loans.name: Silvia

texts.es: Silvia, de 38 años reside en la comunidad nativa de Shankivironi (selva central peruana). Ahí formó su familia junto a Rubén, su esposo desde hace 20 años. Ambos tienen 2 hijos: Oneyda y Nayely, a las que cuidan con mucho amor en su casa propia. Como mujer dedicada y trabajadora, todas las mañanas se dirige a sus terrenos de cultivo, donde tiene 16 cuadras (medida de los terrenos de cultivo) de sembrío de café, cítricos, maíz, kion y fréjol. Ya tiene 20 años de experiencia en el cuidado de los cultivos y según cuenta, solo posee 10 cuadras y el resto lo alquila a terceras personas donde paga una mensualidad. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es poder compartir las responsabilidades junto a su esposo, quien la apoya en el mantenimiento de sus terrenos. Además cada 15 días va a la ciudad de  Pichanaki, donde comercializa sus frutos en el mercado central de la ciudad, obteniendo así mayor ganancias. Ahora comenzó con la cosecha de café, que se realiza una vez al año, donde espera obtener buenas ganancias; ya que comenzó con la recolección plena de los granos maduros. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Los clavelitos de Shankivironi” y este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración para el logro de sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Silvia de obtener su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de abono orgánico para esparcirlos entre sus cultivos; asimismo en el pago del arriendo de su terrenos agrícolas.
texts.en: Silvia is 38 and lives in Shankivironi (in the Peruvian Amazon).  She has been married to Rubén for 20 years and they have two daughters: Oneyda and Nayely, who they care for in their own home.  Silvia works hard farming16 cuadras (a measure of farmland) of coffee, citrus, corn and beans. She has been farming for 20 years; of the land she works only10 cuadras is hers, and she pays rental fees to others for the rest.  She greatly enjoys working the land together with her husband, who helps her. Twice a month Silvia travels to the city of Pichanaki to sell her produce in the central market there.  Currently she is harvesting coffee and expects a good profit this year from the crop's beans.  This is Silvia's fourth credit with the lender “Los clavelitos de Shankivironi” and she is committed to prompt repayment, as she has done in prior loans.  She enjoys the interaction with other members of the lending association, who are helpful and responsible workers.  Silvia will use this credit to buy fertilizer to spread around her crops to increase yield, and will also use part of the loan to pay the land use fees.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay land use fees

loans.name: Kathy Leen

texts.en: Kathy Leen, a 33-year-old married mother of four children, lives in the Philippines where, for the past five years, she has operated a retail shop that sells snacks, beverages and canned goods. A new member of HSPFI, Kathy Leen has  requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy beverages and snacks. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy beverages and snacks.

loans.name: Bosco

texts.en:
30-year-old Bosco sells food at a stall in one of the busiest food markets in Kihihi in Western Uganda. The father of two says he began this business with savings from his coffee sales business. He mostly sells maize flour, bananas and cassava. In the photo, he is shown standing next to the many maize flour bags he owns in his store. His business has been in existence for the two years now. 

On the side, Bosco also operates a commercial motorcycle transportation business commonly known as "Boda Boda". He says he set forth with his own capital. Weekly this business generates sales profit totaling Ugandan shillings 500,000 and he says with this Kiva loan he is going to purchase more foods such as bananas, cassava, yams and beans to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more foods such as bananas, cassava, yams and beans to resell.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David has practiced farming in Olkalou town for the last three years.  He is 27 years old, married to Grace and they have one school-going child.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his third loan.  He paid all his previous loans well and in good time.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy carrot seeds for planting and also to plow the land.

In future, David hopes to become a leading farmer in Olkalou town.

loans.use: To plow the land and buy carrot seeds for planting.

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma has been operating her salon business and selling sodas for the last 14 years in Kenyatta market, Nairobi city. She is 32 years old and married with two children.

She was introduced to KADET by a friend who is also a KADET client. This is her first loan. She intends to use the loan to buy seven crates of sodas and invest the rest in her salon

In the future, Salma hopes to expand her business and open a soda depot.

loans.use: To buy seven crates of sodas and invest the rest in her salon.

loans.name: Ambar Johanna

texts.es:
Ámbar, es comerciante de lociones y cosméticos, vive con su esposo y tiene tres hijos de 5, 8 y 11 años de edad, todos los días se dedica a la venta de cosméticos aparte de eso es empleada de una empresa, donde lleva varios años de estar trabajando.
Actualmente necesita comprar un lote de mercadería como lociones, maquillajes, labiales, sombras, y más productos de belleza, esto le ayudara a mejorar el negocio y el servicio a los clientes.
Ella tiene como objetivo el montar un negocio estable, donde pueda atender a los clientes, que sea capaz de atender la demanda y mejore su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ámbar is a lotions and cosmetics retailer, she lives with her husband and she has three children aged 5, 8 and 11. Everyday she sells cosmetics and aside from this she is also employed by a company where she has worked for several years.

She currently needs to buy a batch of merchandise such as lotions, make-up, lipsticks, eyeshadows and other beauty products. This will help her to improve her business and the service that she provides to her customers.

Her goal is to set up a stable business where she can serve customers, meet demand and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: To buy merchandise: lotions, make-up, lipsticks and eyeshadows

loans.name: Azza

texts.en:
Azza is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.
For the past three years, Azza has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbors and passers-by. Azza faces the major challenge of seasonality and theft in her business. She dreams of expanding her business to a wholesale shop in the future.
With this loan of 20,000 KES, she wants to purchase sacks of sugar and rice for resale. She decided to join Kiva partner, Yehu, to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of sugar and rice for resale.

loans.name: Nazira's Group

texts.en:
Nazira is the leader of this group. She is the resident of Tashkomur – a small mining town in the south of Kyrgyzstan. She is 30 and married to a farmer. Together with her husband she brings up a daughter and two sons. The older son studies at school and the other children are preschool age (under seven). In 2004, with an initial investment of 5000 soms, the family purchased four livestock animals and since that time they have been breeding livestock for making money to support their livelihood. Nazira applied for the loan because she needs money to purchase more livestock for breeding, fattening and further resale. In the future, she wants to improve the family’s living conditions with the profits gained from reselling livestock.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Ibrahem

texts.en:
Ibrahem is a 22-year-old young man. He is a university student and he has a project of computers sales, which is a source of income to help pay his university fees, as his father is a worker with a decent salary.

Ibrahem wants to expand his project and increase his sales by purchasing more computers for sale, but the amount of money he has isn't enough, so he needs to take a loan of $2,000 from FATEN. When he gets the loan, which will be repaid on a monthly basis, he will purchase more computers to increase his sales, which means an increase in his income to enable him to continue his studies and live in better life conditions. 

Ibrahem is photographed in the FATEN branch.

loans.use: To purchase more computers for sale.

loans.name: Reina Esperanza

texts.es: Reina Esperanza vive con sus hijos los cuales todavía asisten a la escuela, ella posee una venta de frutas y verduras en el mercado municipal de donde residen, tiene su puesto en un punto estratégico del mercado es por eso que se ha hecho de mucha clientela, además de que las frutas y verduras que vende son frescas y de muy buena calidad; Reina es una mujer muy trabajadora y le gusta mantenerse adelante de la competencia, para ella todo viaje, por largo que sea empieza por un solo paso, ella quiere emprender su viaje y hacer crecer su negocio, por eso se decidió a dar el paso y solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar naranjas, mandarinas, plátanos, piñas, tomates, cebollas, chiles, papas entre otros. Reina Esperanza tiene la confianza que de esta forma lograra llevar a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en: Reina Esperanza lives with her children who are still going to school.  She sells fruit and vegetables in the municipal market where they live.  She has her stand located in a strategic spot in the market so she has many customers.  Besides, the fruit and vegetables she sells are fresh and of very good quality.  Reina is a very hardworking woman who likes to stay ahead of the competition.  For her, every trip, no matter how long, starts with a single step.  She wants to undertake her trip and make her business grow.  That’s why she decided to take that first step and ask INTEGRAL for a loan that will allow her to buy oranges, mandarins, bananas, pineapples, tomatoes, onions, chilies and potatoes, among others.  Reina Esperanza is confident that she will bring economic security to her home this way.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Henry Ismael

texts.es: El Señor Henry Ismael es un hombre trabajador, luchador con ganas de prosperar y sacar adelante a toda su familia, su negocio es la venta de ropa, desde hace mas de 3 años que tiene este negocio, es un joven con muchas ganas de salir adelante para proporcionarle a su familia lo necesario. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de pantalones, camisas, faldas, trajes, ropa interior, entre otros. Sus principales sueños y metas del es mejorar su seguridad y calidad de vida.
texts.en: Henry Ismael is a hard-working man, striving with dreams of prosperity and success for all of his family. His business is selling clothing, and he’s had this business for more than three years. He’s a young man who really wants to get ahead so that he can give his family what they need. The purpose of the loan is to buy pants, blouses, skirts, suits, underwear, and other things. His main dreams and goals are to improve his security and quality of life.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, skirts, blouses, suits, underwear, etc.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has two children. Marilyn has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for four years. She requested a loan for 16,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages. Marilyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Marilyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Norman

texts.en:
Norman is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with three children. 

Norman has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. He has had this business for eight years. He requested a loan for PHP 9,000 to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Norman has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Norman hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 40 years old and lives in the town of Kijura in the Luweero region of Uganda. He is married and has four children. For the past ten years, Patrick has been working hard to manage his drug shop, which sells different types of medicine to his community. 

To help expand his business, Patrick has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more medicine for resale, and will help Patrick to generate greater profits and buy food to feed his family. Patrick hopes that in the future he will be able to expand his business more. 

Patrick is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Patrick who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more medicine for resale

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Rosalina works hard to support her family. 

She has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling frozen products. Rosalina is borrowing 19,500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy additional ingredients for her restaurant business. 

Rosalina has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional ingredients for her restaurant business

loans.name: Hounkpa-Tin Group

texts.fr: Le groupe HOUNKPA-TIN est formé de trois personnes qui sont toutes des amies. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Houé Victorine, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier d’ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Houé Victorine est mariée à un certain Gilbert. Le couple a six enfants, dont un reste à leur charge. Houé Victorine vit ensemble avec son mari et son enfant encore à sa charge et assure ensemble avec son mari, les diverses charges de la famille. Houé Victorine a arrêté l'école au cours primaire. Depuis une vingtaine d'année, Houé Victorine mène comme activité la vente de poissons de façon ambulante et de l'huile végétale de façon secondaire. Houé Victorine achète ses produits dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête d'une meilleure satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son revenu, Houé Victorine sollicite pour la première fois, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe HOUNKPA-TIN, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
HOUNKPA-TIN Group is made up of three women who are friends. The group's representative, named Houé Victorine, is the one raising her hand in the photograph. This is the first time that the members of the group are seeking financial support from Kiva's partner, ALIDé, in order to bolster their businesses.

Houé Victorine is married to one Gilbert. The couple has six children, out of whom they still have to support one. Houé Victorine lives together with her husband and the one child she still has to support. The couple takes care of the various family expenses together.

Houé Victorine dropped out of elementary school. For about twenty years, she's been selling fish as a traveling saleswoman. As a secondary business, she also sells vegetable oil. She gets her supplies in one of Benin's markets.

Eager to better satisfy her clientele and in order to increase her income, Houé Victorine is seeking a first loan from ALIDé, together with the other members of the group.

loans.use: to buy fish and vegetable oil

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a 37-year-old man. He is married and a father of seven children. They live in Taiz, Yemen. His educational background is Bachelor of Commerce. 

Hassan's main business is a grocery store selling food items, other daily service needs and gas cylinders. He started his business two years ago and it is the only source of income for him and his family. He has attracted more clients and confined people. His business has continued running successfully and is more profitable. 

Due to the current bad situations in Yemen, he has less profit from his enterprise and his customers are decreasing. Hassan took a loan of 100,000 YER from AMB to expand his business by purchasing more grocery items.

In the future, he hopes to expand his business  to purchase another shop and make it a gas cylinder store and also buy a car for transporting his business items.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Joséphine

texts.fr: Joséphine âgée de 37 ans, n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Joséphine est mariée à un dessinateur à un certain Mathieu. Le couple a six enfants, tous scolarisés et cinq à leur charge. Joséphine vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la maison sont supportées par le couple.  Pour cette raison, Joséphine vend de la nourriture à son domicile depuis dix ans. Cette activité lui génère des revenus l'aidant à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Joséphine achète ses produits dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, Joséphine  sollicite pour une septième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Aceheter des condiments; du maïs et de l'huile végétale.

loans.name: Monica Isabel

texts.en:
Monica is 35 years old and lives in the municipality of Sincelejo. She has 2 daughters whom are 11 and 9 years of age and whom are the reason of this woman life, why she goes to work every day so she can provide for them. She has a business since 2010, something she started because she loves to serve to people, so she has a food selling place.

She wants to improve her business by increasing her sales, clients and profits, so she can provide better for her family and can give to her daughters a good quality of life. She’s asking for a loan so she can buy a big showcase and to invest in inventory so she has more to offer.

Monica dreams with improving her house, and the most important thing, with paying for her children education so they become professionals. Help her now to accomplish all her dreams with just a loan.

loans.use: buy a big showcase and to invest in inventory so she has more to offer

loans.name: Sergey

texts.en:
Sergey is married. He makes his living in the small electrical appliance trade. Sergey’s entrepreneurial talent and sociable nature have been a real help as he’s started his own business. Currently he offers a variety of household electric appliances, fans, heaters, blenders, wiring accessories, electrical switches, etc. After becoming a client of “Nadiya Ukraine”, his business has seen considerable growth. Financial assistance from “Nadiya Ukraine” has given Sergey an opportunity to purchase a spacious pavilion where he stores and sells his inventory. Currently Sergey’s net sales profit amounts to 40% which helps create stable expansion for his business. A cheerful disposition and active position in life have helped him succeed in business and find his market niche. Sergey is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase electric devices and a variety of associated components. The favorable location of his business in one of the busy local markets and a wide range of high-quality electric equipment help attract many potential customers. Sergey also has a hobby – he’s a beekeeper. It’s a rewarding hobby for him. Not only do the bees produce honey and beeswax, but they serve as pollinators for crops grown in the local area. He is planning to re-invest profits gained from selling electric devices into his bee farming.

Сергій - одружений. На життя він заробляє торгівлею електричними приладами. Підприємницький талант та жвавість характеру Сергія завжди допомагали йому в бізнесі. В кіоску Сергія можна знайти різноманітні побутові електричні прилади, вентилятори, обігрівачі, змішувачі, електромонтажну арматуру, перемикачі тощо. Після того як Сергій став клієнтом „Надії України”, його бізнес суттєво зріс. Фінансова підтримка надала Сергію можливість придбати просторий павільйон, в якому він зберігає та продає товари. Чистий прибуток Сергія становить 40%, а це дуже позитивно відбивається на зростанні його бізнесу. Життєрадісна вдача та активна позиція допомогли йому досягти успіху в бізнесі та знайти свою нішу на ринку. Сергій просить про позику в 1200 доларів для того, щоб придбати електричні приладі та різні додаткові запчастини. Вигідне розташування його бізнесу на місцевому ринку та широкий вибір високоякісного електричного обладнання обов’язково приваблять потенційних покупців. В Сергія також є хобі – він бджоляр. Це дуже корисне заняття. Бджоли не тільки виробляють мед та віск, але й ще виконують функцію місцевих запильників врожаїв. Отже Сергій планує використати гроші, які отримає від продажу електричних приладів, для того, щоб розводити бджіл.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en:
Sakina is 29 years old. She is maried and has four children. She has 8 years experience in tailoring. She sews clothes for her neigborhood. Sakina wants to get a loan to buy fabric and other required material so she can make different types of clothes and sell them to the bazzar. She is a hard working woman and she wants to expand her business and make her family's life better.

Note: The picture featured in this business profile is Sakina facing away from the camera. In Afghanistan, it is culturally unacceptable to post a picture of a woman on the Internet.

loans.use: Sakina would like to buy more fabric, thread and sewing material for her tailoring business

loans.name: Henri

texts.fr:
Born in 1977 in Tsévié, Mr. H. K. NYAWOLE is married and has two (02) children. Having been unable to continue his studies after the BEPC, he became an excellent tailor, skilled in the mastery of his craft. Due to his efficiency and dynamism, he managed his two previous loans and repaid them without incident.

To better equip his workshop and to maintain and possibly even increase his clientele, he is asking for a loan of $800 to buy fabric and to manufacture ready-to-wear clothing for the market. Thus, he will be able to increase his income to meet the needs of his family.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Né en 1977 à Tsévié, Monsieur NYAWOLE K. H. est marié et père de deux (02) enfants. Ne pouvant plus continuer les études après son BEPC, il devient un excellent tailleur et apprécié dans la maîtrise de métier. Par son efficacité et son dynamisme, il a su gérer les deux premiers crédits qu’il a parfaitement remboursés.

Pour mieux équiper son atelier, maintenir sa clientèle et même l’augmenter, il sollicite un crédit de $800 pour l’achat des tissus et confectionner les habits prêt-à-porter pour la commercialisation. Ainsi, il pourra augmenter ses revenus pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy fabric and to manufacture ready-to-wear clothing for the market

loans.name: Ibodat

texts.ru:
Ibodat R. is 51, is married and has 3 children. She has a high-school education. For the past few years her husband has been working in Russia to earn some money for the family. Her children are all grown up and have families of their own. She has been selling men's clothing for the past 14 years. Her startup capital was $60. Back then she sold men's underwear. Gradually she was able to increase the selection of goods she sold. When she became a client of MicroInvest, back in 2003, her assets amounted to $200. She borrowed $70. Borrowing allowed her to increase her turnover by $500. She was able to add men's sports wear to her selection. She is planing to open another sales point.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer.

Рахматова Ибодат – 51лет. Замужем, имеет 3детей. Образование среднее специальное. Муж уже несколько лет в России на заработках, дети взрослые и каждый имеет свою отдельную семью. Она занимается реализацией мужской одежды, уже 14лет. Начала свою деятельность с 60$, тогда она продавала мужское нижнее бельё. Постепенно она увеличила товар. Когда стала клиентом «Микроинвест» в 2003 году её активы составляли 200$, она получила займ в размере 70$. После получения неоднократного займа она увеличила товарооборот на 500$, добавила в свой ассортимент мужские спортивные одежды. В будущем планирует открыть еще одну торговую точку.

loans.use: to open another shop

loans.name: Jahid

texts.en: Jahid K. lives in the Ashigli village of Beylagan, in south-western Azerbaijan. He is 40 years old, married and has 3 children. He works in cattle-breeding. He wants to expand his business and buy sheep. He needs $900 to buy 10 sheep.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Jalil

texts.en: Jalil A. lives in Beylagan, a small city in south western Azerbaijan. He is 53 years old, married and has four children. Jalil owns a small kiosk where he sells spare parts. He started his business five years ago. Jalil wants to built a new store, therefore he needs a loan in amount of $800.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Lotoi

texts.en: Lotoi is a widowed mother of 66 years of age. She is overage to get any loan from the program but she is fit and healthy plus she received help from her two sons. She is applying for a second loan just to extend and to help out with her family remittances.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her plantation

loans.name: Floripe

texts.es:
Mrs. Floripe belongs to the communal bank Nuevo Edén, located at 7 Jr. Dos de Mayo MZ A Lt, in the district of Yarina Cocha, in the neighborhood of Ucayali. She is 38 years old and the mother of 4 children. All of her children are minors. Her husband works as a mechanic. Her last loan was for 300 Peruvian Soles from Manuela Ramos. She has decided to invest in a sort of table that she could display and sell her products from. The products that she sells are candies and snack food.

Right now she works full-time selling candy and snack food. Everyday she wakes up at 6:00 am to make breakfast for all 4 of her children and for her husband. And after that she goes to the market to purchase the supplies that she needs. In the afternoon she starts selling her merchandise on her sidewalk outside of her house.

With the loan of 1,500 Peruvian Soles, which will be repaid back in 5 months, she will buy 1 package of cigarettes 1 package of candies, 1 package of gum, 1 package of cookies, 1 package of chocolate, and some other items that she can sell.

Floripe is very happy because she is economically independent now and she doesn’t have be asking her husband for money because she has enough money to buy what she needs and she can help support her family.

Translated from Spanish by Gabe of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteer

La señora Floripe pertenece al banco comunal Nuevo Edén, ubicado en el Jr. Dos de Mayo Mz A Lt 7, distrito de Yarina Cocha, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 38 años, es madre de 4 hijos, todos menores de edad, es casada y su esposo es mecánico. Con el primer préstamo de S/. 300 que recibió de Manuela Ramos decide invertir en un pequeño tablero para la venta de diversas golosinas.

En la actualidad se dedica a la venta de diversas golosinas. A diario se levanta a las 6 a.m. para hacer el desayuno de sus hijos y el de su esposo, luego va al mercado a comprar sus productos que le faltan y en las tardes sale a vender sus golosinas en la vereda de su casa.

Con el préstamo de S/. 1,500, el cual pagará en 5 meses, invertirá en la compra de 1 paquete de cigarros, 1 paquete de caramelos, 1 paquete de chicles, 1 paquete de galletas, 1 paquetes de chocolates, etc.

Floripe se siente muy bien porque es independiente económicamente ya que no tiene que estar pidiendo a su esposo para comprar algunas cosas que ella necesita y puede apoyar a su familia.

loans.use: Purchases desserts and cookies.

loans.name: Adjo Odette

texts.fr:
Mrs. A. Adjo Odette was born in Lome on April 17, 1963 and lives in the Adobou-Komé district. Born handicapped, she is unmarried and takes care of two people. She makes and sells dolls to tourists in the large market of Lomé. In addition, she sells ice water and "pure water". Due to a lack of funds, she is requesting a loan of $300 in order to increase her production and satisfy her customers.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Translator

Madame A. Adjo Odette est née à Lomé le 17 Avril 1963 et réside au quartier Adobou-Komé. Née handicapée, elle est célibataire et a à sa charge 2 personnes. Ses activités sont axées sur la confection et la vente des poupées aux touristes au grand marché de Lomé. En plus elle associe à cette tâche la vente d’eau glacée et de « pure water », Par manque de fonds, elle sollicite un prêt de $300 en vue d’augmenter sa production afin de satisfaire sa clientèle.

loans.use: Purchase of materials to manufacture dolls

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es:
Eduardo is a 29 year old entrepreneurial man who got married at a very young age and had to shorten his education. With the educational level that he had he was not able to find good work that would compensate him with an adequate salary to cover necessities. It was at this time that he received an opportunity and began to work in a veterinary clinic. Thanks to his discipline, he learned the skill of cutting the hair of different breeds of dogs. He decided later to quit this job and start his own business. With effort he was able to buy the tools needed for his business.

As a result of good customer service and a low price for his quality service, he was able to increase his list of clients. Now he has included the sale of fish to his canine grooming business.

He needs a loan of US$475 that he will pay back over the course of 6 months. With this loan he will acquire a large batch of fish in order to reduce the cost, and will better supply the store with dog accessories. Let's support Eduardo so that he can reach his goal.

Translated from Spanish by Katrina, Kiva volunteer.

El Sr. Eduardo es un hombre emprendedor de 29 años, se caso muy joven y tuvo que truncar sus estudios, con el nivel que tenía no encontraba un buen trabajo que le otorgara un sueldo que pudiera cubrir sus necesidades, fue entonces que recibió una oportunidad y empezó a trabajar en una veterinaria gracias a su disciplina aprendió el oficio de cortes de cabello de las diferentes razas de mascotas, hasta que decidió renunciar y poner su propio negocio, con esfuerzo logro comprar las herramientas y utensilios necesarios para su negocio. Debido al buen trato a sus clientes y un precio bajo por un servicio de calidad, fue que logro aumentar su cartera de clientes, ahora ha incluido en la estética canina la venta de peces,

Actualmente necesita un crédito por US $475 que pagara en 6 meses para adquirir un lote grande de peces para disminuir el costo, además de surtir mejor la tienda con accesorios para mascotas. Apoyemos a Eduardo para que alcance su meta.

loans.use:
Buy merchandise

Comprar mercancia

loans.name: Maîmouna

texts.fr:
Maîmouna D. is an experienced seamstress. Her clientele is composed essentially of women. She is asking for this loan to use for purchasing cloth and a few necessities for sewing.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Maîmouna D. est une couturière experimentee ; elle a une clientele composee essentiellement de femmes ; elle sollicite un crédit pour acheter des tissus et un peu de mercerie.

loans.use:
purchase of cloth and various sewing supplies to develop her business

achat de tissus et fournitures diverses pour developper ses activites

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To start a small business of selling fresh meat.

loans.name: Lucía

texts.es:
Lucia has a business selling cold drinks in a busy area where many people of her community pass by. She began this business a short time ago, because she wanted to help her dear son achieve his dreams. With the great demand from her customers, she would like to invest in her business and offer a greater variety of beverages, generating more income and growing her business.

Lucía, se dedica a la venta de bebidas heladas en una zona muy concurrida y visitada por los miembros de su comunidad, su incursión en este rubro comercial se dio hace poco tiempo debido al deseo de contribuir con el cumplimiento de los sueños de su amado hijo.Debido a la gran demanda a decidido incrementar su capital de trabajo a fin de ofertar más y mayor variedad de bebidas a sus clientes.

loans.use: TO INVEST IN HER SMALL BUSINESS AND OFFER MORE COLD BEVERAGES TO HER CUSTOMERS, GROW HER BUSINESS AND HELP HER SON.

loans.name: Habijan's Group

texts.en:
Habijan baji is the wife of B. A. and lives in the city of Kot Radha Kishan, Pakistan. She has lived in a two-room brick house for the last 35 years, and is the mother of four children: two sons and two daughters. Her husband is a land contractor (he rents land and farms it). He has worked in this area for the last 25 years. Habijan has successfully repaid three loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan) and is now applying for a loan to rent land for her husband.

She is applying for this loan with several other people. Sugran baji wants a loan to rent land. Bashiran baji wants a loan to buy wood for her furniture business. Sugran baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo to resell. Parveen baji wants a loan to buy inventory for her grocery store.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Jessica Yeniz

texts.es:
Jessica is a member of the communal bank “Amor Divino”.

Jessica is single and 29 years old. She studies communications sciences and, along with her mother, sells clothes and shoes which they offer to friends and family on credit. Jessica sells to her friends and schoolmates at the university, while her mother sells to her workmates. Her products are purchased in the city of Lima, which they visit on a monthly basis. In addition, Jessica works as an administrative assistant at the Magdalena parish.

Jessica needs a loan of 1,500 soles, funds that will be invested into the purchase of blouses, sweaters and pants.

Jessica’s dreams include wanting a stable business for her mother, having a store of her own, and getting her professional title.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva volunteer.

Jessica es socia del Banco Comunal Amor Divino.

Jessica es soltera y tiene 29 años, Jessica estudia ciencias de la comunicación, Jessica junto a su mama, venden ropa, calzados que ofrece a amigos, familiares, sus ventas son al crédito. Jessica vende a sus amigos, compañeras de universidad, mientras que su mama lo ofrece a sus compañeras de trabajo, sus productos son adquiridos en la ciudad de Lima a donde viajan mensualmente. Además Jessica trabaja como personal administrativo en la parroquia de la Magdalena.

Jessica necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de blusas, chompas, pantalones.

Los sueños de Jessica son que su mamá tenga un negocio estable, tener una tienda y sacar su titulo profesional.

loans.use: Jessica needs a loan of 1,500 soles, funds that will be invested into the purchase of blouses, sweaters and pants.

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es: En una comunidad de la ciudad de Puno, llamada, Pirullo, tiene su vivienda Felipa de 33 años de edad, es madre de 2 pequeños niños, quienes  se  han convertido en su motor de vida; desde que formó su familia, hace más de 12 años, se dedicó  a la crianza y alimentación de terneros y cerdos, luego de que sus animales tiene un peso y tamaño adecuado, los vende, con los beneficios económicos que  obtiene, incrementa el dinero que su esposo Melecio, como profesor  lleva a su hogar, así cubren juntos, los gastos de su familia.Estos padres, tienen pensado comprar dos terneros, que en adelante, con cuidado y alimentación, les provean de leche, y así, poco a poco  dedicarse a la elaboración de deliciosos  quesos.Con ese propósito, Felipa, solicita este préstamo.
texts.en:
In a neighborhood of Puno city, called Pirullo, lives 33 year old Felipa, mother of 2 small children who are the driving force of her life. Ever since she had her family, for more than 12 years, she has dedicated herself to raising and feeding calves and pigs. Then, when her animals are of an adequate weight and size, she sells them, and the income she receives compliments the money that her husband Melecio earns as a teacher. Together they cover their family's expenses. These parents are planning to buy two calves, that in the future, with care and feeding, will provide milk, and in this way, little by little they can begin making delicious cheese. With this proposition, Felipa is asking for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy two calves to feed and care for, to produce milk and cheese

loans.name: Muth

texts.en: Mrs. Muth S. is a villager in Preak Thom Village in Kandal Province. She is a 58-year-old widow with seven children; two are employed in a garment factory while four others are employed in different businesses and the youngest one is attending the local school. She is a fruit seller in the local market. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it so she decided to ask for a loan to buy different kinds of fruit to resell.

loans.use: Muth would like to buy different kinds of fruit to re-sell.

loans.name: Sandra Alberto

texts.pt:
Sandra Alberto M. é natural de cidade de Maputo e tem 31 anos de idade, casada maritalmente e mae de 3 filhos com idades entre 11, 4 e 6 meses respectivamente. Sandra estudou até 7ªclasse e não continuou por falta de condições financeiras da sua família.

Sandra trabalha como servente num acampamento turístico na ponta de ouro, uma zona turística ao sul de Moçambique que faz fronteira com africa do sul. Ela entra as 7:00 e despega as 15:30h, com um salário mensal de 2368,00mt. Nos tempos livres dedica se a vende de refrigerantes onde tem um rendimento médio mensal de 4000,00mt.

Para Sandra este é o quarto empréstimo na Hluvuku e primeiro no Kiva, conheceu a Hluvuku através do marido também informado pelos amigos. Assim com este empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção para edificar a sua residência e o plano futuro é oficializar o seu casamento.
texts.en:
Sandra Alberto M. is from Maputo, married and the mother of 3 children, aged 11, 4 and 6 months. Sandra was in school until the 7th grade and didn’t continue with her studies due to her family’s financial difficulties.

Sandra works as a servant in a tourist camping site in Ponta de Ouro, a tourist region in Southern Mozambique which shares a border with South Africa. She starts at 7:00 and finishes at 15:30, with a monthly salary of 2368,00 MZN. In her free time she sells sodas from which she makes around 4000,00 MZN a month.

This is Sandra’s fourth loan with Hluvuku and her first with Kiva. She heard about Hluvuku from her husband who in turn heard about it from friends. With this loan she intends to buy construction material to build her house and her plan for the future is to officialize her marriage.


Translated from Portuguese by Ines Teles, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials

loans.name: Celina

texts.en:
Celina M. is married and the mother of two children. She is a 42-year-old trader, who has been selling women's slippers, shoes, and dressing bags for the past fifteen years. Celina's working capital was provided by family members and friends, but it is not adequate for her business needs. As a result, she can't purchase high quantity or quality products.

She believes that a loan will provide her with the resources needed to purchase good quality products for her customers. She wants to use the loan to buy more women's slippers, shoes, and dressing bags. She belongs to the community group called ‘Mount Calvary Trust Group’. In this group, members serve as guarantees for one another to access loans and exert peer pressure to repay loans.

loans.use: Buy additional stock of ladies accessories

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of fuel at wholesale.

loans.name: Lola

texts.en: Lola B. is 44 years old and married with 2 children. She lives in Ibadan, Nigeria. She sells wine. She started this business in 2000. She needs the loan amount of N40,000 to purchase more wine to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more wine to sell

loans.name: Navuth

texts.en:
Mrs. Navuth M., 42, and her husband, Mr. Heng Hai, 41, who live along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penn, the capital city of Cambodia, married in 1989 and have four children: three sons and one daughter. Three of their children are in school, and the eldest daughter does farming.

Navuth has been selling vegetables for one year and has been selling fruit and farming since she was married. She sells guavas and mangoes. Her husband is a chef. He sometimes cooks for wedding ceremonies and other ceremonies in his village and in Phnom Penh. Navuth is requesting her first loan of US$ 1,000 to purchase mangoes on contract for re-sale.

loans.use: To purchase mangoes on contract for re-sale

loans.name: 10- Quảng Hưng Group

texts.vi:
* Thôn 1 xã Quảng Hưng là một thôn nghèo của tỉnh Thanh Hóa. Người dân ở đây sống chủ yếu bằng nghề nông và buôn bán nhỏ.Chị T. Thị Tráng là nhóm trưởng nhóm số 10,gồm 5 thành viên.Chị sinh được 3 người con, con trai đầu nghỉ học sớm để đi làm thợ xây phụ giúp gia đình, còn 2 con gái đang đi học.Chồng chị năm nay 49 tuổi,sức khỏe không được tốt cũng phải đi làm thợ xây để đỡ đần cho chị. Chị vay 2.442.600 đồng (~140 USD) để mua hoa quả bán rong. Đây là vốn thứ 3 của chị. Các vốn trước chị cũng đầu tư vào việc bán hoa quả và chị đã hoàn trả đầy đủ và đúng hạn .Hàng ngày chị lên thành phố mua trái cây như: cam, quýt, táo,xoài ,lê để đi bán,thời gian nào trái cây bán chậm chị lại chuyển sang bán rau, mong kiếm đồng lời để trang trải chi phí sinh hoạt trong gia đình và nuôi 2 con ăn học. Các thành viên khác trong nhóm cũng có cùng mức vay:
* Chị N. Thị Hà vay vốn để mua rau bán.
* Chị N. Thị Thơi vay vốn để đầu tư vào cửa hàng bán giải khát.
* Chị N. Thị Huệ vay vốn để mua rau bán.
* Chị
texts.en:
Village 1, Quang Hung Commune is one of the poor communes in Thanh Hoa province. The inhabitants make a living mainly by farming and petty trades. Mrs. Tran Thi Trang is the group leader of Group 10 consisting of 5 members. She has 3 children. The eldest son had to leave school early to work as a construction worker to support the family. The two daughters are going to school. Her husband is 49 years old. He is in a weak health condition but still works as construction worker to support the family. She wishes to borrow VND2,442,600 (about USD140) to buy fruits to resell. This is her third loan. The previous loans, invested in buying and reselling fruits, were fully paid on time. Everyday, she goes to the city to buy fruits such as oranges, mandarins, apples, mango, pears to resell. In the seasons not good for fruit sales, she switches to sell vegetables to earn some money to pay for living costs of the family and send her children to school. Other members of the group also request for the same amount of loan, as below:

Mrs. Nguyen Thi Ha borrows to buy vegetables to resell

Mrs. Nguyen Thi Thoi borrows to invest in a beverage and soft drink shop

Mrs. Nguyen Thi Hue borrows to buy vegetables to resell

Mrs. Doi Thi Chien borrows to buy fishes and prawns to resell.

Translated from Vietnamese by Tu Duong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy fruits, vegetables, foods to resell

loans.name: Amor De Dios Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad de El Alto se encuentra ubicado el centro focal Cascada, a éste pertenece la asociación Amor de Dios, grupo muy alegre, simpático y unido sobre todo.
La asociación Amor de Dios tiene diferentes actividades por ejemplo Felicidad tiene un puesto de dulces y otras golosinas, además también  venden frutas de la temporada, otras de ellas se dedican a la elaboración y venta de comida. Afirman que necesitan mayor capital para abastecerse de mayores productos con el fin de ampliar sus ventas, de esta manera generar mayores ingresos que apoyen a la economía de sus hogares.
texts.en:
The Amor de Dios association is from Cascada in the city of El Alto. It’s a group that is very happy, friendly and, above all, united.

The Amor de Dios association has different types of work. For example, Felicidad has a candy stall and also sells seasonal fruit. Others work in the production of food. They need capital to stock up on more products in order to increase their sales. In this way, they can generate more income for their homes.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a better quantity of products

loans.name: Zebiniso

texts.ru: Зебинисо - женщина 40 лет. Замужем и мать 5-х детей. Занимается откормом скота и переработкой молока и молочных изделий. Муж - пастух. Каждое утро гонит скот на горы и поздно вечером возвращается. Раз в месяц возит свой скот на рынок. Старшему сыну 21 год. Он помогает отцу. Дочери помогают по хозяйству дома. Зебинисо каждое утро и каждый вечер доит молоко. Часть они употребляют для семьи, а часть продают. За последний кредит Зебинисо приобрела еще одну корову.
texts.en:
Zebiniso is a 40 year old woman. She is married and is the mother of 5 children. She fattens livestock and processes milk and dairy products. Her husband is a shepherd. Every morning he takes the livestock to the mountains and returns late at night. Once a month he takes his livestock to the market. Their eldest son is 21 years old. He helps his father. The daughters help around the house. Zebiniso milks the cows every morning and every evening. Part of the milk is used by the family and part of the milk is sold. Zebiniso used her last loan to buy one more cow.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Abdullo

texts.ru:
Абдулло Умаров занимается животноводческой деятельностью около 8 лет. Проживает он Шахристанском районе с женой Дилором и детьми.Родился Абдулло в 1979 году.
  Ему нужен займ в размере 1600 сомони для откорма скота, с последствием его продажи.
  Дополнительный семейный доход Абдулло приносит переработка молока и его деятельность в сельском хозяйстве.
texts.en:
Abdullo U. has raised livestock for nearly eight years. He lives in the Shahristan district with his wife Dilor and their children. Abdullo was born in 1979. He needs a loan in the amount of 1600 somoni for fattening cattle, which he will then sell. To bring in additional family income, Abdullo processes dairy products and works in agriculture.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising cattle

loans.name: Mapatano Group

texts.en:
Amda has been a firewood and juice seller in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for five years. She belongs to the Mapatano group (code 2070). She currently earns an average monthly profit of approximately $90. Every day she works for eight hours.

She is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania so she can buy firewood for resale and fruits and sugar for juice. Amda is hoping that through this loan, she will be able to grow her business and save money for future use.

Amda is 45 years old, married, and has six children: ages 25, 20, 15, 12, 10 and five. Amda will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Arafa. who has her own small business selling juice and fish in Zanzibar.

loans.use: Buy more firewood, fruits and sugar.

loans.name: Maruf

texts.en:
K. Maruf is 30 years old. He is married with two children. Maruf sells cattle. As a rule he purchases small cattle in the central market, feeds them and resells them at higher prices.

Being in this business for many years he knows how to choose the animals, how to breed them and look after them. Thus, he gets up every morning to feed the animals and look after them. His knowledge and skills allow him to make his business successful and he generates a stable income for his family.

Maruf has a large and friendly family who always try to help each other. Maruf is planning to enlarge his stock and purchase more cattle.

With this purpose he requests $700. You could become an important part in Maruf family's life. He deeply appreciates the trust and support you are giving him.

---------------------------------------- More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchase cattle to expand his business.

loans.name: Joseph Tsetse

texts.en:
Joseph Tsetse A. sells cosmetics and trinkets at Kormantse near Cape Coast. Joseph Tsetse has received tertiary education. He is married and has four dependents and his wife is also a trader.

Joseph Tsetse has been selling cosmetics and jewelry since 1987. He is responsible for taking care of the family's financial needs and the children's education as well. His loan will be used to buy more cosmetics and trinkets to sell. He hopes to use the new profits from his business to expand the business and to create employment for the needy.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics and trinkets to sell

loans.name: Nadira's Group

texts.en: This group is led by Nadira, a married woman and mother of two daughters. She works in a factory, in the city of Kara Balta. Apart from the fact that she keeps cows and sells milk, she purchases cattle, fattens them up and resells them at the cattle market. Eight years ago her relatives gave her a calf as a present on her wedding anniversary. Then she invested 120 dollars in raising it. Now she makes around 150 dollars every month. “I like what I do now, because it makes me independent and self-sufficient. Besides, I get great support and help from my husband and both of my daughters,” says Nadira. Now she needs a loan to purchase a cow to increase the amount of milk she has for sale. In future, she hopes to increase her livestock population and have five cows for milking. Nadira’s partners are Izzatillo, Ajzada and Nazgul. Izzatillo is a teacher at a boarding school in Kara Balta city. A year ago he started selling consumer goods and some fruit like apples and lemons wholesale and retail. He has already bought a car for goods transportation. He needs a loan to purchase more fruit to wholesale and to start reselling new kinds of fruit: bananas, oranges and dried fruits. Ajzada is thirty-six and works at a construction site as a general worker. As well, she sells milk, raises sheep and resells them at the Kara Balta cattle market. She wants to sell more milk; therefore she needs a loan to purchase a cow. Her dream is to buy a car and own a flat in the capital and she is determined to reach these goals. Nazgul is just twenty-two. Nevertheless, she is married and has two kids. She works in “Bakai” factory doing odd jobs. Some months ago she drew up a contract with a mobile company and opened a shop for a cellphone recharging. She wants to buy a heifer for raising and obtaining milk, so she is in need of a loan. She intends to save money, buy a house and raise cattle. ====================================== --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase a cow to increase the amount of milk she has for sale

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
La Sra. Marina P. tiene 27 años, está casada con el Sr. Luis Cabrera Flores, llevan tres años de casados. Tienen un bebe de 1 año de edad. Viven en una zona que se dedica a la produccion de leche.

La Sra. Marina lleva trabajando con ganado lechero 10 años, entrega todo lo que produce a una microempresa local que elabora productos lácteos para la venta en un mercado de la ciudad de Cbba. Empezó trabajando con su madre y poco a poco fue comprando su propio ganado para independizarse. 

Necesita del préstamo para poder comprar alimento de ganado debido a que debe almacenar para todo el año. Esto repercutirá en su producción ya que no tendrá escases de alimento y producirá mas leche para generar más ingresos. 
En un futuro desea comprar más vacas lecheras e incrementar sus ingresos para poder mejorar su casa y darle a su bebe una mejor condición de vida.
texts.en:
Señora Marina P. is 27 years old. She is married with Señor Luis Cabrera Flores. They have been married for three years and have a baby who is 1-year-old. They live in a zone that is dedicated to the production of milk. Señora Marina has been working raising dairy cattle for 10 years. She delivers everything that she produces to a local micro-business that makes dairy products for sale in a market in the city of Cochabamba. She began working with her mother and little by little began buying her own cattle to become independent. She needs the loan to be able to buy food for her cattle in order to store enough for all the year. This will impact her production since she will not have a scarcity of food and will produce more milk to generate more income. In the future she hopes to buy more dairy cows and to increase her income to be able to improve her house and to give her baby better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy feed for raising dairy cattle

loans.name: Horn

texts.en:
Mr. Horn S. was born in 1968 and he now lives in Thorm Nei village in Takeo province. He is a construction worker.

His wife, Mrs. Y Sarvoeun, is a farmer who owns a piece of land on which she cultivates rice. Aside from this plantation, she is a water lily seller in the local market. His wife is shown with him in the photo. The couple has five children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the others are enrolled in the local school.

Now Mr. Horn S. is applying a loan to buy a buffalo for breeding and to plow the field.

loans.use: To buy a buffalo for breeding and to plow the field

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: achat de ciment pour la construction

loans.name: Winfrida

texts.en:
Winfrida is a member of the Gangilonga borrower group in Kinyanambo, Iringa. She is married and a mother of 1 child. Her child is 1 year old. 

Winfrida has owned a shop business for 3 years, she works 4 hours a day and she earns a monthly profit approximately 100,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Winfrida`s first loan form BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more shop commodities.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Winfrida hopes to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more shop commodities

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: effectur du labour

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy N. is from the city of Pagadian City. She is 42 years old, is married, and has four school-aged children. Mercy owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month. Mercy joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2,000 PHP from PMPC. Mercy is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase pig feed and other supplies. This loan will be her 2nd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed and other supplies

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana is divorced with one adult son. She sells children's clothing at a downtown market in the city of Zaporozhye. Tatyana has been in this business for 10 years, and in this time has been able to develop her business well. She has two business locations, a large assortment of inventory and many repeat clients. Her income is about 4,000 UAH per month.
 
Tatyana would like to borrow 11,300 UAH to purchase winter inventory. Tatyana loves her job and does it well. She hopes to develop her business further and increase her volume of customers even more.

loans.use: To purchase winter inventory

loans.name: Angéline Thérèse Afiavi

texts.fr: A. Angéline Thérèse Afiavi est née le 02 Octobre 1964 à Allada, dans le département de l'Atlantique. Angéline Thérèse Afiavi réside à Ahito à Allada depuis près de 46 ans. Mariée à HOUNKPONOU Richard, Angéline Thérèse Afiavi est mère de sept enfants, tous scolarisés, dont cinq sont à sa charge. Angéline Thérèse Afiavi vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Angéline Thérèse Afiavi a fait seulement le cours primaire. Depuis près de 30 ans, Angéline Thérèse Afiavi vend de la nourriture (riz, pâte de maïs, pâte faite à base de cossette d'igname, accompagnés de sauce). Angéline Thérèse Afiavi mène comme activité secondaire, la vente de boissons à Allada. C'est à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin que Angéline Thérèse Afiavi s'approvisionne. C'est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui rembourse bien ses crédits. En vue d'accroître le volume de ses produits et de mieux satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Angéline Thérèse Afiavi sollicite un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
A. Angéline Thérèse Afiavi was born on October 2, 1964 in Allada, in Atlantique county. She has been residing in Ahito, in Allada, for nearly 46 years. Married to HOUNKPONOU Richard, she is the mother of seven children who are all in school. Five of them are in her care. She lives together with her children and husband. The couple provides for the family jointly. Angéline Thérèse Afiavi has gone to primary school only. For nearly thirty years, she has been selling food (rice, mash made from cormeal, and mash made from yam chips , all served with a sauce). She runs a secondary business selling drinks in Allada. She stocks up in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She is a previous ALIDé client who repays her loans. With the aim of increasing the volume of her goods and to satisfy customer demand further, she’s requesting a fourth loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of yam chips, corn, and rice

loans.name: Matilde De Los Dolores

texts.es:
En el BANCO COMUNAL Colon de la ciudad de Portoviejo, nos encontramos con este banco muy unido, y tuvimos la oportunidad que la señora Matilde nos cuente algo de su vida, en sus miradas pudimos ver la tristeza que le embarga por la pérdida de su esposo que hace seis meses falleció, junto a el tenia trabajaban en su propio negocio como es la venta de comida rápida.

Matilde tiene 63 años, con su esposo procrearon 6 hijos, ahora ellos son su fuerza en estos momentos de dolor, nos cuenta Matilde que lleva 15 años en la ardua labor de preparar comida rápida, no tuvo la necesidad de salir de casa para poder hacerlo, cuando estaba en vida su esposo le arreglo la parte frontal de la casa para poder improvisar  su negocio, empezaron con un horno a carbón y unas cuantas mesas y sillas , de jueves a domingo desde las 5 de la tarde hasta las 8 de la noche atiende a su clientela junto a su hija, es ella la que la acompaña ahora en casa.

Matilde con el préstamo que recibirá invertirá en su negocio, va a surtirlo de colas, cervezas y carnes, para esta manabita no ha sido nada fácil mantener este negocio, ha pensado en cambiar de trabajo puesto que en los actuales momentos está un poco delicada de salud el doctor le aconseja que deje esta venta porque le humo le esta causando problemas en su garganta, pero ella no va a dejar de trabajar ya esta pensando en dedicarse hacer empanadas, morcillas y platos típicos.
texts.en:
In the communal bank Colon in Portoviejo, we found this very united group and we had the opportunity to talk with Matilde who told us a bit about her life. In her eyes we could see the sadness left by the loss of her husband who passed away 6 months ago. Together they had worked in their own fast food restaurant.

Matilde is 63 years old and with her husband, had 6 children. Right now they are her strength in this moment of sadness. Matilde told us that she had been making fast food for 15 years and she didn’t have to leave the house to do it. When her husband was alive, he fixed the front of their house so she could sell food from it. They started with a charcol grill and a few tables and chairs, from Thursday to Sunday, 5 in the afternoon until 8 in the evening attending to customers together with her daughther. Her daughter is still accompanying her in the house.

With the loan that Matilde is going to receive, she is going to invest in her business. She is going to stock up on sodas, beers and beef. It hasn’t been easy to maintain this business. She had thought of changing her business because there were times when her health was delicate and the doctor advised her to leave this business because the smoke was causing problems with her throat. Still, she is not going to leave this work and is thinking to start making empanadas, mocillas and typical dishes.

Translated from Spanish by karl baumgarten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock up on sodas, beers and beef

loans.name: Walter Enrique

texts.es:
En el municipio de Somotillo, el señor Walter R. con gran esfuerzo se dedica a trabajar arduamente con el fin de llevar el sustento a su casa de habitación que mucho requiere de él. Está en el deber de mantener a sus tres hijos y brindarles los estudios y las condiciones necesarias para vivir en su vivienda.

Una dificultad que atraviesa actualmente es que requiere mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda porque se ha visto afectada y es por esta razón que ha decidido iniciar a reconstruir dicha vivienda para brindarle mejores condiciones a sus hijos. Solicita el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de los materiales de construcción y de esta manera llegar a cumplir sus sueños de tener una vivienda digna donde sus hijos se puedan desarrollar.
texts.en:
In the municipality of Somotillo, Mr. Walter R. - with great effort - works hard with the goal of supporting his family and his household. He supports his three children, providing them with an education and what they need at home. Mr. R. is having great difficulty currently - his home is in need of repairs. He has decided he would like to make improvements to his home in order to provide better living conditions for his children. He is requesting this loan to buy the construction materials he needs so that he can have a decent home in which his children will thrive.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying construction materials

loans.name: Siane

texts.en:
Siane G. is 50 and married with no children.  She owns a business venture, selling pancakes (fried flour pancakes flavored with lemon or coconut jam).  Siane has 5 years of experience in this business.  Siane needs a loan of WST $1500 to buy flour, flavoring, sugar, and plastic bags.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 120 tala or US $50 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2008, Siane joined SPBD.  This is her 2nd loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Siane's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Siane G. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.5 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1.2 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1.23 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              2 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to buy flour, flavoring, sugar, and plastic bags

loans.name: Edmund's Group

texts.en:
Edmund G., from the village of Sto. Niño, Tumauini, Isabela, is the 36-year-old group leader of a four-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Edmund G..

Married with two school-aged children, Edmund owns and operates a specialized retail store whose main income comes from selling rice in the local community. Edmund has been engaged in his business for over a year and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, he joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Edmund is now requesting a loan of 4000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell, and he plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his store.

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our field partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es:
La Señora Martha Lorena A. se dedica  a la venta de cosméticos en el Mercado la estación de León. Todos los días inicia abriendo el negocio a las 6:00 de la mañana  es una mujer muy trabajadora, ejemplar ya que  es el sustento de su familia.
Solicita el crédito en Ceprodel para la compra de cosméticos tales como: shampo, jabón, pinturas de uña, colonias, cremas entre otros.
texts.en:
Martha Lorena A. sells cosmetics in León's La Estacion market. She starts her workday every day at 6am; she is a very hard-working woman, exemplary since she is her family's only source of support. She is asking for funding to buy cosmetics such as: shampoo, soap, nail polish, colognes, creams, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more exercise books, ink for the printing machine and other stationery supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of spare parts

loans.name: Lauriana's Group

texts.en:
Lauriana R. is from the village of Rang-Ayan, Roxas, Isabela. She is 43 years old. Lauriana is the group leader of a 12-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Lauriana R.' Group.

Lauriana is married and has three school-aged children. Lauriana owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Lauriana has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2009, Lauriana joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid her last loan from ASKI, which was for 11,000 PHP and which was used purchase additional products to sell.

Lauriana is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to to expand the business. This loan will be her fourth from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand it.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah is 46 years old and married with 5 children aged between 25 years to 13 years old. Two of the children are attending school. She is a farmer in Kapomboi location in Kitale town. She has been in the business for over 25 years and sells her milk to the local milk vendors. She also earns some income from her posho mill.

She has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. Annah is happy that from the dairy farming her family's health will improve and she will be able to educate her 2 children still in school. She is also requesting Juhudi to diversify its loan products to range from dairy farming to maize farming.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Olga

texts.es: LA SRA. OLGA TIENE UNA TIENDA DE BARRIO DONDE VENDE VARIEDAD DE PRODUCTOS ENTRE ELLOS PAN ,REFRESCOS, GALLETAS , ABARROTES Y OTROS. ESTA CASADA, SU ESPOSO TIENE UN CAMIONETA PRESTA SERVICIOS HACIENO FLETES DEL TRANSPORTE DE MERCADERIA, TIENE UNA HIJA MENOR QUE TIENE 12 AÑOS QUE SE ENCUENTRA EN EDAD ESCOLAR. SU TIENDITA ESTA UBICADO EN BUEN LUGAR EN LA AV. BARRIENTOS EN EL CENTRO DE LA CIUDAD DE COCHABAMBA. EL CREDITO QUE SOLICITA A EMPRENDER ES PARA PODER SURTIR MAS SU TIENDITA YA QUE LE FALTA MAS PRODUCTOS. LA SRA. OLGA ES MUY TRABAJADORA Y MUY RESPONSABLE CON ESTA ACTIVIDAD AYUDA EN LOS GASTOS DEL HOGAR A SU ESPOSO, SU DESEO DE LA SRA. OLGA ES DE VER  A SU HIJA PROFESIONAL, ESTA MUY AGRADECIDA CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Olga runs a neighborhood store where she sells a variety of products like bread, drinks, cookies, groceries, etc. She is married and her husband has a truck that he hires out to transport merchandise. They have a 12 year old daughter who is attending primary school. Her store is in a good locale on Barrientos Avenue in the center of the city of Cochabamba. The loan she is requesting is to better supply her store since she needs more inventory. Olga is very hardworking and very responsible. The money from her store is used to pay for household expenses. She dreams of seeing her daughter become a professional. She is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence they have in her to provide her this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase inventory

loans.name: Martha Josefa

texts.es: LA SRA. JOSEFA TRABAJA CON NOSOTROS DESDE 2006, LA ACTIVIDAD PRINCIPAL QUE TIENE LA CLIENTE ES LA DE ATENDER SU KIOSCO DE COMIDA Y BARIOS PRODUCTOS UBICADO DE USO DOMESTICO SU PUESTO SE ENCUENTRA  UBICADO EN UNA DE LAS ACADEMIAS DE ESTUDIO MILITAR, ACTIVIDAD CON LA CUAL MANTIENE SU HOGAR QUE ESTA CONFORMADO POR SUS DOS HIJOS Y SU ESPOSO LOS HIJOS ESTAN ESTUDIANDO ACTUALMENTE Y EN SU TIEMPO LIBRE LA AYUDAN A LA MAMA YA QUE EL KIOSCO ES LA PRINCIPAL FUENTE DE INGRESOS PARA SOSTENER SU HOGAR, LA CLIENTE ES MUY RESPONSABLE Y TRABAJADORA POR ESO QUE SE HIZO BENEFICIARIA DE LA TASA KIVA, LA SRA. JOSEFA ESTA MUY AGRADECIDA CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO, CON EL DINERO DEL CREDITO SE COMPRARA UNA CABINA TELEFONICA PARA SU PUESTO DE VENTA Y ASI TENER OTRO INGRESO MAS Y CON EL DINERO QUE LE SOBRA LO UTILIZARA EN LA COMPRA DE MERCADERIA.
texts.en:
Josefa has worked with us since 2006. Her main work has been taking care of her kiosk that sells food and various household products and is located at one of the military academies. This enables her to maintain her household that is made up of her two children and husband. The children are currently studying and in their free time they help her with the kiosk, as it is the main source of income supporting the household. She is very responsible and hardworking and as a result has been awarded the Kiva rate. Mrs. Josefa is very grateful to Emprender and to Kiva for the confidence they have shown in her through this loan. With the money from the loan she will buy a public telephone for her kiosk and thus will have more income. The left over money from the loan will be used to buy merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Anna Ruby Waxham Blackwell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a Public Telephone and Products for Kiosk

loans.name: Ma. Regina

texts.en: Ma. Regina M. is a 33-year-old single mother who supports her children by engaging in a general store. She lives in Barangay Robles, La Castellana, Negros Occidental with her two children who are between 3 and 4 years old. Ma. Regina has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2006 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of Php 10,000. Ma. Regina is now borrowing Php 18,000 so that she can expand her general store. This will be her 9th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of Php 15,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Ma. Regina aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the “Dungganon” way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital for her general store

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia A. is from the village of Benhaan, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 40 years old. Alicia is married and has two adult children. Alicia owns and operates a furniture making business.
