The main source of income for the business comes from making & selling general household furniture to local businesses and community members. Alicia has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it.

In 2010, Alicia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Alicia is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw materials to make additional furniture. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Alicia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement income of the family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: purchase of raw materials to make furniture

loans.name: Maria Rosario

texts.es:
La Señora María M. es socia del banco comunal Nueva Juventud, vive por la parroquia de Quingeo, esta parroquia se caracteriza por sus campos verdes y su vegetación en su estado natural, su gente se dedica a la agricultura, mucha de su población ha emigrado a varios lugares del mundo para brindar a sus familias una mejor calidad de vida.

Nuestra socia tiene 49 años, es casada y tiene 8 hijos quienes se encuentran de 26, 24, 22, 19, 17, 15, 12 y 8 años de edad, su primera hija es separada de su esposo y ahora vive en su casa de su madre ayudándole en su trabajo, su segunda hija es especial, su tercera hija es casada y vive de manera independiente, su cuarto y quinto hijo trabajan y le ayudan  económicamente, su sexto hijo pasa en la casa ayudándole en los quehaceres del hogar y sus dos últimos hijos estudian en la escuela, con su trabajo ha logrado construir su casa pero es muy pequeña para su gran familia, su esposo trabaja en la agricultura.

Nuestra socia se dedica a la cría de cuyes y también a la agricultura labrando su propia tierra.

Se encuentra en su tercer ciclo y los créditos anteriores le han beneficiado para la compra de cuyes, ahora  su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de abono para  mejorar el potrero y así tener alimento para sus cuyes, su meta es  seguir creciendo en el criadero de  cuyes.
texts.en:
María M. is a member of the Nueva Juventud (New Youth) communal bank. She lives in Quingeo parish. This parish is noted for its green pastures and vegetation in its natural state. Its inhabitants are mostly farmers. Much of the population has emigrated to various parts of the world to provide their families with better quality of life. She is 49 years old, married and has 8 children who are 26, 24, 22, 19, 17, 15, 12 and 8 years of age. Her oldest daughter is separated from her husband and now lives with her mother and helps her with her work. Her second daughter has special needs. Her third is married and lives independently. Her fourth and fifth sons are employed and help her out financially. Her sixth son stays home and helps her with her household chores and her youngest two are still in school. With her work she has managed to build her house but it’s too small for such a large family. Her husband is a farmer. She raises guinea pigs and also farms her own farmlands. This is her 3rd loan cycle. She used her previous loans to buy guinea pigs. She will use this new loan to buy manure to improve her field in order to have feed for her guinea pigs. Her goals are to continue growing as a guinea pig producer.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy manure.

loans.name: Mrs. Son Nou Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The fifteen people of this group have selected Mrs. Son N. as the village bank president. She is 51 years old and is located in Tuol Sang Ka village, Takeo province. The members will use their portion of their loan in varied ways to support their businesses.

Mrs. Son N. and her husband, Mr. Chhuon C., are farmers who own a one-hectare (2.5-acre) plot of land they use to cultivate rice to sell to support their family. Now it’s time to grow rice but they do not have enough money to support it. So, to improve their production, Mrs. Son N. is seeking a loan to bU. fertilizer and gasoline.

Mrs. Son N. is the mother of five children, two of whom are seamstresses in a garment factory while another one is a farmer and the others are attending the local public school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and gasoline for her farm

loans.name: Hong

texts.en: Mr. S. is 33 years old, married, and devoted to his two kids, who are already enrolled in school and dependent on his income. He is married to 27-year-old Samoeun, who helps support the family by selling cakes in the primary school. S. is a requirement laborer who currently works in the construction field. The family lives in an old house that frequently requires repairs. This affects their daily living. To solve this problem, S. is pursuing a loan to use towards repairing his broken house. (Mr. S.'s wife is pictured above)

loans.use: To use towards repairing his broken house.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou G., age 48, is married with three children, one in school, one working, and one currently at home. Marilou and her husband work hard to pay daily expenses, and to cover the cost of their children's education. For the past sixteen years, Marilou has owned and run her own sari-sari store (general store) selling snacks, soft drinks, and other goods. 

Marilou has requested a loan of PHP 31,000 to help her expand her inventory, and hopefully attract new customers. Marilou is looking to expand her business and finds that the loans allow her to buy inventory in bulk, saving on transportation costs and allowing her to spend more time running the store.  

Marilou has been a member of the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) since 2008 and has consistently attended weekly fellowship meetings.*  She hopes that her business will continue to generate income and that her family will live a happy and stable life.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To purchase inventory.

loans.name: Goun's Group

texts.en:
This small group loan is made up of four members, all residents in the rural area of Siem Reap Province. The members have selected Mrs. Goun P. as leader. She is 35 years old and earns a living with her husband by carrying fish at the local market. This couple has seven children: two work at the same place as their parents and the remaining five are single. Goun P. and her husband also take time to fish in and around the river. Goun P. is requesting a loan to buy tools for fishing.

The other borrowers who are jointly taking this loan are: Mrs. T. is applying for a loan to buy fishing equipment. Mrs. H. is applying for a loan to buy fishing equipment. Mr. H., a fish porter, is asking for a loan to repair his old house.

Note: the people shown in the photograph are Mrs. Goun P., Mrs. T.’s husband, Mrs. H.’s husband, and Mr. H..

loans.use: To buy tools for fishing

loans.name: Las Asucenas Group

texts.es:
El contacto para el inicio del presente comité fue la señora Delia Elizabeth T. quién  invito y organizo a sus amigas para formar parte del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras.
Actualmente las integrantes de este comité se encuentran trabajando apara el progreso de individual y también grupal.
Todas se encuentran satisfechas por los créditos obtenidos ya que pueden concretar con sus proyectos mediante mejoras en sus casa o sus actividades.

Así la  Sra. Delia Elizabeth  quien se dedica a la venta de comestible, anteriormente solo vendía una clase de comestibles y luego de invirtió el préstamo  en la compra de ingredientes para la elaboración de los comestibles,  actualmente cuanta con varios tipos que puede ofrecer a sus clientes como las empanadas de carne, pollo, jamón y queso, croquetas, milanesas, panchos, chorizos y otros.
texts.en:
Señora Delia Elizabeth T. was the person who started this group. She invited and her friends to participate in the Committee of Entrepreneurial Women program. The members of the committee are currently working on the progress of both the individual and the group. The women are very satisfied with the loans they have obtained and have used them to follow up on various projects such as making improvements to their houses or to their businesses. Sra. Delia Elizabeth earns her living by selling food. In the past she only sold one kind of food, but then she obtained a loan and bought ingredients to make other dishes. Now she has several different things she can sell to her customers such as meat, chicken, ham, and cheese empanadas, croquettes, breaded meat, hot dogs, sausages etc.

Translated from Spanish by Jane A, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy meat, oil etc to make food

loans.name: Jonna

texts.en:
Jonna P. is from the village of Duka, Medina, Misamis Oriental. She is 40 years old. Jonna is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Jonna owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Jonna has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Jonna joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jonna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Jonna is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Jonna from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.es: Genoveva tiene 59 años, vive con una de sus hijas en su casa propia. Desde hace 6 años se dedica a la venta de mazamorra típica de su zona. En un inicio lo hacía de manera ambulante, pero hace tres años se estableció en un puesto de venta, donde atiende todas las mañanas hasta altas horas de la tarde vendiendo este postre que tiene mucha demanda. En ocasiones recibe la ayuda de su hijo y sobrinas atendiendo a los clientes; al término de vender todas las raciones de mazamorra, nuevamente compra los ingredientes necesarios para su siguiente preparación. En lo sucesivo desea producir más mazamorra, de esa manera espera aumentar sus ganancias. Es su crédito número 14 con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero por que sabe que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Asimismo le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de ingredientes al por mayor, asimismo renovar platos y utensilios que utiliza en su negocio.
texts.en: Genoveva is 59 years old and she lives with one of her daughter in her own home. For the past 6 years she has sold traditional desserts in her region. When she first started she sold her products door to door but three years ago she set up a food stall. She sells her product every day until the very late hours of the evening. Every so often her son helps her to attend to clients. When she has sold out of her desserts she purchases more ingredients to prepare another batch. In the future she wants to produce more of her product to increase her earnings. This is her 14th loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner). She is very happy to have this financial support and she knows that it will be very useful in the advancement of her business. She is also happy to be a member of her community bank because all of the other members are very responsible team players. The loan she requests will be invested in the purchase of ingredients in wholesale, and she will also purchase new plates and utensils used in her business.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients and new plates and utensils.

loans.name: Juana Jesús

texts.en: Juana Jesús C. L. is a 50-year-old mother of two. Juana has completed high school and some technical courses. Juana lives in Sarapiqui, Heredia, a rural town located near the humid Caribbean coast of Costa Rica. She is in the business of rearing and selling pigs. Juana started her business with an initial investment of 100,000 colons. She focuses her energy on bringing her clients a high quality pork product coupled with exceptional service, she is conscious of what her clients´ value. This loan will be used for general investments necessary to the growth of her pork business. Specifically, this loan will be used for the purchase of livestock and animal feed. Juana aims to seek out new clients and maintain the loyalty of her existing ones. She attempts to carry out the duties of her everyday life with sincerity and responsibility, values she regards as central to her character. Juana intends to use this loan to maintain the health of her various livestock by ensuring their regular weight and by protecting them from parasites. She says the best way to accomplish this is by giving the animals proper vitamins and plenty of water.

loans.use: To purchase livestock and animal feed.

loans.name: Medelina

texts.en: Medelina M. is 31 years old, married, and has three children, two of whom attend school.  She is currently in the business of selling ground nuts and maize flour.  She is requesting a loan to stock bags of rice and beans to sell.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: To stock bags of rice and beans to sell

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: Rosemary is a hardworking lady with four children.  To earn a living, she runs a grocery shop.  Her business is located along the road hence so she gets a good number of customers.  In order to boost her income, she also sells second-hand clothes.  She joined Kiva partner Faulu Kenya so that she could save her money and access loans easily. She has requested a loan of 40, 000 Kes to increase her stock of vegetables.

loans.use: To increase her stock of vegetables.

loans.name: Jolynida

texts.en:
Jolynida P., from the village of Paradise, Banisilan, South Cotabato, is 38 years old, married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Jolynida owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods, instant noodles and junk foods in the local community. Engaged in her business for over four years, she earns approximately 10000 PHP a month.

In 2005, Jolynida joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 13000 PHP from HSPFI that was used for additional inventory and working capital, she is now requesting her sixth loan for 15000 PHP to purchase additional products such as canned goods to sell. Jolynida plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the store.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is a married woman who lives in Narra, Palawan. She earns her living by operating 3 businesses: an Internet cafe, cosmetic sales and tricycle. Her husband, Alfredo, who is 57 years old, works as a laborer to earn a living and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have four children who are between 16 and 35 years old.

Elma joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2003 because she hoped for something better for her family. With the help of her past 11 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon and her own efforts, Elma has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty. Her previous loan of PHP 22,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000, raising the family's standard of living. This time, for her 12th loan, she is borrowing PHP 27,000, which she intends to use to buy computer supplies in order to continue to save up for her children's future education. Elma is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: to purchase computer supplies

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth V. is from the village of Kandiis, Magsaysay, Misamis Oriental. She is 50 years old. Elizabeth is married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, she raises pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $187 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Elizabeth joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. 

Elizabeth is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be her 5th loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Amarsaihan

texts.en:
Amarsaihan, 30, is married and lives with her husband and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. They live in a ger, a Mongolian nomadic housing tent, on a small plot of land that they own. Both children attend a local school. 

She began a firewood and coal trading business in 2006. Her husband helps her to operate the business which has become very stable. In the summer time they transport firewood using their own vehicle. They plan to have their own location where they can sell firewood and coal. Amarsaihan is an honest and modest person who says, "My husband and I work hard to expand our business since we will need more money for our children's future education."

She is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT  to purchase more coal to sell in the near future to increase their working capital.

loans.use: To purchase more coal

loans.name: Izro

texts.en:
Izro D. is from the town of Banga. He is 42 years old. Izro is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Izro owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Izro works hard to sustain his family, especially his children's education.

Izro joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Izro has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Izro is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of his children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses is 40 years old, married and blessed with two children aged 14 and 16.  He has been operating a "boda boda" (motorbike) transport business to earn his daily bread.  He has been in the business for over two years.  He also runs a retail shop so as to supplement his income.  He hopes to transform his business into wholesale in future.  He says that since he joined Faulu Kenya, his financial status has improved.  He has requested 25,000 Kes to add stock of maize flour and sodas.

loans.use: To add stock of maize flour and crates of sodas

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia P. is from the town of Rizal, Quirino, Isabela. She is 45 years old. Patricia is married and has four school-aged children. 

To make a living, Patricia plants and harvests rice for sale. Patricia has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Patricia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Patricia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 23,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. 

Patricia is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. This will be the seventh loan taken out by Patricia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Ramon Enrique

texts.es: EL SEÑOR C. LABORA COMO TECNICO  EN TELEFONIA, ES SOLTERO ,TIENE CINCO  PERSONA A SU CARGO, ES EL PRIMER CREDITO QUE CEPRODEL LE OTORGA,LO NECESITA PARA INVERTIRLO EN MEJORA DE SU VIVIENDA EN CONSTRUIR UN COCINA, EN COMPRA DE ARENA, BLOQUE, CEMENTO, HIERRO,ESTRIBO, EL PAGO DE LA MANO DE OBRA, AGRADECE EL APOYO QUE  ESTA INSTITUCION LE BRIND
texts.en: MR. C. WORKS AS A TELEPHONE TECHNICIAN. HE IS SINGLE WITH FIVE DEPENDANTS. THIS IS HIS FIRST LOAN FROM CEPRODEL, AND HE NEEDS IT TO INVEST IN HOME IMPROVEMENTS - TO BUILD A KITCHEN, TO BUY SAND, BLOCKS, CEMENT, IRON, A BRACE, AND TO PAY FOR LABOUR. HE IS GRATEFUL FOR THE SUPPORT THIS INSTITUTION IS OFFERING HIM.

loans.use: to improve his home and purchase building materials

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa K. is 26 years old.  She is married but has no children. In 2009, Hawa established her plastic ware business. She began her business because people buy such things often and it is profitable.  Her business is open 6 days a week and 10 hours a day. 

Hawa would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Hawa requires a loan in order to purchase more plastic bowls, baskets, baby bathtubs and other plastic utensils.   In the future, Hawa plans to acquire a piece of land and educate her children well.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more plastic bowls, baskets, baby bathtubs, and other plastic utensils.

loans.name: Nehemias

texts.es: Nehemias, de 21 años; es un joven soltero y con mucho futuro. Vive en compañía de su mamá Alicia, su papá Juan y sus 3 hermanos a los que apoya. En unión familiar ellos viven en casa de sus abuelos, ubicados en el caserío de Huaylahuichan. Como hijo mayor y hermano responsable, él apoya a sus padres desde hace 6 años en la siembra. Ayudando con mucho esmero a producir la tierra que heredaron de parte de su familia. Su principal responsabilidad es mantener sus cultivos en buen estado, por ello constantemente cuida de sus sembríos de maíz, arveja, olluco y papa. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es pasar la mayor parte de su tiempo en el campo, pues gusta de estar solo y meditar. Su excelente trabajo que desarrolla en el cuidado de sus cultivos le ayuda para negociar sus cosechas a buen precio en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma, mientra que el maíz que produce lo comercializa en la capital del país. Por otro lado viaja cada 8 meses para dedicarse a la construcción civil, donde gana un dinero extra, dependiendo del tiempo que dura el contrato. Ahora se está preparando para su próxima cosecha de arveja, donde está seguro podrá obtener un buen resultado. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Nueva esperanza”, y este es el tercer crédito con MFP, donde se siente desarrollado; pues el apoyo y la experiencia que comparten en su asociación lo motivan a seguir adelante. Nehemias, comenzará su sembrío de maíz de la variedad “primeriza”, por ello invertirá el dinero solicitado en el arado de la tierra, donde esparcirá las semillas, asimismo en la compra de abono orgánico para fortalecer el crecimiento en los primeros meses.
texts.en:
Nehemias is a 21 year old single young man with a bright future.  He lives with his mother Alicia, his father Juan, and three brothers who he helps to support.  They all live together in his grandparents’ house in Huaylahuichan.  As the eldest son and responsible brother, he has been helping his father with the crops for the past six years; helping with great pride to work the land that they inherited from the family.  His main responsibility is to maintain the corn, pea, ulluco, and potato crops in good state.

What he enjoys most about his work is spending time in the fields because it allows him to meditate alone.  The excellent work he does when caring for his crops help him to negotiate a good price for them in the main Tarma market, except for the corn which he sells in the capital city.

He also travels every 8 months to work in construction where he earns extra money, depending on the length of employment.  How he’s preparing to harvest his next pea crop, which will be good and is sure to bring in a good price.

He is a member of the “Nueva Esperanza” (New Hope) communal bank and this will be his third loan through MFP, where he feels he has developed well because of the support and experience that is shared within his organization and that has motivated him to continue pushing ahead.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Diosdada

texts.en:
Diosdada  is from the village of Segatic Daku in the municipality of Clarin in Misamis Occidental Province. She is 50 years old. Diosdada is separated from her spouse and has six grown children. To make a living, Diosdada owns and operates a transportation service. The main source of income for the business comes from operating motor transport services. Diosdada has been engaged in her business for over one year, and she earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Diosdada joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Diosdada is requesting a loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Diosdada from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC: 
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair an existing vehicle for better service.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is a married woman with 3 children. Her husband works as a farmer and a welder.

Rosita is a farmer working in Sta. Josefa, Agusan Del Sur. She and her husband till their land together. They primarily grow rice to sell. When free of farming duties, Rosita's husband works as a welder. Rosita also raises pigs in their backyard.

This loan will be used to buy fertilizers, feed and materials for welding. She hopes for her ventures to prosper.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, feed and materials for welding

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah, age 53, is a vendor of tomatoes, onions, cabbages, and groundnuts. She has been offering her wares to the residents of a busy area for over nine years. Sarah plans to use the loan to buy more vegetables to offer for sale. She describes herself as highly dedicated to her work. She and her husband have seven children.
 
This is Sarah’s first loan with SMEP. In the future, she aspires to become a major supplier in the area. She hopes eventually to be able to buy a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to offer for sale

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “IMASUMAC II”; el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Gregoria; la socia tiene 62 años de edad, la socia es casada, La socia tiene 6 hijos los cuales ya son todos ellos independientes; La socia se dedica a la administración de sus propio negocio la socia tiene una picantería desde hace 20 años atrás ella misma atiende y cocina para sus clientes, la socia es muy conocida de su vecindad y muy querida, ella también lleva a las ferias comida típica elaborada junto con sus dos hijas, la socia requiere el préstamo para poder invertir en la compra de insumos al por mayor así como arroz, fideos, carne y otros ingredientes para la elaboración de sus diferentes platillos. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de insumos para la elaboración de sus platillos.

La socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the "IMASUMAC II" community bank; the bank is located in the Huanchac district in the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

The member is Señora Gregoria, she is 62 years old and is married with 6 children who are now all independent.  The member works managing her own business.  She has had a cookhouse for 20 years where she serves and cooks for her customers.  The member is well known in her neighborhood and much loved.  She also brings traditional local dishes to the markets, she prepares the food together with her two daughters. The member requires the loan to be able to invest in the purchase of ingredients at wholesale, such as rice, noodles, meat, and other ingredients for her different dishes. The member is requesting the loan to invest in the purchase of ingredients for the preparation of her dishes.

The member is grateful for the support being granted to her, and similarly agrees to comply in a disciplined manner with the payment of dues

loans.use: to invest in purchasing ingredients for the preparation of her dishes.

loans.name: Bakari

texts.en: Bakari is a married man with five children; four children attend school while one is too young for school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family. For the past seven years, Bakari has operated a retail shop, selling to his neighbors and passersby. In addition he also operates a tailoring business and a bodaboda (motorcycle) businesses which add to his income. He faces a major challenge of seasonality during rainy season when transportation becomes difficult. He dreams of expanding his business to wholesale in the future. With the Kshs 80,000 Bakari wants to purchase bundles of maize flour, wheat flour, beans, cow peas, sugar and cooking oil for his store. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of maize flour, wheat flour, beans, cow peas, sugar and cooking oil for his store.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein is a single man who lives at a family house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expense is clothing. For the past year, he has operated a vegetable stall business, selling to his neighbours. He faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in his business. He dreams of establishing a grocery business in the future. With the Kshs 10,000, Hussein wants to purchase sacks of vegetables for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with three children; two attend school while one is still too young for school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past two years, she has operated a street-food selling business, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing a restaurant in the future.

With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to establish a food stall business and purchase sacks of cereals, wheat flour and maize flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To establish a food stall business and purchase sacks of cereals, wheat flour and maize flour.

loans.name: Celia

texts.pt:
Nasceu na cidade de Maputo, provincia do mesmo nome, sul de Mocambique, casada e mãe de 1 filho de 16 anos de idade que frequenta a 10ª classe. Fez 9ª classe e naõ continuou devido a dificuldades financeiras. vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem.
Nunca saiu da sua terra natal, é negociante ha bastante tempo,onde vende produtos diversos e tem um rendimento de cerca de 4.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca teve emprestimo em outros bancos, conheceu Hluvuku atravez de uma amiga que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu segundo emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 20.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar produtos (arroz, batata, amendoim, refrescos, sumos, massa, e outros) para aumentar a sua mercadoria e obter mais lucros. O primeiro emprestimo foi de : 15.000.00mt.
Pretende ampliar o seu negocio construindo um estabelecimento comercial maior, assim pretende solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Celia was born in the city of Maputo, Maputo Province in southern Mozambique. She is married and has a 16-year-old son who attends tenth grade. Celia finished ninth grade and did not continue with school because of financial problems. She lives in her own house with her family and does not support anyone else.

She has never left her hometown. For quite some time Celia has been a businesswoman selling various products, and she has an income of around 4,000 meticais per month. She uses the money for household expenses and saves some in her bank account (at BIM).

She has never had loans from other banks. She learned about Hluvuku through a friend who is also a customer of this institution. This is Celia's second Hluvuku loan, and she is asking for 20,000 meticais to buy products (rice, potatoes, peanuts, soft drinks, pasta and other items) in order to increase her inventory and earn more profit. The first loan was for 15,000 meticais.

She intends to expand her business by building a larger store, so she intends to ask Hluvuku for more loans.

loans.use: to buy and sell products (rice, potatoes, peanuts, soft drinks, juices, pasta, etc.).

loans.name: Ruby Esther

texts.es: Ruby  de 40 años, vive en el municipio de Soledad con su esposo y sus tres hijos en las edades de 12 a 17 años. Allí  se dedica desde hace un poco menos de 10 años, a la producción de ropa deportiva, suéteres y blusas de franela y confección sobre medida, actividad innata que emprendió y posteriormente perfeccionó en el Servicio Nacional de Aprendizaje “SENA”. En la actualidad su negocio depende en su mayoría del sistema de maquila, que ofrece a una empresa de confecciones; en tiempos libres elabora productos propios que vende en sectores aledaños.  Sus estados financieros muestran un buen negocio,  los ingresos en su gran mayoría provienen del servicio de maquila que presta.  En la actualidad su meta es lograr plena independencia, sueño que trabajará gradualmente,  pues aspira a   conseguir su propio mercado.  Los indicadores financieros, muestran una estabilidad en el negocio; tanto en su autonomía financiera, como  en la rotación de las materias primas, que aunado al proyecto de adecuación del local en la parte externa de la vivienda, le generaría mayor comodidad a la familia. En la actualidad su competencia es su mayor desafío para lograr un mercado mayorista, pero está trabajando en conseguirlo gradualmente. Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual hará adecuaciones del área de producción de su negocio para hacer más efectivo su trabajo.
texts.en:
Ruby, 40, lives in the town of Soledad with her husband and three children ranging in age from 12 to 17 years.  For about the last ten years she’s been making sportswear, sweaters and flannel blouses there and has been making clothes to order, an innate activity that she started and then perfected taking courses at “SENA” [National Learning Center].  

Currently, her business depends for the most part on the ‘maquila’ (assembly for third parties) system that she offers a clothing manufacturing firm.  In her free time, though, she makes items for herself that she then sells in surrounding areas.  

Her financial statements show that her business is a good one.  Her income, for the most part, comes from the assembly services she provides.  Her current goal is to become totally independent, a dream she hopes to attain gradually because she hopes to acquire her own market share.  Financial indicators show business stability both in her financial autonomy and in raw materials turnover which, when added to the project to remodel the workshop located outside her house, will generate more comfort for her family.

Currently, competition is her greatest challenge to attain a wholesale market but she’s working towards attaining it gradually.  Her Kiva loan is the first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and she’ll use it to do some remodeling in the business’ production area so that work will be more efficient.

loans.use: to do some remodeling to make her workshop more efficient.

loans.name: Arvera

texts.en:
Arvera is 34 years old and has 2 children aged 14 and 17, and are both in school. She sells different types of foodstuffs like peanuts, sunflower oil and small fish. She buys them from neighboring countries and sells them in Rwanda. 

She has run this business for the last 14 years. She needs a loan to purchase more foodstuffs to sell in her store. She will use the profits along with her savings to buy a house.

loans.use: to purchase food to sell in her store

loans.name: Haneen

texts.en: Haneen is a 32 years old young woman, she is married with four sons, her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee with decent salary. Haneen has a grocery store and wants to purchase more groceries to have better collection for sale, she has an amount of money which is not enough to pay, so she needs to take a loan of amount $2,000 from FATEN. When Haneen gets the loan, she will pay to purchase more groceries and have better collection for sale, this will increase her income and enable her to provide better life conditions to the family. Haneen is a conservative woman, so her husband Samer is photographed instead in the grocery store.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries for sale.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a resident and a farmer in Kitale, Western Kenya.  She is 37 years old and married with two children aged 16 and 5.  Both her children are in school.  She has been farming for seven years and currently produces wheat, milk, and vegetables for the local market.  She has two farmhands and she receives additional income from her taxi business.

Hellen has requested a loan of 62,400 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow.  She says the additional income will improve her farming income and enable her to educate her children and improve the general living standards of her family.

She mentions animal diseases as the major challenge in the farming business but remains optimistic about the growth.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
As a parent of one child, Analyn works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from food vending, farming sugarcane and rice, and through a general store. Analyn is borrowing PHP 28000 through NWTF to buy spare parts for motorcycle maintenance for her transport business.

Analyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for motorcycle maintenance.

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es: Maria Cristina desde más 8 años que tiene este negocio, ella se dedica a la venta de productos lácteos. En donde tiene una gran cantidad de clientes que le solicitan variedad en sus productos. Cuenta con una clientela establecida, con los ingresos que obtenga podrá solventar sus necesidades de su casa. Maria se ha dado cuenta que su negocio va creciendo favorablemente en el transcurso de los días. Desea seguir ampliando su negocio con la compra de más mercadería. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de queso, cuajada, crema entre otros.
texts.en: Maria Cristina has had her business for more than eight years. She sells dairy products. She has a lot of clients who ask for a variety of products. She has an established clientele, and with the income she gets she will be able to afford household necessities. Maria has realized that her business will grow favorably over time. She would like to continue growing her business with the purchase of more merchandise. The purpose of the loan is to buy cheese, curd, cream, and other dairy products.

loans.use: to buy cheese, curd, cream, and other dairy products.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a married woman with one child. Teresita is 63 years old and resides at Santa Cruz, Tangub City, Philippines. 

Teresita owns and operates a business planting & harvesting fruits & vegetables, such as mangoes, to earn a living.  She's been 20 years in this business. Each month, she earns 3,000PHP. 

She requested a loan of 12,000PHP to purchase additional seeds & seedlings to raise. Teresita is been a member of GDMPC for almost two years.  In the future, Teresita wants to make improvements to her house and to complete her child's studies.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds & seedlings to raise

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
60-year-old Margarita runs a sari-sari store business in Panglao, Bohol. She is married and has three children.
Margarita has had her sari-sari store for 10 years. She sells items like bath and detergent soap, shampoo and canned goods to her community. 
Margarita works hard to support her family. She requested this loan to buy more items to sell, such as rice, soft drinks and canned goods. Margarita hopes to earn more and be able to make improvements to their house.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell, such as rice, soft drinks and canned goods

loans.name: Ines Lorena

texts.es:
La Señora. Inés es socia del banco comunal El Crédito, vive por el centro de la ciudad de Cuenca, Conocer a Cuenca es conocer la historia de un país, es viajar maravillosamente al pasado desde el presente, por la belleza de su centro histórico, su cultura y tradiciones que la caracterizan, cuenta con una variada gastronomía la misma que cautiva el paladar de propios y extraños.

Doña Inés tiene 34 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 12, 10 y 3 años de edad, su primera hija estudia en el colegio y su segunda hija en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo es de profesión técnico en sistemas y labora en la atención de un local de venta de repuestos de computadoras que es de su propiedad, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
 
La Señora. Inés labora en la atención de una ferretería en donde trabaja una sola jornada y de lunes a sábados.  En sus tiempos libres se dedica a la venta de cosméticos de varias marcas y esta actividad la realiza hace 8 años.

Es socia del banco comunal hace 4 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de piezas de computadoras para el negocio de su esposo.
 
Su meta es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Inés belongs to the “El Crédito” communal bank.  She lives near downtown Cuenca.  To know Cuenca is to know the history of a country, it is to marvelously travel from the present to the past because of the beauty of its historic city center, its characteristic culture and traditions, its varied cuisine which captivates the palates of locals and foreigners alike.

Inés is 34 years old, married and has had three children who are 12, 10 and 3 years of age.  Her oldest daughter is going to secondary school and her second daughter attends the local little elementary school. Her husband is a systems technician and works in a store that sells computer accessories he owns.  She does not own a house; she a renter.

Inés is employed in a hardware store where she works a single shift from Monday through Saturday.  In her free time she sells cosmetics of various brands and she’s been doing this for 8 years.

She’s been in the communal bank for four years and will use her new loan to buy computer parts for her husband’s business.  Her dream is to have a house of her own.

loans.use: to buy computer parts.

loans.name: Mahmadullo

texts.ru: Махмадулло проживает в районе Гиссар. Ему 50 лет. Он женат. У него четверо детей. Он имеет среднее образование. На сегодняшний день Махмадулло занимается развозкой пассажиров на своем автомобиле марки "Хонда старекс". Он берет кредит для ремонта машины, чтобы предоставить безопасную услугу в зимнее время года.
texts.en: Mahmadullo lives in the Gissar District. He is 50 years old.  He is married and has 4 children. He has a high school education. Currently Mahmadullo is providing transportation services to passengers using his Hyndai Starex van. He is taking a loan to repair his vehicle, so he can provide safe service during winter months.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Nida is a farmer and raises hogs to earn a living. She has been doing this for 15 years. Nida has requested a loan of 5000 PHP to purchase pigs to sell.
  
Nida has been a member of PMPC for two years.

loans.use: To purchase pigs to sell.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a farmer in Kitale. He is aged 52 years, and married with seven children. The first born is 18 years old, and the last born is only four months. He has been in farming for five years, and his produce of maize, sugarcane, beans, and milk are sold within the local market.

Patrick has requested a loan of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. He says this will give a boost to his farming income and enable him to easily provide the basic family needs. He hopes to increase the number of his dairy cows.

Patrick lists animal diseases, high cost of feed, and unreliable rains as the leading challenges.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: 12 De Octubre Group

texts.es: Este grupo está formado por cuatro socias emprendedora una de ellas es Ileana  que vende zapatos, cosméticos y ropa usada hace 6 años. Inicio vendiendo ropa usada y con los márgenes de ganancia fue diversificando sus productos, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de ropa, zapatos, cosméticos de la Avon etc. Noelia vende sandalias, Luisa Amanda vende zapatos, ropa nueva y electrodomésticos en menor escala y Ana vende ropa y sandalias.
texts.en: This communal bank is made up of four entrepreneurial members.  One of them is Ileana.  She has been selling shoes, cosmetics and second-hand clothing for six years.  She started out selling second-hand clothing and with her profit margin, she diversified her products.  She will invest the loan in the purchase of clothing, shoes and Avon products etc.  Among the other members of the communal bank, Noelia sells sandals, Luisa Amanda sells shoes, new clothing and, to a lesser degree, electrical appliances, and Ana sells clothing and sandals.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of clothing, shoes and Avon products, such as perfume, hand lotion, body lotion, hair cream, cologne etc.

loans.name: Jandry Ricardo

texts.es:
La parroquia Riochico de Poprtoviejo es un emporio de producción de coco, limón, cacao, plátano y maíz, y  además productor de ciclo corto como el tomate, pimiento, frejol, haba, maní, pepino, entre otras debido a su alta calidad favoreciéndole los factores de clima, suelo y agua. 
En este lugar vive el señor Jandry  tiene 21  años de edad, es soltero y no tiene hijos. Vive en casa de sus padres.    
Jandry se dedica a la compra venta de materiales de construcción como ladrillos, bloques, madera, caña guadua, arena por sacos, etc.  El aprendió el negocio de su padre quien también tiene el mismo negocio y lo apoya a seguir adelante. Su horario de trabajo es de 7:h00 a 18:h00 de Lunes a Sábados y los Domingos de  7:h00 a 12:h00. Lleva 2 años con el negocio y que a pesar de que el trabajo es sacrificado le gusta.
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar ripio, ladrillos, arena, caña guadua, etc. Este es su segundo crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son fáciles de hacer sin tantos trámites.
 Su sueño es comprar una finca y tener un local grande con todos los materiales para la construcción.

loans.use: comprar ripio, ladrillos, arena, caña guadua, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Loise would like to buy two dairy cows.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Mary would like to buy a water tank and another dairy cow

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa makes macrame and wool table cloths for order. She works by herself and her husband is a laborer. They live in the neighborhood of Callapa in La Paz, where her workshop is as well. This is the first loan she has requested from IMPRO. She will use the funds to purchase wool and yarn. Our analysis finds that with her experience and cash flow she will be able to cover the loan. IMPRO hopes she will have this opportunity.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Rosa elabora manteles en macramé y lana; todo tejido que ella elabora es a pedido; ella trabaja por cuenta propia y su esposo es albañil. Vive en la zona de Callapa de la ciudad de La Paz y su taller también esta ubicado en la misma dirección. Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito con IMPRO. El monto solicitado será destinado para la compra de materia prima (lana e hilo). Su trabajo le permite acceder a este crédito ya que el análisis financiero efectuado y su flujo de caja indican que Rosa tiene experiencia en su negocio. IMPRO sugiere que se debe dar esta oportunidad a Rosa.

loans.use: To buy wool and yarn.

loans.name: Agbissi

texts.fr:
Mrs. Agbissi A. is a 35 year-old woman who lives in a village called Adidomé. She is a married mother of six (6) children, and is involved in the trade of coconut oil. Her business consists of buying oil in bulk quantities and reselling it for a small profit. The income which she earns makes it possible for her to participate in taking care of her family's needs. In order to re-stock her storage of oil for re-sale, she is asking for financial support of $1200. That will enable her to improve her income and the living conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame A. Agbissi est une dame de 35 ans qui réside dans le village d’Adidomé. Mariée et mère de six (6) enfants, elle se dévoue avec le commerce de l’huile de coco. Cette activité consiste à acheter de l’huile en quantité et de revendre afin d’en tirer quelques profits. Le revenu qu’elle tire de son activité lui permet de participer en grande partie à la gestion du foyer. Pour redynamiser son activité, elle a besoin d’un appui financier de $1200 qui lui permettra de faire un stockage d’huile à revendre. Cela lui permettra d’améliorer son revenu et des conditions de vie de sa famille.FAFALI

loans.use: Buying and reselling coconut oil

loans.name: Rahila

texts.en: Rahila ( her husband is pictured ) is 54 years old. and she and her husband have two children. They lives in Khachmaz town.  She and her husband have raised cattle for four years. They are now requesting a loan of $725 to buy a cow for their business.

loans.use: To buy a cow for their cattle breeding business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her current stock and buy a weighing machine

loans.name: Coni

texts.es:
Coni belongs to the Mientras Tanto group “Mas que Vencedoras” (more than winners), lives in the San Martín region, provence of San Martín, in the Tarapoto district. Her home and business are located at Jr. Túpac Amaru Nº 533 in the Joven 9 de Abril village. She sells groceries retail.

Coni is a women that, with the support of Manuela Ramos, has increased the capital with which she started her business and so she uses all other loans that she receives from Manuela to continue to expand her business to match her customer’s demand.

With this loan that she will repay in 4 months, she will buy rice, sugar (in sacks), milk in boxes, eggs in cartons and other products such as candies that she sells daily in the store.

Coni is 24 years old, a single mother and lives with her only daughter for whom she works hard to be able to succeed and supply her daughter with what she needs and raise her well. She would like to thank Manuela Ramos for the opportunity that they are giving her, which helped her to make the decision to become independent of her parents and enter the world of business.

Translated from Spanish by Alexandra Jaffe, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Coni pertenece al Grupo Mientras Tanto “Mas que Vencedoras”, vive en la Región San Martín, provincia de San Martín, distrito de Tarapoto, su domicilio y su negocio están ubicados en el Jr. Túpac Amaru Nº 533 del pueblo joven 9 de Abril. Se dedica a la venta de abarrotes al por menor.

Es una mujer que con el apoyo de Manuela Ramos ha aumentado el capital con el que inició su negocio y de esa manera los demás préstamos que recibe de Manuela le sirven para ir incrementando el negocio de acuerdo a la demanda de sus clientes.

Con este préstamo que pagará en 4 meses, comprará arroz, azúcar (en sacos), leche en cajas, huevos en javas y otros productos como golosinas que diariamente tienen movimiento en el negocio.

La señora Coni tiene 24 años, es madre soltera, vive con su única hija por quien toma fuerzas para seguir adelante para suplir sus necesidades y darle buena educación. Agradece a Manuela Ramos por la oportunidad que le brinda y ello le ayudó a tomar la decisión de independizarse de los padres y entrar en el mundo de los negocios.

loans.use: Purchase of groceries (rice, sugar, milk, eggs, etc.)

loans.name: Orfelinda's Group

texts.en:
Edith, Orfelinda and Juana are members of the community bank “Cusi Urpi”. They have been members for two, three, and five years respectively. In that time they have learned the importance of punctuality, responsibility, and honesty.

Edith is 33 years old and has one 7-year-old child. For several years Edith has been selling shoes but with her new loan she will begin to sell breads and pastries. She is excited about this because people rarely buy shoes and selling bread, which people buy daily, will give her a more even and dependable source of income.

Orfelinda is 33. She has two children and is expecting her third. Orfelinda was encouraged to join the community bank by her cousin and has five other family members who are associates. She has been selling food staples such as flour and sugar from her home for ten years. She is also an artisan and makes intricate wooden altarpieces, a skill she learned from her parents.

Juana is 68 years old and has two adult children. She has a small store where she sells food staples. She has been selling groceries since she was very young.

Edith, Orfelinda, and Juana need loans of 600, 400, and 200 soles (3 soles = $1), which will be invested in bread products, flour, butter, grocery items such as, rice, beans, and oil, and artisan products such as wood and paint.

The community bank emphasizes the importance of saving, and each associate has an interest earning account. Edith, Orfelinda and Juana plan to use their savings to pay their children’s school fees and health care. Orafalinda was saving to buy a house until her mother got sick and Juana is trying to help her grand children, whose mother abandoned them. Their dreams are that their children and grandchildren have a better life.

loans.use: Edith, Orfelinda, and Juana need loans of 600, 400, and 200 soles (3 soles = $1), which will be invested in bread products, flour, butter, grocery items such as, rice, beans, and oil, and artisan products such as wood and paint.

loans.name: Alisher

texts.ru:
Alisher S. lives in the Fayzabad region. He is 25 years old and is unmarried. He has a secondary education. He raises cattle. He has been in this business for 3 years. He is planning to buy a cow using the proceeds of his loan. This will increase the size of his herd. After he increases the size of his herd, he plans on selling the older cows and raising the younger ones. After the cow gives birth he can sell the milk, which becomes an additional source of income for him. This business gives him a chance to provide for his family as well as supply the local market with fresh milk and meat. He is planning to repay his loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Jamilya & Keith Leitich, Kiva Volunteers.

Саидов Алишер Ашурович проживает в районе Файзабад. Возраст 25 лет, холост детей не имеет. Образование среднее. Занимается разведением КРС. Занимается данным бизнесом клиент уже 3 года. На планируемый кредит хочет купить корову для того чтобы увеличить поголовье скота. После того как количество поголовья увеличится клиент продает старых и растит молодняк. Кроме того отелившаяся корова дает молоко которое продается и дает дополнительный доход хозяевам.Этот бизнес дает возможность обеспечивать семью клиента а также обеспечивать рынки свежим молоком и мясом. Погашать кредит клиент планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase a cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase her stock of products to sell

loans.name: Kiboswa Safina Group

texts.en:
Evaline N. is an average Kenyan woman aged 40 who is married with 2 children. She also cares for 2 orphan children of her late sister. Evaline started her second-hand clothing business 8 years ago after working as a house helper for 10 years.

Evaline deals in ladies' and children’s wear. She purchases her bails of clothes every Sunday from Kibuye market which is well-known for its wholesale clothing business. With the little profit that she gets from her business, Evaline is still able to clothe, feed, and educate her children and relatives with the help of her husband who works as a mechanic in Kisumu town.

With the help of her loan, Evaline would like to diversify her business. Evaline’s long-term business vision is to expand her business into a boutique.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Do Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs Đỗ Thị M., 44 years old, participates in TYM fund since 2004. In the region where she lives, there's not much job opportunity apart from farming and raising livestock. She used her loans to raise pigs which yielded good profit so she continues to do so in later rounds of loans. Her husband, Mr M., works as a laborer and he helps her taking care of the weekly payment. The revenue from the pig business is sufficient to provide education for their children: their eldest son has graduated and the other 3 are still in high school and primary school. Her monthly income from the pig business is 100 USD. She is seeking 375 USD to buy pigs to breed.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Đỗ Thị M., 44 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ Tình thương năm 2004. Trên địa bàn chị sống ít nghề phụ, công việc chủ yếu của người dân là làm ruộng và chăn nuôi. Sau những vòng vốn đầu chị M. đầu tư chăn nuôi thấy hiệu quả nên các vòng vốn sau chị tiếp tục vay vốn phát triển dự án này. Hàng ngày chồng chị M. đi làm thuê và hỗ trợ chị trong việc hoàn trả nên việc tham gia Quỹ của chị rất thuận lợi. Nguồn thu từ chăn nuôi giúp chị có điều kiện cho các con đi học tốt hơn, cháu lớn nhà chị đã ra trường, 3 cháu còn lại đang học trung cấp và phổ thông. Thu nhập bình quân hàng tháng từ chăn nuôi của chị M. khoảng 100USD. Vòng vốn này chị đề nghị vay 375USD để mua thêm lợn nái về nuôi.

loans.use: Buy pigs

loans.name: Luz María

texts.en:
Luz María belongs to the María Milagrosa Village Bank and lives in Villa María del Triunfo in Lima. She lives with her husband and has 4 children, 2 of them still in school.

She started her business 4 years ago selling sandwiches and braised chicken. This business is profitable during weekends. Since last year, she began selling pullovers hand-sewn. It helped her a lot because it’s a support for investment in her business and to better her quality of life.

Luz María is asking for a 400 soles loan that she plans to invest in her 2 microenterprises for the purchase of supplies for her sandwiches and wool to weave pullovers.

Luz María wants to purchase machines to implement a pullover workshop and thus enable her children to go to college. Because in the sandwich sector located in her living area, there is much competition, that’s why she relies on the pullover selling.

loans.use: Luz María is asking for a 400 soles loan that she plans to invest in her 2 microenterprises for the purchase of supplies for her sandwiches and wool to weave pullovers.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
Mario is a milk producer for the PIL company; he also works in bovine artificial insemination. His wife sells potato and potato flour products that they themselves produce on their land and they sell them to different markets in nearby communities. With these jobs they are able to support their four children, all of whom are dependent on their parents.

Mario lives in a community called Huayrocondo-Battallas (located two and a half hours from La Paz city).

The loan will be used to buy a medium-sized cow to increase milk production, and the milk will be then sold to the PIL company. This will increase his income by about 15%.

This is Mario’s second loan with Impro, and the good payment history enables him to qualify for another loan. Mario has been a client of IMPRO since April, 2007.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

Mario, es productor de leche de vaca que comercializa en la empresa PIL; también trabaja realizando inseminación artificial, la esposa es comerciante de papa y chuño productos que ellos mismos producen en su tierra y venden en las diferentes ferias de las comunidades aledañas. Así consiguen sus ingresos con los que cubren la manutención de sus cuatro hijos que depende de ellos.

Mario vive en la Comunidad de Huayrocondo - Batallas (A dos horas y media de la ciudad de La Paz).

El crédito lo destinará para la compra de una vaca de raza mediana para incrementar la producción de leche y vender a la Fabrica PIL. De esta manera sus ingresos mejorarán en al menos un 15% más.

Es el Segundo crédito con Impro, el buen comportamiento de pago permite aprobar otro préstamo solicitado por Mario. Es cliente de IMPRO desde Abril del año 2007.

loans.use: Buy a milk cow to increase milk production and sell the milk to PIL company.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
hjdhfghfdgn
fgjfjgnfg

fgjnfng

loans.use: Venta de comida, biens, higenicos

loans.name: Jackeline

texts.es: Jackeline es una muchacha de 18 años de edad, desde que concluyó sus estudios secundarios, inmediatamente decidió dedicarse a la venta de vajillas de porcelana y variedad de utensilios de cocina, su empeño, alegría e iniciativa la están llevando a tener éxito en su negocio, lo que le permitirá cubrir satisfactoriamente sus estudios superiores. Adquiere  su mercadería en la ciudad de Lima, y  la vende de forma ambulatoria en su ciudad, Juliaca.Por la variedad y novedosas mercaderías que ofrece está logrando  obtener buenos beneficios económicos.Ahora, debido a demanda de sus clientes desea aumentar el monto de su capital, es por esa razón que solicita este préstamo, dinero que  tiene pensado invertir en su negocio.
texts.en:
Jackeline is a young 18-year-old woman. Ever since she completed her high school studies, she immediately decided to sell porcelain dinnerware and a variety of kitchen utensils for a living. Her dedication, delight, and initiative have caused her to be prosperous in her business, which will allow her to adequately cover her university studies. She obtains her merchandise in the city of Lima, then sells it as a street vendor in her city, Juliaca. Because of the variety and the innovative products that she offers, she has managed to obtain good profits. Now, due to customer demand, she would like to increase her capital, which is why she is requesting this loan that will be invested in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in inventory

loans.name: Suhbatjon

texts.en:
Suhbatjon P. is married and is a young father of two children. Suhbatjon’s children are small now, but he is already working hard in order to ensure the best future for them. For the past 9 years, Suhbatjon has been selling brooms in the market. He owns land where he grows the material required for making brooms.

Suhbatjon is requesting 2700 Somoni ($800 USD) for the term of 12 months. The loan will be used to buy necessary materials for processing his land and growing broom materials. The loan will enable Suhbatjon to earn more and accomplish his dreams of educating his children. He also dreams of someday buying car to be able to look after his parents.

loans.use: Purchasing necessary materials for making brooms

loans.name: Ulviyya

texts.en:
Ulviyya V. lives in the Bilasuvar Internally Displaced Settlement to which she and her family fled during the Azerbaijan-Armenian conflict in 1993. A young and ambitious single woman of 24 caring for her pensioned parents, she operates a business selling wedding dresses. The enterprise is going very well due to the advice that she renders to clients plus the fact that it is the only shop offering such products for many kilometers.

Now Ulviyya would now like to further develop her business and is therefore requesting a loan of $1200 to purchase wedding accessories to offer for sale in her shop. Let’s help this young girl in her small business!

loans.use: To purchase bridal accessories for her store.

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es:
Marco Antonio   vive en la Avenida “chacaltaya “  de la zona de Achachicala en la ciudad de La Paz.
 
Vive junto a su hijo y esposa, la cual se dedica al comercio y de esa forma ayuda con los gastos del hogar.

Se dedica transporte urbano como chofer asalariado de taxi en una ruta central de la ciudad.

El crédito lo destinara en la reparación de la parte electrica del vehiculo que conduce. 
 
Es el primer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Marco Antonio lives in Avenida "Chacaltaya", of the zone of Achachicala in the town of La Paz. He lives with his son and wife who is a merchant and this way helps with the family expenses. He is a taxi driver with the public transportation on one central route of the town. The loan will be spent on repairing the electric part of his vehicle. This is his first loan with Impro, and the evaluation qualifies him for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair a taxi.

loans.name: Olateju

texts.en: Olateju A. is 42 years old and married with 3 children. She sells women's and men's shoes. She has been in this business for a long time. She needs the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more shoes to sell. She says thanks to all who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes to sell

loans.name: Sanoat

texts.ru: Хамдамова Саноат проживает в городе Вахдат. Замужем и имеет троих детей. Возраст 39 лет. Уже 15 лет занимается выпечкой лепешек и их реализацией. Для ремонта лепешечной решила получить кредит . Это поможет улучшить условия работы . Погасить кредит сможет в течение 6 месяцев.
texts.en:
Sanoat H. lives in Vahdat. She is 39 years old, married and has three children. She has been baking and selling traditional flatbread for 15 years. Sanoat decided to obtain this loan to renovate her bakery and improve working conditions. She will be able to repay the loan within 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bakery renovation

loans.name: Savun

texts.en:
Mr. Savun B., 43, and his wife, Mrs. Sam-un Van, 42, were married in 1984 and have five children: two sons and three daughters. Three of their children are silk weavers and the other two children attend school. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Savun and his wife are farmers. They grow tomatoes and cucumbers in their farmland near the village. Besides farming they sell mangoes as well. They buy them from the villagers for resale in the market in Phnom Penh.

Savun is asking for a loan of $600 to purchase mangoes on contract for resale and to buy silk materials for his children.

loans.use: To purchase mangoes for resale and buy silk materials for his children

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen sells traditional beads. She has been in this business for a long time. She hopes for the loan amount of N 100,000 to purchase more traditional beads to sell. She is 60 years old and married with 7 children. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more traditional beads to sell

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is a young entrepreneur. She is only 19 years old and already married to Lerson, a farmer. They do not have a child yet and they keep on praying to have one. She has managed a sari-sari store (community based store) in their village for three years.

Fe wants to buy more stock for the improvement of her business which would save time and transportation fares going to the market since it is far from their place and needs a ride in a ferry boat. She hopes to obtain a loan of PHP 5,000.00. Fe is looking forward to the financial support of the lenders and she hopes that, someday, she can develop her business.

loans.use: To buy more stock for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Asli

texts.en: Asli is a widow with 2 children. She lives in Khachmaz region, in Garagurtlu village. She is 50 years old. She has been baking bread for 5 years. Now she needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy the necessary things for baking bread.

loans.use: to buy the necessary things for baking bread

loans.name: Tingnéré Nènè

texts.fr:
Madame Tingnéré Nènè Dembélé est âgée de 42 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle vit dans une famille monogame avec son époux et ses enfants  dans le quartier Darsalam I  de la ville  de Koutiala (Région de Sikasso ). Enseignante dans une école publique  de Koutiala il y a plus de 10 ans, elle mène en plus de cette profession des activités génératrices de revenus notamment la teinture et la vente des bazins teintés qu’elle a apprise auprès d’une de ses collègues de service depuis 7 ans. Elle fait des prestations pour beaucoup de demandeurs de son quartier et de la ville en teinture, elle  reçoit également des commandes de différentes structures professionnelles de Koutiala et des tierces personnes.  
Afin de satisfaire sa clientèle et générer plus de  bénéfice, elle a décidé de faire recours à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il  y’a  2 mois. 
Elle est à son  premier prêt individuel qui servira à acheter, 5 pièces de bazins moyen riche, des colorants (teintures) et de la potasse. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Koutiala et souvent à Bamako (capitale du Mali). Elle effectue ses ventes dans la ville de Koutiala (tant dans les structures professionnelles étatiques que privées et dans le quartier) à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes à crédit ou au comptant. 
Elle compte réaliser sur un bénéfice mensuel de 100.000FCFA qu’elle  utilisera pour le remboursement de son échéance, s’entretenir et investir le reste dans son activité. 
Dans ses perspectives, elle compte ouvrir un centre d’apprentissage en teinture qui demande un fonds important, pour cela elle fonde son espoir sur Soro  Yiriwaso et son partenaire Kiva pour réaliser ce projet.
texts.en:
Ms. Tingnéré Nènè Dembélé, age 42, is married and the mother of four. She lives in a monogamous family with her husband and children in the Darsalam I district of the city of Koutiala (Sikasso Region). A teacher in a Koutiala public school for over ten years, she also earns revenues from business, particularly the dyeing of cloth and selling dyed damask fabrics, that she learned from one of her service colleagues seven years ago. She offers a range of cloth dyeing services for many requestors in her district and in the city. She also receives orders from different professional organizations of Koutiala and from third parties. To satisfy her customers and to generate more profit, she decided to turn towards the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso two months ago. She is on her first individual loan, which will be used to buy five bolts of medium-rich damask, colorants (dyes), and some potash. Supplies are gotten at the grand marketplace of Koutiala and often in Bamako (capital of Mali). Sales are made in Koutiala City (in professional state organizations as much as in private organizations and in her district) to customers composed of women and men, cash or credit accepted. She is counting on realizing a monthly profit of 100,000 francs CFA that will be used for repaying the loan, for supporting herself, and for investing the rest in her business. Looking ahead, she intends to open a center for apprentices in cloth dyeing that demands sizable funding. Her hopes rest upon Soro Yiriwaso and its partner, Kiva, for this plan to be realized.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bolts of damask fabrics and dyes

loans.name: Ketra

texts.en:
Mrs. Ketra K., 47, and her husband, Mr. Many Un, 49, have been married since 1980. They have four children—two sons and two daughters. One of Ketra’s daughters is a cobber in a shoe factory, one son has full-time employment, the other daughter assists her mother in her scarf weaving business and the youngest son attends school. The family lives along National Road Number one, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. 

Ketra has been a scarf weaver since 2000; it’s a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products in Olympic market, located in Phnom Penh. Her husband has been a soldier for over 20 years; he also drives a motor taxi when he has free time to get more extra income. 

Ketra has two looms: one for her and another one for her daughter. She is requesting her second loan of 1,000 to purchase cotton threads to continue her scarf weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase cotton threads for her scarf weaving

loans.name: Eldard

texts.en:
Mr. B. Eldard owns a boutique in Ibanda town. He sells used clothes in his boutique and sells other clothes in different markets. He is using the loan to purchase more clothes for his boutique.

He has been running this business for twelve years but before doing this business, he was a farmer. He has five children in secondary school. He works with his wife; sometimes she goes to the markets in case it is market day. Both have good customer care and they believe it this will enable them to get customers and maintain the stability of their business.

Mr. B. aspires to own a large scale boutique to sell a wide range of clothes in the same location so as to attract an awesome number of customers.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for his boutique

loans.name: Nicholas
