texts.en:
Nicholas O. is a 27-year-old small restaurant owner who lives and operates his business in the Mukuru slum in Nairobi, Kenya. He is married and has one child. He is asking for a first loan of Ksh. 20,000 to buy chairs, tables and sufurias (pots) for his business. Having faced the challenge of unemployment, Julius began his small food business, which he is currently operating and desires to expand.

In addition to supporting his family, Nicholas also supports his parents and educates his sister. Nicholas hopes to expand his business into a big hotel one day. He describes himself as friendly, interactive and hardworking.

Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Buy new chairs, tables and pots

loans.name: Hilda Clenencia

texts.es:
Hilda es socia del Banco Comunal Señor de Huanca
Hilda es conviviente, tiene 39 años y 2 hijos, Hilda tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, frutas, además reparte gas a domicilio también vende celulares, actividades que realiza en el mismo local.
Hilda necesita un préstamo de 2600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de azúcar, arroz, gas.
Los sueños de Hilda son brindar una buena educación a sus hijos para que sean profesionales y construir el segundo piso de su casa.
texts.en:
Hilda belongs to Señor de Huanaca Communal Bank. Hilda lives with her life partner, is 39 years old, and has 2 children. Hilda has a store in her house where she sells general groceries, and fruit. She sells soda there too. She also sells cell phones in the same area. Hilda needs a loan of S./ 2600, which she will use to buy sugar, rice, and soda. Hilda dreams of being able to offer her children a good education, so that they become professionals, and of building the second floor of her house.

Translated from Spanish by Hannah Lily, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying sugar, rice, and soda.

loans.name: Theodomir

texts.en:
Theodomir B. is 27 years old. He is single, and he lives with his parents. He owns a small shop selling different kinds of products as seen in the picture. He has an experience of 11 years. He works every day from 8:00 AM to 8:00 PM, and his monthly profit is 100,000 RWF.

Theodomir is requesting his first loan of 500,000 RWF from Vision Finance Company s.a. With this new loan, he hopes to expand his business through purchasing more products for sale, and as he will be getting more profit, he hopes also to buy his own house.

loans.use: to buy more products for his shop

loans.name: Action Group #1

texts.en:
Action Group #1 is a group of 5 borrowers, led by Vincent F., living in Kolahu, Lofa County, Liberia.  John is 55 years old, married, with 9 children, aged 3-20, and also takes care of children orphaned in the war.  All his children are in school.  John is a high school graduate and lives in remote Kolahu city in rural Lofa county, the breadbasket of Liberia. 

John’s business is preparing and selling dried meat, important in Liberia since most don’t have refrigerators.  He sells the meat to the farming community from his temporary market stall alongside approximately 100 other vendors of various trades.  He has been running his business for 1 year.   He’s taking a loan to purchase additional meat and also bags to transport it.  With the profits he dreams of first having a larger market stall and ultimately building a more permanent shop, and investing in the future of his children, especially school which he was fortunate to complete.

loans.use: Purchase 1 carton of meat and bags for reselling

loans.name: Celeste Mucavela

texts.pt:
Celeste nasceu no distrito da namaacha, tem 42 anos de idade, casada e mãe de 5 filhos com idades compreendidas entre 16 e trinta anos, todos encontrando se a estudar na excepcao dos dois mais velhos. Estudou ate 5 classe tendo parado devido à falta de condições financeiras por parte dos pais, no tempo colonial.

Cresceu na companhia dos seus progenitores no distrito de namaacha na zona de mafuiane e só saiu da mesma após o casamento e passou a viver no distrito de boane com o seu marido que é pensionista militar. Vive na casa própria com os três filhos mais novos e sem ninguém mais por sustentar. Faz negocio num estabelecimento comercial de pequena escala na zona da sua residência. Aprendeu a fazer esta actividade com suas amigas no ano 2000. Vende diversos produtos de mercearia (açúcar, pipocas, sabão, biscoites, produtos de beleza, higiene e outros) e tem rendimento mensal aproximado de 6.000,00MT que aplica no sustento da família e também poupa algum valor no esquema tradicional de poupança rotativa. ( xitque).

Este é o segundo empréstimo da Celeste no valor de 20.000,00MT para compra e venda de produtos de primeira necessidade (pipoca, sabão, biscoite produtos de beleza e outros). Acha que o aumento do volume do negocio poderá ganhar mais dinheiro e satisfação dos seus clientes. O primeiro empréstimo foi de 15.000,00MT para o exercício da mesma actividade.

Teve informações sobre a Hluvuku-Adsema através de vizinhos e clientes da instituição.
Propõe se, tal como no credito anterior, a reembolsar o empréstimo sem problemas para poder aceder a mais créditos com objectivo de fazer crescer o negocio e seu estabelecimento comercial.
texts.en:
Celeste was born in the district of Namaacha. She is 42; is married; and is the mother of 5 children, whose ages range from 16- to 30-years-old. All of them are in school except for the two oldest. Celeste studied through 5th grade and had to stop because of the financial situation of her parents during the Portuguese colonial rule. She grew up in the company of her two parents in the district of Namaacha in the Mafuiane region. She only left there after she got married and went to live in the district of Boane with her husband. He is in the military. She lives in her own home with her three youngest children, and she doesn't have any additional family members to support. She has her small business in the same area as her home. She learned to do this activity with her friends in the year 2000. She sells various products such as sugar, popcorn, cookies, beauty products, hygiene products, etc. She has a monthly income of 6,000 meticais, which she puts towards supporting her family. She also saves some money through a traditional savings group, which is known as xitque. This is Celeste's second loan, and it is for 20,000 meticais. She will use it to buy and sell basic products (popcorn, soap, cookies, beauty products, etc.). She believes that by raising the volume of her business, she will be able to earn more money and increase the satisfaction of her customers. Her first loan was for 15,000 meticais, which she used for the same purpose. She received information about Hluvuku-Adsema through neighbors and other clients of the institution. She is promising, just as with her previous credit, to repay the loan without any problems to be able to receive more credits in the future with the objective of growing her business.

Translated from Portuguese by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise (cookies, sugar, flour, etc.)

loans.name: Margaret  Njeri

texts.en:
Margaret is married to Julius and they have no children yet.

Margaret has been in the business of selling second hand clothes for five years. She was introduced to KADET by existing borrowers and she has no previous credit history. The loan she receives will be used to add to her stock of second hand skirts and blouses for sale.

Margaret's area of business is in a busy market, and thus has a lot of customers who pass by through the market. With the extra profit, Margaret intends to open another stall.

Margaret hopes to be able to sell the clothes in wholesale one day, and believes she is hardworking.

About KADET: 
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: The loan will be used to add to her stock of second hand skirts and blouses for sale.

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Felicia is a 50-year-old woman. She is a widow and the mother of two children. She is a food vendor who sells kenkey in her neighborhood. Kenkey is prepared from milled maize grains, cooked and taken with hot pepper and fried fish. She has many customers since many people enjoy kenkey as breakfast, lunch and supper. She wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood. She hopes to raise more income to help her first child enter the university.

loans.use: To purchase maize and other ingredients.

loans.name: Phally

texts.en:
Mrs. Phally S., 39, is widow with two daughters (pictured here with her brother). She lives along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.  Both her daughters are garment factory workers. 

Phally has been a farmer since she was young. She grows corn. Besides of farming, she also sells fruit (mangoes).. She is now requesting her first loan in the amount of $600 to purchase mangoes on contract for resale.

loans.use: To purchase mangoes on contract for resale.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.en:
Miguel L. is 42 years old and is married to Delia Escobar, who is 34 years old. They have 4 children, all of whom are in high school.

Miguel began his business in 1993 with the money he saved from his salary. When he started he had very few clients and very few products to sell, but his business has since grown to have a wide variety of products and a loyal and large clientele.

Miguel will use this loan to buy more merchandise to increase his stock.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
La señora Luz es socia del  Banco Comunal “24 de Junio”, vive en el distrito de Ilave, provincia de  de El Collao, en el departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 30 años de edad y es casada. Se dedica a la compra y venta de animales menores como: ovino y porcino.
La señora Luz estudiò secundaria completa y tiene 4 hijos.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 2 años atrás, y en su Banco Comunal su primer préstamo fuè de  S/.500.00 nuevos soles el mismo que le sirvió para la compra de animales.

Ella solicitará un préstamo de S/.1500.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que lo invertirá en la compra de un toro.

Su deseo para el futuro es comprar una casa en Tacna y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
Lo que màs le gusta de su organización es el ahorro.
texts.en:
Mrs. Luz is a member of the communal bank "24 of June", she lives in the district de Ilave, El Collao province in the Puno department. She is 30 years old and married. She works selling and buying smaller animals like sheep and pigs. Mrs. Luz completed high school and has 4 children. She has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for two years now, and in her communal bank her first loan was for S/.500.00 nuevos soles, which she used to buy animals. She will request a loan for S/. 1,5000.00 nuevos soles which she will invest in buying a bull. Her hope for the future is to buy a house in Tacna and that her children become professional. What she likes the best about her organization is the savings.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying a bull

loans.name: Maria Lourdes

texts.es:
La  Señorita María Lourdes O. González, tiene la edad de 20 años, Labora como Educadora en el Mercado Oriental de Managua, ella tiene un hijos a su cargo, este se encuentran  en edad escolar, es Soltera, ha trabajado créditos con  CEPRODEL durante un años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido 1 créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamientos otorgados por CEPRODEL,  el es un cliente excelente.
 
El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción. El que utilizara para la remodelación y cambio del techo de la vivienda en la que habita, con el objetivo de darle mayor seguridad y mejores condición de vida a su hijo.
texts.en:
Señorita María Lourdes O. González is 20 years old, and works as a teacher in the Eastern Market of Managua. She has one school-aged son, she is single, and she has worked with loans with CEPRODEL for a few years. Over this period of time, she has invested one loan in the improvement of the home in which she lives, thanks to the financing granted by CEPRODEL. She is an excellent customer.

The requested loan is to be able to invest in the purchase of construction materials. She will use it for remodeling and changing the roof on the home in which she lives, with the objective to give better security and improved life conditions to her son.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of construction materials.

loans.name: Ieni

texts.en:
Ieni P. is 20 and single with no children.  She owns a business venture, raising cattle for sale.  Ieni has many years of experience in this business.  Ieni needs a loan of WST $1500 to expand shelter for the borrower's livestock.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 800 tala or US $333 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2008, Ieni joined SPBD.    This is her 2nd loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Ieni's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Ieni P. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.5 out of 3
Level of Education:                              2 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         2 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              2 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to expand shelter for the borrower's livestock

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en: Zenaida recently joined CEVI to expand her business opportunities. She said she likes its program and sees it as a big opportunity for farmers like her who lack capital for their businesses. At 53, she still wants to provide for her family. She has six children with her husband Nestor. She wants to grow her farm so that even her grandchildren could benefit from it.  She would like to request for a loan of 6,000 Philippine pesos. She will use it to buy farm supplies for her rice farm.

loans.use: Farm supplies

loans.name: German

texts.es:
El Sr. German tiene 31 años esta casado con la Sra. Carolina Candia  de 31 años que  es docente, poseen dos hijas que se encuentran estudiando en la escuela.
El señor anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de diarios, su hermano que es mecánico profesional lo llevo a trabajar con el enseñándole  la profesión, actualmente posee un taller mecánico con su  local propio con clientela formada. Para el futuro desea ampliar su taller comprando mas herramientas ya que cuenta con muchos clientes.
El préstamo que solicito fue invertido en la compra  de lubricantes, aceites para camiones etc.
texts.en:
Mr. German is 31 years old and is married to Mrs. Carolina Candia who is 31 years old and is a teacher; they have two daughters that go to school. German used to sell newspapers; his brother, who is a professional mechanic, took him to his work and taught him the trade. German now has a repair shop in his own establishment with many customers. In the future, he wants to expand his shop by buying more tools since he has many customers. The loan he is requesting will be invested in buying lubricants, oil for trucks, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy lubricants, oil for trucks, etc.

loans.name: Janette

texts.en:
Janet G., 29, owns a small parcel of rice farmland. She is a farmer and at the same time a retailer because she plants rice and sells various type of goods in Norralah South Cotabato. She has only one child, who is two years old. The business really helps her provide the basic needs in their home.

She hopes to receive a loan of PHP 15,000 from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. She will use the loan to buy additional merchandise and farm supplies.

loans.use: To buy additional merchandise and farm supplies

loans.name: Pir

texts.ru: Олимов Пир проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 48 лет. Женат, имеет 9 детей. У него средне- специальное образование. Более 13 лет занимается животноводством. Разводит скот у себя дома. Сыновья вместе с ним занимаются животноводством. Кредит берет для закупа крупно- рогатого скота, чтобы увеличить их количества.
texts.en:
Pir O. lives close to Yavan. He is forty-eight years old, married with nine children. He is a trade school graduate. He has been raising cattle for over thirteen years at his home. His sons are involved in the business as well. He is asking for a loan to purchase more cattle to increase the sales of his livestock.

Translated from Russian by Susan Savkov, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Yory

texts.en:
Mrs. Yory Y. is 62 years old and she is a villager who lives in Roboah Angkanh village in Kandal province. She and her husband, Mr. Bich Khoem, are able to earn a living through their farm crops. Her husband is shown on the right in the photo.

Mrs. Yory Y. is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which she grows crops. In this farming, she does not have enough money to support her farm crops. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and gasoline to support her purpose.

Mrs. Yory Y. is the mother of four children: one is a seamstress in the garment factory, one is a farmer who supports the parents’ farming, while the other two are students in the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and gasoline for her farm

loans.name: Ngoné

texts.fr: Ngonéy D. est une femme de 37 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants en charge. Depuis 7 ans et demi elle est membre du Banc Villageois de DANKH SENE dont elle fait partie du comité de gestion, et y a reçu 15 crédits qu'elle a bien gérés et remboursés à temps. Elle est vendeuse de céréales, d'arachide et de sucre. Son objectif est de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ngonéy D. is 37 years old, married and the mother of four children under her care. She has been a member of the local “Banc Villageois” loan group for the past 7 ½ years, is part of its management committee, and has been granted 15 credit loans, all well managed and reimbursed on time. She sells grain cereals, peanuts and sugar. Her objective is to assist her husband in taking care of her family.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Better develop and promote her commercial activity

loans.name: Némè

texts.fr: Cette dame est une veuve et est mère de 3 enfants, afin de subvenir à leurs charges, elle s’est lancée en 2005  dans le commerce de céréales qui sont très utilisées dans la cuisine togolaise. Son dynamisme fait qu’elle gagne tous les jours de nouveaux clients. Elle s’approvisionne à l’intérieur du pays plus précisément dans la ville de notsè. Voulant gonfler son stock de marchandises elle sollicite de WAGEs un crédit pour l’achat  de 8 sacs de maïs, 3 sacs d’haricots , 1 sac et demi de mil et assurer le transport de la marchandises.
texts.en:
This lady is widowed with 3 children and, in order to provide for her family, began a business in 2005 selling cereals that are widely used in Togolese cuisine. Her energy has resulted in her earning new clients everyday. She gets her supplies in the interior of the country, more specifically in the town of Notsè. Wanting to increase her stocks of merchandise, she is seeking a loan through WAGES (one of Kiva's field partners) to buy 8 bags of maize, 3 bags of beans, and one-and-a-half bags of millet, and to pay for the transportation of these goods.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cereals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy children's clothes.

loans.name: Yaceli Yaqueline

texts.es:
Yaceli tiene 22 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene hijos, vive en casa de sus padres ubicada en el caserío Monte Sullón del distrito de Catacaos, un distrito conocido por las artesanías y por los sombreros de palma que fabrican sus habitantes. Pertenece a la región Piura y se encuentra ubicado a más de dos horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace un año a la venta de ropa al crédito y al contado en su propio caserío, ella compra su mercadería en las ciudades de Chiclayo o Lima y lo distribuye entre sus clientes. También trabaja en base a pedidos. Este negocio es una fuente importante de ingresos para su familia, por lo que trata de mantenerla de la mejor manera posible.

Yaceli es encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que planea invertir en la compra de ropa para la estación de invierno, sus clientes le han solicitado diversas prendas de vestir para esta temporada.

Yaceli es una joven trabajadora y bastante responsable, su mayor anhelo es poder contar con una casa propia para poder vivir junto a los suyos.
texts.en:
Yaceli is 22 years old and single with no children. She lives in her parents' house, which is located in the Monte Sullón area of the Catacaos district, which is known for its handicrafts and the palm hats produced by its inhabitants. It is part of the Piura region, more than two and a half hours from the city of Chiclayo. For the past year, Yaceli has worked selling clothing for cash and credit to customers living in her area. She buys her merchandise in the cities of Chiclayo or Lima and distributes it to her clients. She also takes customer orders for merchandise. This business is an important source of income for her family, so she is trying to maintain it as effectively as possible. Yaceli is requesting a loan for the first time from Edpyme Alternativa, in the amount of 2000 Peruvian new soles, which she plans to invest in buying clothing for the winter season [June-September]. Her customers have asked her for a range of clothing items for this season. Yaceli is a hard-working and very responsible young woman; her greatest desire is to be able to have a house of her own where she can live with her loved ones.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expanding her inventory with clothing for the winter season

loans.name: Norinisso

texts.en:
Norinisso A. is 52 years old. She is married and has two children. Norinisso has been running a grocery store for the past 10 years. She sells sweets, preserved food, juices, soft drinks and also detergents in her grocery. The inventory she has for sale is of very good quality and selection. 

Norinisso is respectful and patient with all of her customers which attracts people and brings them back to her vending facility to buy groceries again. Norinisso is seeking to keep her business sustainable and has requested a loan of 4500 Somoni to increase the inventory she has for sale. We believe this current loan will enhance the potential of her business and help Norinisso reach all of her aspirations.     


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing goods for resale

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena B. is from the village of Gampis, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 57 years old, married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Magdalena owns and operates a business venture in the food sector, running a fish selling business. Magdalena has been engaged in her business for 23 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities. 

In 2008, Magdalena joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Magdalena has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Magdalena is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Magdalena from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her fish selling business.

loans.name: Rehana Kosar

texts.en:
Rehana Kosar lives in an area called Ismail Nagar which is located in the city Lahore in Pakistan. There, she has a two-roomed brick house where she lives with her family. 

Rehana is a vigorous lady. She runs a boutique from her home. Her daughter assists her in her work. She takes orders from her community and fulfills them to earn an income. She imports clothes from Faisalabad which is famous for its textile industry. Then, she offers the services of sewing and applying good designs on the clothes to her customers which gives the clothes good presentation and variety and helps her to attract more customers.  

Rehana wants to expand her business on larger scale. She sells her variety of clothes in different boutiques as well as from her home. This can only happen when she buys more material, such as clothes, laces and beads, in bulk. Therefore, she has applied for a loan from Asasah.  She is hopeful that, with the loan amount, she will be able to expand her business. This will result in an increase of her monthly income and it will increase her customer base as well.

loans.use: To purchase materials and supplies for boutique business.

loans.name: Bwanda Bakyara Kwetungura, Rukungiri Group

texts.en:
A supportive, hard working and widowed, B. Lydia, aged 54 years, is a mother of 7 children. She has been operating a retail shop business from Bwanda Trading centre in Rukungiri. In the shop, she is selling general merchandise especially for home use, such as: basins, jerrycans, buckets, grocery, sugar, salt and more. She started this business 10 years ago from her previous farming enterprise. At the end of every month she is able to pocket profits to the tune of 185,000 Ugandan shillings. 

Her main drawback has been having too little stock in her business, therefore not matching  the purchasing rate of her customers. Lydia is seeking a loan that she figures will help her stock more goods that will satisfy the customers’ high demand. She feel that this will also transform her enterprise into a big enterprise. 

Being very committed to the business with good customer care, she hopes to increase her sales revenue. This will bring about a transformation for her business and enable her to achieve a self sustaining life. She hopes to cater to her family's requirements, especially to fulfill her dream of educating her grandchildren. She further looks at buying herself a plot of land where she can set up her own business premises.

loans.use: To purchase of more inventory for business.

loans.name: Hashem

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 26 years old and is a married man with two children.

Since 2003 he has owned a garage where he fixes cars although the place is rented. He is well known in his local community and has good manners.

He is requesting a loan of $2,100 from Kiva partner, CHF-ACSI, which he wants to invest in renovating his garage and buying a scanner machine for cars.

He is working on developing his business and increasing his revenues.

loans.use: To renovate his garage and buy a scanner machine

loans.name: Nguyễn

texts.en: N. Nguyễn Thị (20201030007) is a 45-year-old female living in the town of Huyện Yên Phong, Bắc Ninh province. She is married and has three adult children. N. owns and operates a food stall, primarily selling rice products in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over twelve years and earns approximately 5,000,000 VND a month. In 2007, N. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,392,000 VND from SEDA. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding her business. N. is now requesting a new loan of 9,632,000 VND which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. The loan will be her 5th from SEDA. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About SEDA: The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide micro-finance services to the low-income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. ***************************************************** N. Nguyễn Thị (20201030007) là 45 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh. Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 3 trẻ ở độ tuổi trưởng thành. Để kiếm sống, N. Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh. Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm. Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các sản phẩm từ gạo trong cộng đồng địa phương. N. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 12 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, N. kiếm được khoảng 5.000.000 VND một tháng. Vào 2007, N. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. N. đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng đầu tư mở rộng công việc kinh doanh. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 9.632.000 VND. Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua thêm hàng hóa tồn kho & vốn lưu động. Khoản vay sẽ là 5th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA. N. dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh hỗ trợ tài chính cho các thành viên gần gũi trong gia đình của người vay. Về SEDA: Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Grupo Del Sol Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama Grupo del Sol,y el grupo escogió este nombre por la grandeza que representa este cuerpo celeste,además de que en su familia ellas son el centro donde gira su entorno familiar.Este grupo se encuentra en el Estado de Hidalgo, el grupo está conformado por 11 integrantes y están en el 5to ciclo en CrediComún. Eleane Ramírez Hernández es la presidenta del grupo. Tiene 34 años, es casada, estudió hasta la Secundaria, es comerciante y tiene en total 3 hijos.Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa, zapatos y perfumes.La Señora Eleane tiene 14 años con la venta de estos artículos y solicita el préstamo para una mayor adquisición de su producto, y así poder acreditar más su negocio para ofrecer a sus clientes una mayor variedad y con esto elevar sus ventas. Sus clientes nos comentan que la Señora Eleane Ramírez Hernández es una excelente vendedora ya que realiza visitas a las casas de sus vecinas, les da seguimiento además de buenos precios y diferentes formas de pago. Soledad Lázaro Pérez tiene 65 anos, es divorciada, estudio solo la primaria y tiene 2 hijas ya mayores. Se dedica a la crianza de ganado bobino y porcino el cual lo comenzó hace 7 años, además de ser empleada de sanitaR. públicos en la localidad.La señora Soledad solicito el crédito para invertir en su criadero ya que por su edad quiere darle la mayor atención posible puesto este negocio será su principal sustento en una vida futura.
texts.en:
This group is called 'Group of the Sun'. The group chose it's name for the greatness the this celestial body represents and also for the fact that in their families, they are the center around with their families revolve. This group is located in the state of Hidalgo. The group is comprised of 11 members who are in the 5th loan cycle with CrediComún. Eleane Ramírez Hernández is the president of the group. She is 34 years old and married. She attended school thru secondary school. She is a merchant and has 3 children in total. She is dedicated to the sale of clothes, shoes and perfumes. Señora Eleane has been selling these articles for 14 years. She requests a loan to purchase her products wholesale and thus to be able to build her business, offer her clients a greater variety and increase her sales. Her clients tell us that Señora Eleane Ramírez Hernández is an excellent saleswoman since she visits the houses of her neighbors, providing service and not only good prices but also different forms of payment. Soledad Lazarus Pérez is 65 years of age. She is divorced, only attended school through grade school and already has 2 grandaughters. She is dedicated to the breeding of cattle and hogs, which she began 7 years ago. In addition she is an employee of the public sanitation department in the area. Señora Soledad requests the loan to invest in her cattle, since at her age she wants to give the most attention possible to this business which will be her main source of income in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in raising cattle that will settle their future. .

loans.name: Jocelyn's Group

texts.en:
Jocelyn S. is from the village of Villa Concepcion, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 38 years old. Jocelyn is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Jocelyn is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Jocelyn owns & operates a retailing business selling fruits and vegetables. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of fruits and vegetables in the local community. Jocelyn is just starting this business.

In 2010, Jocelyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jocelyn is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Jocelyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Benita Dolores

texts.es: La Sra. Benita es dueña de casa y es Divorciada, vive con un sus dos hijos menores una esta en la universidad y el otro esta en el colegio La Sra. cuenta con un puesto en alquiler en una comercial donde se dedica a la venta de accesorios para celulares , celulares y además de servicio técnico en ese lugar la competencia es fuerte pero ella ya tiene sus clientes además esta abriendo una sucursal en Departamento del Beni ya que su hijo mayor se fue a vivir a ese departamento, Anteriormente la Sra. tenia una venta de abarrotes y hace un año que se dedica a esta nueva actividad y ella indica que le va mejor que antes es una persona muy responsable que además se hizo cargo de una deuda de una amiga a la que ella garantizo, con el dinero del crédito desea comprar cargadores de celular al por mayor.
texts.en:
Sra. Benita owns her home. She is divorced and lives with her two younger children. One is in university, the other in high school.

Sra. Benita rents a stand in a commercial area where she is engaged in the sale of cell phone accessories, cell phones and, in addition, technical service. Competition in that place is strong, but she already has customers and is also opening a branch in the Department of Beni since her eldest son is leaving to live in that department.

Previously, Sra. Benita had a grocery shop, and for a year she has been engaged in this new business. She states that things are going better than before. She is a very responsible person and has also taken charge of a friend’s debt which she has guaranteed. With the money from the loan she wants to buy cell phone chargers at wholesale.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise (cell phone chargers)

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
El Señor Miguel G. de 62 años de edad esta casado hace 40 años con la Señora Casimira Caceres de 55 años de edad; el matrimonio tiene dos hijos todo mayor de edad y cada uno tiene formada su familia y viven en forma independiente.
Don Miguel se dedica a la carpinteria desde hace 16 años y su señora tiene un pequeño almacen y juntos se ayudan para llevar adelante los gastos familiares y por ende mejorar el nivel de vida que llevan.
Solicita este préstamo para la compra de maderas,  terciadas  clavos, gaseosas, bebidas, golosinas, arroz, fideos, harina, azucar, yerba y otros articulos que comercializa en su negocio, ya que está llegando fin de año y tiene que prepararse para cumplir con todos los que tiene ya  sea en su carpinteria y almacén.
texts.en:
Miguel G. is 62 years old and has been married to his 55-year-old wife, Casimira Caceres, for 40 years. They have two children who are both adults and have their own families and live independently.

Miguel has worked in carpentry for 16 years and his wife has a small grocery store. They help each other with the household expenses and to therefore, improve their quality of life.

He is requesting this loan for the purchase of wood, plywood, hammers, sodas, drinks, snacks, rice, pasta, flour, sugar, maté, and other items sold in their store. The end of the year is approaching and he needs to prepare himself to meet all of the demands, both in his carpenter’s shop or grocery store.

loans.use: To purchase wood, plywood, hammers, drinks, sodas, pasta, rice

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: 16 De Julio Group

texts.es:
La Banca Comunal “16 DE JULIO” iniciará su  segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, en el Centro Focal de Santiago II.  Está compuesta por nueve integrantes.  La mesa directiva está integrada por la presidenta, tesorera y secretaria de actas. Los negocios que ellas desempeñan son variados: venta de mantas y frazadas, venta de medias, venta de condimentos, venta de flores, venta de adornos, tienda de barrio, tienda de Internet.

En el caso de la presidenta, señora E. tiene un hogar consolidado, casada, madre de cinco hijos,  tres mujeres y dos varones.  Con respecto al negocio, la señora E. produce y vende flores.  Ella aprendió este oficio de su madre hace más de veinte años atrás. La señora E. indica que compra flores que llegan al Mercado Rodríguez, pero que también trae flores que ella ha sembrado en los Yungas, para vender. 
Cuando se le consulta sobre lo que le gusta de Pro Mujer ella indica que le gusta el ahorro.
texts.en:
The “16 DE JULIO” ["July 16"] communal bank is starting its second loan cycle with Pro Mujer, at the Santiago II community office. It is made up of nine members. The executive board is composed of the president, treasurer and recording secretary. The businesses they pursue are varied: selling blankets and bedspreads; selling condiments; selling flowers; selling decorative items; running a neighborhood store; and operating an Internet café. 

In the case of the president, E., she has a stable household and is married with five children, three girls and two boys. With respect to her business, E. produces and sells flowers. She learned this profession from her mother more than 20 years ago. E. reports that she buys flowers which are brought to the Rodríguez Market, but she also sells flowers that she has grown in the Yungas [a forested area of Bolivia] to sell. 
When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says she likes the savings.

loans.use: Buying arapando, iris, nard and daffodil flowers and seeds

loans.name: Mirian Roxana

texts.es: Mirian Roxana M. A. de 30 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo y un hijo de 9 años de edad, junto a los cuales reside en la colonia Los Tulipanes en el departamento de Ahuachapán. Mirian es una persona muy  trabajadora, la cual se encarga de vender verduras en el mercado regional de Ahuachapán, lugar en el cual trabaja junto a su esposo. Ambos son dos personas muy responsables quienes se dedican en gran manera a su hogar y al bienestar de su hijo. Mirian solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de verduras y frutas, sobretodo tomates, chiles verdes y cebollas las cuales suben de precio en esta temporada de fin de año y así mismo su demanda se incrementan, lo cual pueda aprovechar al máximo.
texts.en:
Mirian Roxana M. A. is 30 years of age and lives with her husband and her nine year old son in the Los Tulipanes district, located in the department of Ahuachapán. Mirian is very hardworking and is in charge of selling vegetables in the Ahuachapán regional market, where she works alongside her husband. They are both very responsible and devoted to their home and the wellbeing of their son. 

Mirian is requesting a loan to buy a greater quantity of fruit and vegetables, above all tomatoes, green chillies and onions which rise in price at this time of year . As demand for them also rises, Mirian will be able to take full advantage of their sale.

loans.use: Purchase vegetables for resale

location.town: Colonia Los tulipanes, departamento de Ahuachapán

loans.name: María Sonia

texts.es: María Sonia B. D. M. D. 34 años D. edad, resiD. en Mejicanos en el departamento D. San Salvador, mismo lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposo, tres hijos menores D. edad, su hermana y dos sobrinos. María es una persona muy trabajadora quien posee su propio taller D. costura, así mismo se dedica a la venta y reparación D. máquinas D. coser, actividad la cual realiza junto a su esposo, quien venD. las máquinas D. cocer en el centro D. San Salvador. Así mismo María al elaborar ropa D. niños y ropa D. cama, sale a venderla en el centro D. San Salvador, en donD. la comercializa D. forma ambulante. María solicita un préstamo con el enorme deseo D. contar con mayor materia prima para elaborar las prendas D. vestir, así mismo para comprar más maquinas D. coser y algunos repuestos, así D. esta manera tanto María como su esposo esperan mejorar su negocio, el cual es la única fuente D. ingresos que poseen.
texts.en: María Sonia B. D. M. is 34 years old and lives in Mejicanos, in the San Salvador department of El Salvador. She lives with her husband, three young children, sister, and two nephews. María is a very hardworking person who owns her own sewing shop. She also repairs and sells sewing machines with her husband who sells them in downtown San Salvador. Additionally, María makes children's clothing and bedding. She sells these items on the streets in downtown San Salvador. María is requesting a loan with the enormous wish of obtaining more materials to make garments with and to buy more sewing machines and some spare parts. In this way, María and her husband hope to improve their business which is the only source of income they have.

loans.use: To buy fabrics to make clothing with, and to buy sewing machines to sell.

loans.name: Bugongi United Savings And Credit Group D-Kihihi

texts.en:
Julius T., 30, has been affiliated with Bugongi United Savings and Credit Group-Kihihi for the past 10 years. 

It is from his small farming business that this happily married father of two was able to set the balling rolling to create his current retail business. Hard work is what Julius is known for, and his diligence has been bringing in dividends. 

Julius sells a wide range of general merchandise retail items such as sugar, salt, beans, rice, etc. He does not have many of the aforementioned commodities in bulk, however, and he often runs out of stock because his operating capital is not yet at a sustainable level. 

Monthly, this business generates him 200,000 shillings, and with this loan, he says he is going to purchase more beans, bars of soap, sugar, etc., to resell.

loans.use: To purchase more beans, bars of soap, sugar, etc., to resell

loans.name: Davaamaa

texts.en:
Davaamaa, 40, is a widow and lives with her three sons in Uvurhangai province in Mongolia. Her older son goes to college and the younger two attend a local school. Now they live in a ger, a Mongolian housing tent, in someone's backyard close to the city center, since the land that they own is too far away. 

Davaamaa began selling animal hides in 1990. She purchases animal hides at the local market or from residents in the countryside that visit her. She sells them to larger wholesalers if she can collect enough daily. She owns a car and uses it for her business. She wishes to increase her working capital so that she can start a wholesale animal hides business in the future. Davaamaa is a hardworking and brave person whose wish is to become a successful businesswoman. 

She is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to purchase more animal hides so she can make more profit by selling them for a higher price.

loans.use: To purchase more animal hides

loans.name: Marisa

texts.en:
Marisa M. is from the village of New Calamba, Kalawit, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 38 years old. Marisa is married and has six adult children. To make a living, Marisa owns & operates a business selling pork products in the local community. Marisa has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Marisa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marisa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Marisa is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Marisa from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

location.town: Liloy-New Calamba, Kalawit, Zamboanga Del Norte

loans.name: Regina Nzilani

texts.en:
Regina B. is 57 years old and married to Kitheka who contributes to the family income.  She runs a retail shop and does farming. She has been in the business for a period of three years with an income of about KES. 5,000 per month.

This is her first loan from KADET LTD and she intends to use it to buy potatoes, maize and bean seedlings. She hopes to be a leading farmer in the future and improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: To buy potatoes, maize and bean seedlings

loans.name: Tserendulam

texts.en:
Tserendulam is 38 years old and a widow who lives with her three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They all live in a small wooden house on her brother’s plot of land. She has been operating a tailoring business for the last 5 years and now she has six sewing machines, employs two tailors, and sells her products to companies or persons by contract. Her older two sons are attending a local secondary school and the youngest son goes to kindergarten. 

Tserendulam is an open person who has very good communication skills and is providing a good education for her children all by herself. She  is grateful to those responsible for making her dream come true, so she promises to complete her  payments by the established deadlines. She is requesting a 1.500.000 MNT loan to increase her working capital by purchasing another sewing machine and a steam iron from Ereen, the border city of China, because it is cheaper than to buy them in Mongolia.

loans.use: to purchase another sewing machine and a steam iron

loans.name: Nelly Maritza

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SANTA ROSITA DE AYLLUPAMPA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Nelly Maritza; ella tiene 25 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de golosinas y también a la crianza de animales como cuyes, la socia tiene una carreta donde vende diferentes golosinas como chupetes, galletas, gaseosas y chicles y la crianza de animales lo realiza en la provincia de Urubamba, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar los dos pequeños negocios que realiza. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar golosinas al por mayor y también comprar alimentos para los cuyes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Nelly Maritza belongs to the 'Santa Rosita de Ayllupampa' community bank which is located in Urubamba district, in Urubamba province, in Cusco department.

Nelly is 25 years old.  She lives with her partner and has 1 child.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her businesses selling candy and raising animals such as guinea pigs.  Nelly has a small cart where she sells different candy such as lollipops, cookies, soda and chewing gum.  She raises her animals in Urubamba province.  She would like to expand and improve her two small businesses.

Nelly is requesting a loan to buy candy wholesale.  She would also like to buy feed for her guinea pigs.  She is happy to be receiving this loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy candy wholesale and to buy feed for her guinea pigs

loans.name: Gédéon Plus Group

texts.en:
“Gédéon Plus” is a Community Bank made up of 11 micro entrepreneurs whose chairwoman is Lola Y.. These members are united for the same goal: to grow their businesses with loans received from Kiva through IMF HOPE RDC. 

Lola is 55 years old and single. She has been in business since 2002. She originally ran a restaurant. Today she sells lamp oil at her place located east of the city of Kinshasa. She likes her business because it allows her to become financially independent and has stabilized her family economically. 

Lola has been a loyal client of IMF HOPE RDC, and has already received six different loans and has repaid them properly. She intends to use the next loan to increase the inventory of her business by purchasing more oil in bulk.  She will resell it with the aim of increasing her profits. Each week, her business brings in a profit of $50.  Lola has three children between 8 and 34 years old. Two of them attend school.  Her ambition is to open an oil storage facility.

loans.use: to increase the inventory of her business by buying more lamp oil and reselling it at profit

loans.name: Virgen Del Carmen Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “VIRGEN DEL CARMEN”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito D. Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia D. Urubamba y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Salome; ella es casada y tiene 55 años y 6 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio D. venta D. chicha (bebida a base D. maíz) y también tiene una tierra D. cultivo donD. siembra maíz, repollo y asnapa y lo venD. en el mercado D. Urubamba y la chicha lo venD. en el poblado D. Huayocari,la socia quiere ampliar el negocio D. venta D. chicha y venta D. maíz, repollo y asnapa. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar maíz y jora para preparar la chicha y algunos fertilizantes para sus tierras D. cultivo.

Los otros socios  se dedican la venta D. verduras, agricultura, venta D. carne, obrero y ganadería. 

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte D. este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the “Virgen del Carmen” Communal Bank, located in the district and province of Urubamba in Cusco department.

Salome is married and 55 years old with 6 children. She makes and sells 'chicha' (a home-brew maD. from corn), and also has cultivated land where she sows corn, cabbage, and 'asnapa' (an herb). She sells her crops in the market at Urubamba and her chicha in the village of Huayocari. Salome wants to expand both her crops and her chicha business. She requests a loan to buy corn and the special 'jora' corn used in making chicha, and also fertilizers for her cultivated land.

The other members sell vegetables, practice agriculture, sell meat, work as laborers, and raise cattle.

The members are grateful for all who form a part of their dreams by this means, and they promise to comply with their payments as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy corn to prepare chicha, a local beer, and to buy fertilizers for her cultivated land.

loans.name: Damian

texts.en:
Damian is 38 years old and married. He has 2 children aged 13 and 6. Damian runs a business making and selling "balut". Balut is a boiled, fertilized egg and is very popular in the Philippines. Damian's business has been running for a year and three months. He said that so far it has been going well and that it has helped his family immensely.

Damian is planning to expand his "balut" business. He requested a loan of 50000 PHP from CEVI, a KIVA partner in the Philippines. He plans to use it to purchase more eggs. He also will use part of the loan to buy materials for making a bigger incubator for eggs. Damian hopes to have a progressive business.




“Asenso Loans are a new product offered by CEVI for clients showing strong performance in previous loans, and who need a larger loan in order to continue to develop.  CEVI recognises the importance of helping people out of poverty, as well as providing continuous support and training as these clients progress. CEVI aims to provide financial services, not only our poorest clients, but also to our developing clients who should be rewarded for the way in which they display promising business skills.  Please help us provide support for these clients.”

loans.use: to purchase more eggs and materials for making a "balut" incubator

loans.name: Anges

texts.en:
Anges is 54 years old. She has six children, ages 17 to 31 years old. They are all in school apart from the eldest.

Anges is a widow and she has overcome many challenges while raising her children. 

She sells different kinds of bags, most especially women's bags, and she has done this business for many years. This business has enabled her feed her family and meet all her children's needs.

Anges is requesting a loan to buy more bags and hence make more profits.

loans.use: to buy bags for resale.

loans.name: Muattar

texts.en:
Muattar is an honest woman. She is married and has three children. Her husband works as a dump-truck driver. Muattar engages dried fruit production. Her daughter helps her with this business. She tries to improve her living conditions and expand her business in order to make a good profit. That's why Muattar would like to get a loan of $1,500 USD for purchasing fresh apricots to process.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, as it served as a key post along the Silk Road and marked the end of Alexander the Great's extensive rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON’s History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy apricots to process

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “RICHARY ANTEÑA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Gladys; ella tiene 33 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de frutas como manzanas, naranjas, platanos entre otras frutas, la socia vende en forma ambulatoria y también la socia trabaja en la municipalidad de Anta en el área de camal, la socia por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de frutas. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar frutas al por mayor.
                                                        
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Gladys belongs to the “Richary Antena” communal bank, located in the province and district of Anta, in  Cusco department. 

Gladys is 33 years old, living with someone, and has 3 children. Daily, she sells fruit, such as apples, oranges, and plantains, among others, in the streets of her area and, also, in the Camal area of Anta municipality. Gladys is advancing her children by working in this manner.

Gladys wants to expand her fruit-selling business and she is requesting a loan to buy fruit at wholesale.

She is happy about the loan and promises to comply with the schedule of payments.

loans.use: buy fruit at wholesale to sell.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 38 years old, married and has five children. 

Mohamad has had a car workshop since 2003. He has a lot of experience in this field. He has a deep understanding of the local consumer and he is well known in his area.

He is requesting a $3,000 loan to buy a nozzle-cleaning machine and to make a sliding door and outdoor ceiling for his shop. He is optimistic about his business development and hopes that the coming years will continue to bring him positive growth.

loans.use: To buy a nozzle-cleaning machine and to make a sliding door and outdoor ceiling for his shop.

loans.name: Mariluz

texts.en: Mariluz is 27 years old and married with two children. She has two sons who are 8 and 10 years old. She is a housewife who takes care of her two boys and tends to the house. Mariluz is asking for a loan so that she can buy a vehicle for her family. They do not currently have a car and desire access to greater mobility that a new car would bring. She is committed to making all of the necessary loan payments on time.

loans.use: to buy a car for her family

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is 23 years old. He is a hardworking and born-again Christian who aspires to have a good life. For the last three years, he has been making a living by operating a motorcycle business. He makes an extra shilling from the salary he gets from his employment. He wants in the next five years to have ventured into other businesses so he becomes financially stable. He is requesting a loan of 30,000 Kenya shillings to buy a motorcycle. He is grateful to Faulu Kenya for empowering him financially and training him on business management skills.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Ceonaldo

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Boane, provincia de Maputo, sul de Moçambique, casado e pai de 1 filho que ainda não tem idade escolar. Fez a 7ª classe e parou para assumir a responsabilidade como pai, vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta sua mãe e seu irmão que vivem com ele. 

Nunca saiu da sua terra natal, é trabalhador do comite olimpico ha mais de 3 anos e  tem um salário de cerca de 3.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca fez emprestimo noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de um amigo que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu primeiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 12.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção DE UMA CASA PARA HABITACAO(pedra, barrotes, cimento, areia, e outros) para continuar com a sua obra.
Pretende concluir sua casa, e mobiliar pra ofercer conforto a sua familia, assim irá solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Ceonaldo was born in Boane, which is in Maputo Province in southern Mozambique. He is married and has a son who is not old enough to go to school yet. Ceonaldo finished seventh grade and quit school to take on his responsibilities as a father. He lives in his own house with his family and supports his mother and brother, who live with him.

He has never left his hometown. Ceonaldo has worked for the Olympic Committee for more than three years and earns about 3,000 meticais per month. He uses the money for household expenses and saves some in his bank account (at BIM).

He has never had loans from other banks, and he learned about Hluvuku through a friend who is also a customer of this institution. This is Ceonaldo's first Hluvuku loan, and he is asking for 12,000 meticais to buy construction materials (stone, beams, cement, sand and other items) so he can continue building his house.

He intends to finish the house and furnish it to make his family more comfortable, so he will ask Hluvuku for more loans.

loans.use: to buy home construction materials (stone, beams, cement, sand, etc.).

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Hilda nació en la provincia de Urubamba (Cusco, Perú), ella tiene 24 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo, Actualmente, ella vive en la misma ciudad donde nació y donde realiza sus actividades, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa en unos de los centro comerciales de la ciudad de Urubamba. Ya son cinco años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo.

Hilda requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo ropa como por ejemplo jeans. El sueño de la socia es comprarse una casa.

El Banco Comunal “Nueva Visión de Urubamba” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad de Urubamba (Cusco,  Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Hilda was born in the province of Urubamba (Cusco, Peru). She is 24 and is in a common-law marriage. From this relationship, she has one child. Currently, she lives in the city where she was born and where she works. She sells clothing in one of the shopping centers of Urubamba city. She has had this business for five years and it is going very well for her thanks to the effort that she puts into her work.

Hilda needs this loan to purchase merchandise such as clothing; for example, jeans. Her dream is to buy herself a house.

The “Nueva Visión de Urubamba” ["New Vision of Urubamba"] meets every month in Urubamba city (Cusco, Peru). Cusco is known for being a very touristy area, as well as a business center. It is known for the traditional Inti Raymi festival and because it is home to one of the seven wonders of the world: Machu Picchu.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as clothing; for example, jeans.

loans.name: Marlim

texts.es: Marlim, natural de la ciudad de Santa Rosa, tiene 35 años, es una mujer sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su propia casa junto a su esposo Jorge y su querida hija Jenifer de 10 años, a quien desea brindarle una mejor calidad de vida. Marlim y su pareja son el sustento de su familia. Ella desde muy niña sus padres le inculcaron a trabajar en la chacra,es así que posee su propia parcela donde cultiva café, cacao y achiote. Tiene 17 años trabajando en sus propias tierras, y lo que más le gusta es recolectar los frutos de las plantas; ya que así siente que los meses de arduo trabajo le brindan como recompensa la calidad de sus frutos. Considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos desde la chacra hasta los centros de acopio ubicados en las ciudades de Santa Rosa y san francisco, lugar donde le ofrecen mejores precios por sus productos. Su dificultad es no poder contar con suficiente ingreso económico para solventar los pagos por adelantado a los jornaleros quienes le brindan el apoyo quitanto la maleza que crece entre sus plantaciones. Es por ello que acude a los créditos que facilita la institución MFP, pero ahora lo que más prioriza es sembrar más plantas de café por que es una de las plantas con mayor demanda en los mercados. Este es será su segundo crédito  y  ha sido muy puntual en sus pagos anteriores y espera beneficiarse una vez más para pregresar en su negocio. Con los 2,000 nuevos soles, contratará jornaleros para que lo apoyen en  el desmonte de maleza.
texts.en:
Marlim, a native of the city of Santa Rosa, is 35 years old and is a sincere, hardworking woman. She lives in her own house with her husband, Jorge, and her dear daughter, Jennifer, 10, for whom she wishes to provide a better quality of life. She and her partner support the family. 

Ever since she was very young, Marlim’s parents taught her how to work in the fields. Thus she owns her own parcel where she cultivates coffee, cacao and annatto. She has been working her own land for 17 years and what she most enjoys is gathering the fruit from her plants because she feels that the months of arduous work have produced the reward of a high quality yield. The most difficult aspect of her work is transporting her crop from the field to the collection centers located in the cities of Santa Rosa and San Francisco, places that offer the best prices for her products.

Marlim’s other difficulty is that she does not have sufficient income to pay in advance the day laborers who provide help removing the weeds that grow in her fields. This is the reason she has taken out loans from MFP, however now her priority is to cultivate more coffee because it is one of the plants in greatest demand on the market. This will be her second loan and she has been very punctual in making her earlier payments. She hopes to benefit one more time in order to grow her business. This loan of 2,000 nuevos soles will enable her to hire day laborers to help her with the weeding.

loans.use: to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Solana Group

texts.en:
Jackline is the facilitator of the Solana group. Jackline and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Jackline and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Jackline takes care of seven children at home with her husband. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds to harvest more maize from her farm. In the recent 2011 season, Jackline had a very good maize yield, harvesting seven bags on ½ an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Jackline was only able to harvest four bags of maize on ½ acres of land

With income from maize sales, Jackline will educate her children and invest in raising livestock.

In 2012, the members of Solana group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1.5 acre of maize.

In the photograph above, Jackline is pictured with her group members and a few children of her co-group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Fifonsi Group

texts.fr: Le groupe FIFONSI est composé de douze personnes qui habitent dans le même village au Bénin. C'est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Micheline est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Micheline est âgée de 38 ans et est mariée à un technicien agricole du nom de Dieu-Donné. Le couple à deux enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Micheline vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la maison sont assurées par le couple. Pour y parvenir, Micheline mène comme activité la vente des produits cosmétiques. A côté de cette activité, Micheline vend des sucreries ( Bissap,Yaourt etc.). Micheline mène cette activité depuis vingt ans. Micheline s’approvisionne dans le plus grand marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Micheline sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe FIFONSI, un premier crédit.
texts.en: Fifonsi Group is made up of twelve people, all living in the same village in Benin. This is the first time that the group members came to the microfinance institution Alidé and applied for financial assistance in order to raise their activity level. The group is represented by Micheline, who is pictured raising her hand. She is 38 years old and married to Dieu-Donné, an agricultural operative. They have two children, both in their care and attending school. Micheline lives with her husband and their children. The parents share household expenses. To this end Micheline sells cosmetics and sweet products, such as hibiscus tea and yoghurt. Micheline has been in this activity for 20 years. She gets her supplies at the largest market in Benin. Eager to satisfy her clientele and increase her turnover and income, Micheline joins the other members of Fifonsi Group and applies for the group's first loan.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, sugar and hibiscus.

loans.name: Herminigildo

texts.en:
Herminigildo is 37 years old and married. He has three children.

Herminigildo works hard to provide for his family. He runs a firewood retail business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of firewood to sell.

Herminigildo has borrowed and paid 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. He has been running the firewood retail business for 10 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Herminigildo aspires to save enough money to expand his business and send his children to college.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks of firewood to sell.

loans.name: Dario

texts.es:
Darío es un padre ejemplar, a sus 61 años tiene 3 hijos de 17, 15 y 13 años. Hace 2 años que Vacelisa, su esposa falleció, desde entonces trabaja arduamente para evitar que a sus hijos les falte algo. Darío vive con sus hijos en una casita rústica pero propia en el anexo de Pumpuriani. Siempre se ha dedicado a las labores del campo, en sus 5 hectáreas de terrenos siembra café, plátanos, yuca y pituca. Además tiene otras 2 hectáreas que están sin producir.  En su ardua labor, sus 3 hijos lo ayudan, en la siembra, el cultivo, los riegos, y las cosechas.  “Sembrar café siempre me ha dado buen dinero, a pesar de que se cosechen cada 2 veces al año, pero vale la pena”, menciona Darío sobre la rentabilidad de su negocio. Señala, además que los problemas económicos han sido los obstáculos más difíciles que ha tenido que pasar, ya que muchas veces no le alcanzaba el dinero para comprar semillas de café y abonos. Aparte de la agricultura, Darío cuenta con una pequeña bodega en su hogar, ahí expende productos varios, pero que urge implementar y surtir.
Con los ingresos que obtenga de las cosechas, éste padre luchador podrá comprar muebles para la tienda y más productos para su venta, así se asegurará más clientela.  Con éste serían 6 los préstamos que Darío obtiene de MFP, y para que él pueda sobresalir junto a su familia, le es urgente su ayuda. Por otro lado se siente a gusto trabajando con “Las Abejitas de Pumpuriani”, nombre de su banco comunal, que hace referencia a su inagotable labor como grupo. Con el dinero del crédito, Darío comprará semillas de café para preparar los viveros para ello deberá enriquecer la tierra con abonos orgánicos, así avizora la cosecha para abril y mayo. Aproximadamente gastará solo en abonos 800 soles.
texts.en:
61-year old Darío is a wonderful father to his three children aged 17, 15, and 13. His wife Vacelisa died two years ago, and since then he has worked hard to ensure that his children lack for nothing. He lives with his children in a simple house that belongs to him in an area adjacent to Pumpuriani. 

Darío has always worked in agriculture. On his five hectares of land he grows coffee, bananas, yucca, and pituca. He also has another two hectares which are lying fallow. His three children help him with the work: planting, tending, watering, and harvesting the crops. “Growing coffee has always provided me with a good income despite having to harvest twice a year,” says Darío when talking about the profitability of his work, “but it’s worth the trouble.” He says overcoming financial issues has been his biggest problem as on occasion he hasn’t been able to afford to buy coffee plants and fertilizer. 

 As well as his fields, Darío has a small store in his home where he sells various products. It urgently needs more stock. 

With the income from his harvests, this hardworking father will be able to buy furnishings for his store and more items to sell which, in turn, will bring in more customers. As well, he will have his sixth loan from MFP with which he and his family will be able to get ahead. He enjoys working with Las Abejitas de Pumpurani (the name of his community bank), and the tireless work the group has done. 

He plans to buy coffee seedlings and manure to enrich the soil with the loan money so he can look forward to a good harvest in April and May. The manure alone will cost about 800 soles.

loans.use: to buy coffee seedlings and bags of manure

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
