Maria is a hard-working woman who gets up very early to milk the cows and deliver milk to the station in the area. She also farms, growing onions and carrots in certain seasons. She is devoted to her work but does not neglect her son’s upbringing, and consistently supports him in his schooling. Her dream is for her son to enroll in the university to complete his studies. She wants him to study medicine and thus be able to help the people in the community where they live. It is an isolated area whose inhabitants struggle to make a living. She is asking for a loan to purchase cattle and thus increase milk production and deliver more to the station. This will enable her to increase her earnings and provide a better future for her son and make her father more comfortable in his old age. He always worked for her brothers and for her, and that is why she strives to be better each day.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de una cabeza de ganado lechero

loans.name: Harrison

texts.en:
Harrison is married and has two children whom he supports. His wife runs a business which is able to give her a monthly income.

Harrison has been in the hardware business for 10 years and he is servicing a third loan with KADET LTD. He is not in any other Micro Finance. Harrison will use the loan to purchase hardware items like timber. With the extra profits, he will renovate some rental rooms so as to maximize rental income.

Harrison hopes to ensure that he can be able to have rental income as a main source of income for his family.

loans.use: Loan will be used to purchase items like timber.

loans.name: Eduviges

texts.en:
Eduviges is a member of the Communal Bank "Great Power", located in the district of Ilave, in the province of Collao, and the department of Puno. She is 35 years old, married with one son, and completed her secondary education.

Eduviges has worked with Manuela R. for five years. The first loan she got was for 300 PEN, which she used to increase the capital of her grocery-selling business. She is now requesting a loan of 1,5000 PEN to expand her business. Her dreams are to fill her store with a diversity of products and to have a butcher's stall.

Eduviges enjoys working with the communal bank due to its organization and the savings it has helped make possible.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Comlanvi

texts.fr: comlanvi est un homme marié et père de 3 enfants, pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille, il a ouvert sa propre boutique de vente de produits d'alimentation générale qu'il a appelé "MAWULOLO". il s'approvisionne dans les marchés locaux de Lomé. il a une façon très attirante d'accueillir sa clientèle. les périodes de fête de fin d'année approche et il souhaiterai augmenter son stock pour bien vendre, il sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 3 sacs de riz, 5 sacs de spaghetti, 3 bidons d'huile, 1 carton de tomate en conserve et divers autres produits d'alimentation générale
texts.en: Comlanvi is married and the father of three children. To provide for his family, he opened his own grocery store which he calls "Mawulolo" ("God is great" in Ewe). He gets his supplies at the local markets in Lomé. He has a pleasant character and easily attracts and welcomes customers. Since the end-of-year celebrations approach, he wants to increase his inventory and get a better turnover. He came to the microfinance institution WAGES and applied for a loan to buy 3 sacks of rice, 5 sacks of spaghetti, 3 cans of oil, 1 box of canned tomatoes and various other grocery products.

loans.use: To buy grocery products

loans.name: Seraphine

texts.en: Seraphine is 28 years old. She is married and has one child who is three months old. Her husband works as a farmer. Seraphine sells a variety of merchandise in her shop and she has been doing this business for one year. She would like to get this loan to buy more milk, bread, pineapple, rice, and saucepans to sell. She is proud of her business because it has allowed her to purchase land for cultivation and other basic needs. The profit from this business will be used to help with the family expenses. She hopes to own a big shop and a milling machine in the future.

loans.use: To buy more milk, bread and rice to sell.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es:
El señor Ricardo vive en anticretico en la zona de San Martín de la ciudad de La Paz esta casado y tiene tres hijos; es poseedor de un vehiculo (Taxi) con el cual trabaja todos los días generando ingresos.

El crédito que solicita es para reparar el motor de su vehiculo y de esta manera mantener estable sus ingresos y dar una mejor vida a su familia.

Es cliente de Impro y paga muy bien por el carácter social califica para obtener un crédito.
texts.en:
Ricardo lives under the anticrético modality (Anticrético is a transaction whereby a property owner requests a "loan" from you in exchange for housing, which must be paid back to you at the end of your contract. If your loan is not repaid, the property owner loses the property to you) in La Paz’s San Martín zone.  He is married and has three children.  He has a taxi that he works in every day generating income.

He is asking for a loan to repair his vehicle’s motor so that he can keep his source of income stable and provide a better life for his family.

He is a good paying client of Impro and his socioeconomic profile qualifies his for a loan.

loans.use: To pay repair costs for his taxi's motor.

loans.name: Jessielene

texts.en:
Jessielene N. is from the village of Francfort, Bumbaran, Lanao del Sur. She is 34 years old. Jessielene is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Jessielene owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods and snack foods in the local community. Jessielene has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Jessielene joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jessielene has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and increase working capital. Jessielene is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP that will be used to purchase additional products to sell like snack foods and biscuits. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Jessielene from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell like snack foods and biscuits

loans.name: Bonifacia

texts.en:
Bonifacia E. is from the village of Mandih. She is 64 years old, and a widow with four children. Bonifacia is a group member of PMPC. To make a living, Bonifacia owns and operates a fish vending business. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of products in the local community.

Bonifacia has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2008, Bonifacia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Bonifacia is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be Bonifacia's sixth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support the immediate members of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For additional capital to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Ruzijon

texts.en:
Ruzijon is married and has two children. She runs a small store selling candies and sweets. The store is located on the first floor of a big apartment building which provides easy access for her clientele. She has been in this business for 6 years. 

Ruzijon is very cheery and optimistic. Her store faces high competition as there are many supermarkets in the neighborhood. However, her customer-friendly service and the individual attention she can give help her keep loyal customers. Her responsibility and perseverance have helped Ruzijon repay all loans she has received from IMON International successfully. 

Ruzijon is requesting a loan of $1500 US for a couple of purposes. She is going to do some remodeling work inside her vending facility and she’d like to increase the assortment of products she has available. This loan will help Ruzijon expand her business, having a positive impact on her trade profitability, and helping to further improve the economic and social situation of her family.  
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing candies to expand inventory; remodeling store

loans.name: Kong's Group

texts.en:
These four people form a group loan; they are located in Preaek Traeng village in Kandal province.  

Mr. Kong P. was born in 1963 and he was selected as the group leader by the other members.  He is a farmer who owns a plot of land which he uses to cultivate rice that he sells to support his family.  In order to support his farming, he would like to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticides and gasoline for cultivating rice.  His wife, Mrs. Un Savén is a fishing seller in the market who is able to earn a little income to support her family. 

This couple has four children: one of whom is a car driver and the other three are students in the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticides and gasoline for cultivating rice.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace M. is from the village of Kinura, Kalilangan, Bukidnon. She is 28 years old. Mary Grace is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Mary Grace owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products, such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods & toothpaste, in the local community. Mary Grace has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Mary Grace joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Grace has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Mary Grace is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell, like beverages & snack foods. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Mary Grace from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand  her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell, like beverages & snack foods

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Doña Mercedes, de 56 años de edad, reside en Jucuapa departamento de Usulután, vive con su esposo y tiene 4 hijos de las edades 33, 28, 24, 21 años de edad, los dos hijos mayores viven fuera en sus propios hogares y los últimos dos dependen aun de sus ingresos.
Doña Mercedes tiene un negocio de granja y comercialización de pollos de engorde, está pendiente de ellos todos los días de la semana y a cualquier hora, por el momento solicita un préstamo para la compra de concentrado, vacunas y más pollos, esta inversión le ayudara a fortalecer la granja, aumentando su número de pollos y manteniéndoles la alimentación necesaria.
Ella aspira continuar en esta labor, poder tener otra granja al mismo tiempo para albergar más pollos y tener la oportunidad de ser mayorista en un futuro.
texts.en:
Mercedes is 56 years old.  She lives in Jucuapa, in Usulután department, with her husband.  She has 4 children aged 33, 28, 24 and 21.  Her two eldest children live in their own homes and the youngest two are still dependent on her income.

Mercedes has a business raising and selling chickens.  She works with them every day of the week.  Mercedes is currently requesting a loan to buy concentrated animal feed, vaccines and more chickens.  This investment will help her to strengthen her farm, increase her number of chickens and provide them with the necessary feed.

Mercedes aspires to continue in this business.  She hopes to have another farm and house more chickens.  She hopes to become a wholesaler in the future.

loans.use: To buy concentrated animal feed, vaccines and more chickens.

loans.name: Zahida's Group

texts.en:
Zahida belongs to Jaranwala which is a small city of Punjab, Pakistan, known for its agriculture industry. She has been living there in a 2-room brick house with her family for the past 14 years. She is a caring lady and carries out her responsibilities of a housewife very well. She has given birth to five children. All of them are enrolled in a local school and getting their education. 

Her husband’s name is A. R. and he runs a garment shop in the market where he sells children's and ladies' garments to his customers. He is very good in customer relations and treats his customers with great respect. That’s why he has built up a good customer base, people buy garments from him regularly. 

Zahida has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s garment businesses. Through the loan, he will buy more garments for his shop which will allow him to earn more profits by increasing his sales. He has been operating this business for the past five years and Zahida is very confident about its growth in result of investment. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 4th loan application. She is a responsible client and has maintained a good credit record in every loan year. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Zahida.

loans.use: To buy garments for resale.

loans.name: María José

texts.es:
María José C., es soltera con un hijo en edad escolar al que tiene el deber de mantener en sus estudios. Se dedica a atender su propio desde hace 5 años en la ciudad de Managua.
Desde que inicio el negocio doña María se ha caracterizado por ser una persona esforzada y eficiente, ella inicio su negocio vendiendo ambulante  y desde entonces a mantenido su negocio y su núcleo familiar gracias a sus múltiples esfuerzo. Una de las necesidades que atraviesa ella es la urgencia de comprar los productos de su negocio como lo son; ropa y productos de la avon, vogue, entre otros. Es  por este motivo que acude a cerpodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito que le permita comprar los productos a sus proveedores y así continuar comercializándolos para satisfacer las demanda de sus clientes con el único fin de obtener los ingresos para mantener su hogar  continuar brindándole la educación a su única hija.  Es primera vez que solicita crédito con ceprodel.
texts.en:
Maria Jose C. is single with a school-age child that she is expected to support whilst at school. For the last 5 years she has run her own business in the city of Managua. Since starting her business Maria has proven to be a hard working and efficient person. She started off with a street vending business and has since managed to keep it up, as well as her family life, with a lot of hard work. 

At the moment she urgently needs to buy products for her business, such as clothing and Avon and Vogue goods, amongst others. She's come to CEPRODEL to ask for a loan that will enable her to buy these products from her suppliers, so as to be able to continue to sell them to satisfy her customers' demand. This will generate income to support her family and continue to provide her daughter with an education. This is her first loan request with CEPRODEL.

loans.use: to buy clothing and Avon and Vogue products.

loans.name: Randa

texts.en: Randa K. is 33 years old.  She's currently in the business of hotel service.  She's married to a teacher, and they have six children, all of whom are in school.   Her future goal is to build a good house.

loans.use: Stock more Foods.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, beans, pastas, crackers, deli meats, and eggs.

loans.name: Nora Grace

texts.en:
Nora Grace is 45 years old and still single. She has been raising hogs for over five years now. Her income in the business is of great support to her parents. With her hard work, she is able to generate at least PHP 3,500 when she sells one of her raised hogs.

She is asking for a loan of PHP 40,000 to buy a stock of feed and to vaccinate her piglets. Nora Grace wishes to maintain her business and continuously improve it to help her parents improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy feed and vaccinate her piglets

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with two school-going children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past two years, she has operated a fish selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. Fatuma dreams of expanding her business and selling at wholesale in the future. 

With the 15,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) she wants to purchase bundles of fish for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of fish for sale.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 34 years old, and has a 3-year-old child with her husband Andrew. For the past 3 years she has been operating a retail shop in Tala town. She gets a profit margin of KES 8,000 per month.

With her first loan from KADET LTD Janet plans to buy more washing detergent, cooking oil, maize flour, salt, sugar, soft drinks, and matchboxes to sell.  She plans to use the anticipated profits to start selling cereals and to pay her children’s school fees. In the future she hopes to grow her business and own a wholesale shop in Tala town.

loans.use: to buy more washing detergent, cooking oil, maize flour, salt, sugar, soft drinks, and matchboxes to sell.

loans.name: Israel

texts.en:
Israel describes his business, "C. Collision and Auto Repair", as a family affair. The staff is comprised of Israel, his father and his brother. With a true entrepreneurial spirit, he states that the reason for starting his business was, simply, that “nobody was hiring.” With combined 40 years of experience, Israel and his family were able to take the grim reality of the economic downturn and turn it into a business opportunity.

The road to a successful business, Israel says, hasn’t been an easy one. When he opened his business, which offers a wide range of automobile services from mechanical repairs to body work, it was located in a small shop in a residential neighborhood that wasn’t a prime location for a body shop. The most successful business choice C. Auto Repair has made since it opened was moving from its original shop in Rueda, Texas, to a larger shop in Dallas. Of this choice, Israel says, “We took a leap of faith and moved to Dallas, and we just started growing based on referrals alone.”

While he is happy about the business’ success in its new location, Israel is constantly driving to grow and expand the services he offers. “In the future, I would really like to offer full-service everything – state inspections and alignments in a year or two, and, eventually, one or two other locations,” he says. Getting to this future goal involves tireless work from Israel and his family – the shop is open for business 7 days a week, and Israel is typically there from open to close.

With this loan, C. Auto Repair was able to attain the operating capital needed to begin working in its new location. A large portion of the loan was used to install the plumbing systems necessary to get certified by the state. The remainder allowed Israel to buy an inspection machine, which will be used to further him toward his goal of turning C. Auto into a full-service shop.

Israel’s business ethic is rooted in a dedication to good customer service. The advice that he gives to aspiring business owners is that “the biggest thing is return customers; always take care of your customers, and in return they will take care of you.” This loan has allowed Israel to continue doing work he loves, expand his family business and continue to reliably serve the automobile needs of his Dallas community.

loans.use: to pay for plumbing repairs and purchase a state vehicle inspection machine.

loans.name: Haydar

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 29 years old, married and has one child.

Haydar is a blacksmith. He has had a metal workshop since 2004. He has more than 10 years experience in this field and has a good reputation. He is well known in his area.

He is requesting a $1,500 loan to buy a balancing machine for cars. He is aiming to gain more profits to improve his family’s quality life.

loans.use: To buy a balancing machine for cars.

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is a married woman with seven children. Four of her children attend school and three have completed school. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past year, she has operated a business selling clothes door to door to her neighbors and passersby. She faces the major challenge of low turn out of customers because of the rise in the economy. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income and educate her children,

With the KSHS 20,000, she wants to purchase bundles of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Perizat's Group

texts.en:
Perizat leads this loan group. She is 25, married to a builder and earns 5,000 soms a month by working as a waitress. She and her husband have a five-year-old daughter. Perizat has applied for this loan because she plans to start her own business. She will use the money to buy stationery, which she will sell on the open market. Her goal is to buy enough money to buy a house and a vehicle. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to buy stationery to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es: El señor: José es oriundo de una comunidad que esta ubicada en la carretera a Camiri, el se dedica a trabajar como moto taxista en su comunidad, pertenece a una línea de moto taxi, es soltero vive en la casa de sus padres, el es soltero por el momento pero uno de sus deseos es poder encontrar una compañera y formar una familia unida siguiendo el ejemplo de sus padres,  el ayuda con los gastos de hogar, el destino del crédito es para la compra de una motocicleta, hace un año que se dedica a esta actividad, se encuentra  agradecido con la institución por el apoyo financiero que se le brindo.
texts.en: Jose is a native of his community which is located on the highway to Camiri. He is a motorcycle taxi driver in his community and belongs to a line of motorcycle taxis. He is single and lives at home with his parents. He is unmarried at the moment but one of his wishes is to be able to meet a companion and form a united family following the example of his parents. He helps with household expenses. His loan will be used to buy a motorcycle. He has been doing this work for a year. He is grateful to Emprender for the financial support it is providing him

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Bernia

texts.es:
Bernia tiene 53 años D. edad, es felizmente casada y vive con su esposo en su casa propia dentro D. su tierra natal 
VenD. dulces y arrienda cuartos en su casa desD. hace 10 años, tiene su casa amplia que le permite realizar ambos negocios, junto con su esposos administran las ganancias  que les permite  tener mensualmente para los gastos D. su casa,  la clave D. su negocio es tener siempre a la mano la mercadería que necesita y tener inquilinos honestos porque ya tuvo malas experiencias D. algunos D. los inquilinos que se retrasaban en los pagos, en la actualidad  considera que tiene el privilegio detener inquilinos honestos y esto le da ánimos para mejorar la infraestructura D. su casa y su venta D. dulces. 
Es la primera vez que esta solicitando un crédito con MFP, se entero D. esta institución por medio D. un folleto informativo que ha recibido, esto le llamo la atención y podido información sobre las condiciones D. crédito a las cuales decidió afrontar 
Con el dinero  va a comprara bolsas D. cemento que le servirá para pavimentar los cuartos que alquila.
texts.en:
Bernia is 53 years old and happily married. She and her husband live in their own home located in the place where she was born.

Bernia has been selling candy and renting out rooms in her home for 10 years. Her house has ample space for conducting both businesses. She and her husband earn enough income each month to cover the household expenses. The key to her businesses is always having merchandise on hand and doing business with honest tenants. In the past, she has had bad experiences with a few tenants who fell behind on their payments. Bernia considers it a privilege to have honest tenants, so she is motivated to make improvements to the infrastructure of her house and her candy store.

This is the first loan she is requesting from MFP. Bernia learned about the organization through a brochure she received, which brought to her attention the information about the credit terms. As a result, she decided to take action. The money she requested will be used to purchase bags of cement for paving her rental rooms.

loans.use: to purchase bags of cement for paving her rental rooms.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Luz Marina nació en el departamento del Cusco. Actualmente, Luz Marina tiene 41 años de edad, es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene tres hijos de (13, 9 y 1). 

Luz Marina vive en la misma ciudad donde nació y donde realiza sus actividades económicas, ella es docente y trabaja en un colegio particular y ella enseña el curso de matemáticas en el nivel de secundaria. Ya son 15 años que se dedica a enseñar y le va muy bien. Ella también tiene un pequeño negocio familiar de venta de comestibles en su domicilio.  

En esta oportunidad Luz Marina requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo sacos de azúcar, sacos de arroz, sacos de fideos, conservas.  

El Banco Comunal “Comuzone IV” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial y por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y también porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Luz Marina was born in the Department of Cusco.  Today, Luz Marina is 41 years old and married; the fruits of this union are her three children, aged 13, 9 and 1.

Luz Marina lives in the same city where she was born, and this is where she works.  She is a teacher, and works in a private school where she teaches high-school level Mathematics.  She has been teaching for 15 years, and it's going very well for her.  She also has a small family business selling foodstuffs from her home.

On this occasion, Luz Marina is requesting a loan for buying merchandise; for example bags of sugar, bags of rice, bags of noodles and canned food.

The "Comuzone IV" Communal Bank meets monthly in the city of Cusco (in Peru).  Cusco is well-known for being an area with much tourism and commerce, for its traditional Inti Raymi festival, and because it's where you find Machu Picchu, one of the seven wonders of the world.

loans.use: to buy merchandise; for example bags of sugar, bags of rice, bags of noodles, and canned food.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a 36-year-old married woman with two children, neither of whom are in school.  She makes and sells tea and has been in this business for four years.  Mary plans to use this loan from Kiva field partner BRAC South Sudan to buy more sugar for use in the tea she makes and sells.  If she realizes any extra income as a result of this loan, she plans to save it for a house she hopes to be able to build in the future.

loans.use: to buy sugar for use in making tea

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es:
Manuel, está solicitando nuevamente préstamo, ya que el anterior le sirvió para comprar productos para el negocio en la venta de Hot dog, lo que también ocasiono que las ventas aumentaran y poder pagar el préstamo, actualmente lo invertirá en compra de embutidos, aderezos y pan, para la venta de Hot Dog.
Esta contento de recibir este apoyo, ya que le ayuda dandole oportunidad para crecer en el negocio.
texts.en:
Manuel is asking for a new loan. The previous one was used to buy products for his hot dog selling business. This made his sales go up and enabled him to make the loan payments. At present, he will invest in buying hot dogs, toppings and hot dog buns to sell hot dogs. 

He is happy to receive this support, since the help is giving him the opportunity to grow his business.

loans.use: to buy hot dogs, toppings and hotdog buns.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en: Cristina is 36 years old. She is married with five children. Cristina has a sari-sari store (a variety retail shop) that sells rice, canned goods, soap, and beverages. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan for 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy additional rice, canned goods, soap, and beverages. Cristina has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Cristina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional rice to be sold per kilogram, along with canned goods, soap, and beverages

loans.name: Nhip

texts.en:
Mrs. Nhip,31, has been in the business of cultivating rice and vegetables in the Siem Reap province. She has grown different kinds of vegetables through the years; it depends on the market and the demand of the customers. She certainly enjoys doing her business because she is skillful and has learned a lot from her previous experiences. 

Typically, she gets a profit of $2.00 per day to support her family, especially her two school-aged children. Although, the main source of income comes from her husband who provides a Tuk Tuk taxi-service around the province. Presently, the motorcycle and trailer need repair, so Mrs. Nhip would like to ask for a loan from Kiva to pay to fix her husband's taxi and to support her husband’s business. This is her second loan with Kiva. She has never made a late payment on her previous loan.

loans.use: to fix her husband's taxi

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 32-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and only child. He has 10 years of experience working in the agricultural field. In 2006, he started his own business which consists of cultivating vegetables. He has one part-time employee helping him with his labor. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,300 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase fertilizer, seeds, agricultural equipment, and supplies. The loan will absolutely improve his financial situation and he states that he is in a real need for this. In the future, he plans to open a vegetable shop.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, seeds, agricultural equipment, and supplies

loans.name: Tuinuane B Group

texts.en:
Julius is the facilitator of the Tuinuane B group. Julius and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Julius takes care of eight children at home. He joined One Acre Fund to access One Acre Fund’s best prices, to ensure food security for his family and later educate them. In the recent 2011 season, Julius had an excellent maize yield harvesting 21 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Julius was only able to harvest five bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Julius and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Julius will educate his children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Tuinuane B group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Buenaventura

texts.es: Buenaventura Es una mujer casada que vive en Galapa, en su propia casa, municipio muy cerca a la ciudad de Barranquilla, con su esposo y tien 3 hijos en las edades de 43 a 46 años. Ella es propietaria de un expendio de carnes ubicado en esta poblaciòn, donde vende especialmente visceras hueso y costilla y tambien en compañía de su esposo vende carbon vegetal por cargas. Su negocio lo iniciò en el año 1988 y gracias a esta actividad, que ha trabajado con su esposo, pudieron sacar a sus hijos adelante. Su sueño de crecer empresarialmente es inagotable, esta es la razòn por la cual solicita su credikiva para incrementar el surtido de carnes y atender los pedidos que le hacen sus clientes. Buenaventura es una mujer muy trabajadora  que simultaneamente labora en el consejo municipal de Galapa, desempeñandose en oficios varios; con las ventas del negocio cubre sus gastos personales y del negocio,  aporta para el pago de los créditos que ha usado para la educación superior de su hija. En su infraestructura tiene dos enfriadores para conservar las carnes. La rentabilidad está acorde al tipo de negocio, y las rotaciones de cartera y de inventarios es corta, como debe ser en un negocio con estas caracteristicas;  Su credikiva es el pirmer financiamiento que hace a la Fundaciòn Mario Santo Domingo, con el comprarà en mayor cantidad productos càrnicos, especialmente para atender la gran demanda que se acerca con motivo de las fiestas de fin de año: Navidad y Año nuevo.
texts.en:
Buenaventura is a married woman who lives in Galapa, in her own house in a town near the city of Barranquilla, with her husband and three children from the ages of 43 to 46 year old.

She is the owner of a small butcher shop located in her town where she sells entrails, bones, and pork chops, and she and her husband also sell bundles of charcoal.

Her business began in 1988 and thanks to this activity, that she has had with her husband, they could raise their children.

Her dream of growing as an entrepreneur is non-ending; this is the reason why she is asking for a loan in order to increase her supplies of meat and fulfill the orders from her clients.

Buenaventura is a very hardworking woman that simultaneously works on the city council of Galapa and carrying out various duties. The profit from her business covers her personal and business expenses, and pays for the higher education of her daughter.

Her butcher shop has 2 coolers to keep the meat fresh. The earning potential is according to this type of business, the turn-over of the meat and supplies is quick, as it should be in this type of business.

This is her first Kiva funded loan which was through the Fundaciòn Mario Santo Domingo in order to buy in larger quantities meat products, especially to meet the greater demand as the holidays of the year approaches, both Christmas and the New York.

loans.use: to buy meat products in larger quantities

loans.name: Lilias

texts.en:
Lilias is 35 years old and a married woman with six children. Five of them are in school. She has had a business selling clothes in Yei, South Sudan for five years.

Lilias is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase clothes for sale. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for sale.

loans.name: Chiybyl

texts.ru:
Чийбылу 55 лет, женат, воспитал четверых детей. В 2009 году, в поисках источника дохода для своей семьи, Чийбыл начал свой бизнес в торговле продуктами и товарами повседневного спроса. Магазин Чийбыла известен тем, что при хорошем качестве товара, он реализует продукты по низкой цене, что важно для людей с небольшим достатком.  Благодаря настойчивости  и упорному труду, Чийбыл сумел развить свой бизнес  с ежемесячным доходом   около 10,000 сом (KGS). 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Чийбыл обратился  в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на расширение ассортимента.  Доходы от кредита Чийбыл планирует вложить в  расширение торгового места.
texts.en: Chiybyl is 55 years old, married and raised four children.  In search of an income source for his family, he started his own business of selling products and goods of daily demand in 2009.  Chiybyl's store is famous for the good quality of products.  He sells products at low prices, which is important to people with small incomes.  Thanks to his persistence and hard work, Chiybyl was able to grow his business to yield a monthly income of about 10,000 som (KGS).  In order to further develop his business, he requested a loan in the sum of 80,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to expand his product selection.  He plans to invest the profits from the loan into expanding his retail space.

loans.use: to broaden an assortment of goods

loans.name: Lun

texts.en:
Mr. Lun, age 39, is a humble farmer who has spent most his life planting rice and vegetable crops in Baray district. His wife is in the same business as him and always assists him in planting the crops to generate income for the whole family. This couple has been blessed with four children. Two of his children are attending a local primary school. Lun intends to raise some piglets in his backyard in order to improve his family's standard of living.

At this time, for his second loan from Kiva, Lun is asking for 2,800,000 KHR to buy some piglets, pig feed, and a pumping machine for his crops. He hopes that he’ll be able to uplift his family out of poverty someday.

loans.use: to buy some piglets, pig feed, and a pumping machine for crops.

loans.name: Djiguéne Bakhna 39 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupement  Djiguène  Bakhna  39 regroupe 5 femmes qui  habitent dans la même maison et qui ont pour  activité, la vente  de fruits et légumes.
La responsable du groupe Mame  Kardiata  a une expérience de plus de 10 ans  dans le métier. Avec le crédit, elle va acheter des fruits .Elle compte dans l’avenir  ouvrir son propre magasin.
texts.en:
The Djiguène Bakhna 39 group is composed of five women who live in the same house and who all sell fruits and vegetables.

The group's representative, Mame Kardiata, has over ten years of experience selling fruits and vegetables. She will use the loan to buy fruit. In the future, she hopes to open her own store.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables intended for resale

loans.name: Wangnnagbe Group

texts.fr: Le groupe WANGNNAGBE est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. C'est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Jesugnon Christine est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Jesugnon Christine est âgée de 38 ans et vit au Bénin.  Jesugnon Christine n’a pas fréquenté l'école et est mariée à un mécanicien du nom de Bienvenu. Le couple a cinq enfants à  sa charge. Certains de ces enfants sont scolarisés. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Jesugnon Christine vend depuis six ans de la nourriture a son domicile. Parallèlement à son activité principale, Jesugnon Christine vend des mèches et des produits cosmétiques. Jesugnon Christine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu,  Jesugnon Christine, ensemble avec les membres du  groupe WANGNNAGBE, sollicite un deuxième crédit.

loans.use: Acheter du riz, des mèches et des produits cosmétiques.

loans.name: Lazari

texts.en:
Lazari is single lady who does tailoring for a living. She is hard working, but faced with a challenge of competition and inadequate machines for her do embroidering and finishing up the knitting work, which forces her to look for other tailors to finish the work.

Lazeri now wants to deal with competition by buying an electronic machine, which is quick, convenient and also does better work.

Lazari has managed to save some money which is not enough to buy the machine.

She is requesting money to top off her savings and buy a sewing machine.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Mayshelle

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Mayshelle works hard to support her family.

She has a tricycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Mayshelle is borrowing PHP 19000 through NWTF to  buy spare parts, gasoline for her boat and other maintenance for her tricycle for her tricycle transport business.

Mayshelle has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts, gasoline for her boat and other maintenance for her tricycle

loans.name: María Guadalupe

texts.en:
Lupita started her small business more than 5 years ago, a small grocery store run from her own home, while she still worked for her company. She realized that this double effort was needed because she is a single mother and has two little ones at home, 7 and 8 years old. Things have not been at all easy for Lupita, but the love for her children has motivated her to keep moving ahead. After she started her small business she was let go from her company job and now she dedicates herself full-time to her grocery store, the very same that she still manages today, with the active support of her children.

Now she needs fund to be able to stock her business with more merchandise and this way increase her sales to provide her children with the necessities, like an education. For this she requires a loan of $475. With your generosity you can help Lupita and her children. They need you and they thank you sincerely.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Lupita comenzó hace más de 5 años con su pequeño negocio propio, una tiendita de abarrotes, en su propio domicilio, al mismo tiempo que se desempeñaba como emplead en una empresa. Ella tenía que realizar este doble esfuerzo debido a que es madre soltera, tiene dos pequeños de 7 y 8 años. Las cosas no han sido fáciles para Lupita, pero el amor a sus hijos la ha impulsado a seguir adelante. Tiempo después de iniciar su negocio, fue despedida y se dedicó por completo a la tienda de abarrotes, misma que hasta el momento mantiene, con el apoyo de activo de sus hijos.

Ahora ella necesita de capital para poder surtir su negocio con más mercancías y de esta forma poder incrementar sus ingresos y poder brindarles a sus hijos lo necesario, como educación. Por ello requiere de un préstamo de $ 475 DLLS. Con tu generosidad puedes ayudar a Lupita y sus hijos, ellos te necesitan y te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Felicia sells provisions. She has attended several training programmes by Kraban Support Foundation for women in trade on simple record-keeping and business management. She wants a loan of $750.00 from Kiva to enable her to open a shop.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr:
At 55 years of age, Mrs. Akossiwa L. is a very poor woman who lives in a miserable location with five (05) children in her care. Their area, very far away from the city, is without drinking water, electricity, toilets, and even arable land to grow crops. But aware of her situation, this lady runs a small business selling various products (tomatoes, peppers, fried fish, etc) to meet the needs of her family.

Having very limited financial means, she often has stock shortages which sometimes cause her to lose customers. To imrpove this situation, she is asking for a loan of $400 which she will manage with her abilities. The realization of this project will help her ensure the blossoming of her family.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Agée de 55 ans Madame L. Akossiwa est une femme très pauvre qui vit dans un milieu très misérable avec cinq (05) enfants à charge. Leur localité très reculée de la ville est sans eau potable, sans électricité, sans latrine et même pas de terrain cultivable pour au moins faire des cultures. Mais consciente de sa situation, cette dame fait son petit commerce de vente de divers produits (Tomate, piments, poisson frit etc.) pour subvenir aux besoins de la famille.

Ayant une capacité financière très limitée, elle a souvent des ruptures de stock qui la fait parfois perdre de clientèle. Pour améliorer cette situation, elle sollicite un crédit de $400 qu’elle saura gérer par sa capacité de gestion. La réalisation de ce projet l’aidera à assurer l’épanouissement de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy and sell various products

loans.name: Kokouvi

texts.fr:
Mr. Kokouvi A. is born in 1964 in Attivémé in the County of Zio. He stopped his schooling in 7th grade (middle school) due to a lack of funds. He started to work in agriculture with his parents in order to survive. Today he is married and the father of three (3) children with two (2) additional persons to support. Mr. A. has become a big farmer, this activity allows him to cover his household expenses.

He would like to improve his farming and obtain greater yield to better guarantee the education of his children. Therefore he is requesting a loan of $1200 that will allow him to increase the size of his cultivable land and acquire more modern fertilizers.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Monsieur A. Kokouvi est né en 1964 à Attivémé dans la préfecture du Zio. Il arrêta ses études au niveau 5ème (cours secondaire) par manque de moyens. Il commença alors à cultiver la terre avec ses parents pour pouvoir survivre. Aujourd’hui marié et père de trois (03) enfants avec deux (02) autres personnes à sa charge, Monsieur A. est devenu un grand cultivateur, activité qui lui permet de pouvoir supporter les charges du ménage.

Il désire améliorer cette agriculture et obtenir des rendements plus importants afin de mieux assurer la scolarisation de ses enfants. Pour cela, il sollicite un crédit de $1200 qui lui permettra d’élargir sa surface cultivable et d’acquérir des intrants plus modernes.

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizers to improve his crops' yield

loans.name: Truong Thi

texts.vi:
Ms. Truong Thi G., 52 years old, has been a member of TYM Fund for 11 year. Her husband got a disease and died in 1998, making her life even more difficult. Her four children and she put all of their efforts to earn money for the living. At the beginning she applied for a 200 USD loan to raise pigs. After substracting all the costs, her first pigs bring her 100 USD profit. She continues to apply for loans to expand her business. When all of her children have grown up, she applies for the highest loan to open a new store which provides building materials like gravel, sand, etc. Her total income from both the pigs and the store in Trung Gia commune, Soc Son district is around 370 – 430 USD. Her two oldest children just get married, so the family expenses increase. She would like to apply for a 1200 USD loan to expand her business model to increase her income.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Trương Thị Gái, 52 tuổi, đã tham gia Quỹ Tình thương được 11 năm. Chồng chị mắc bệnh qua đời năm 1998 khiến cho hoàn cảnh kinh tế gia đình rất khó khăn. Chị cùng bốn người con đều phải nỗ lực tham gia vào việc phát triển kinh tế gia đình. Lúc đầu chị xin vay mức vốn 200 USD về chăn nuôi lợn. Lứa lợn đầu tiên sau khi trừ chi phí mang lại cho chị khoảng 100 USD. Trong các vòng vốn tiếp theo chị tiếp tục vay vốn đầu tư vào chăn nuôi. Khi các con đã trưởng thành chị xin vay mức vốn tối đa đầu tư thêm vào việc kinh doanh cát sỏi vật liệu xây dựng. Mức doanh thu hàng tháng từ đàn lợn và cửa hàng vật liệu xây dựng tại xã Trung Giã, huyện Sóc Sơn khoảng từ 370 đến 430 USD đủ để trang trải cho cuộc sống hàng ngày của 5 mẹ con. Hai con lớn của chị Gái vừa lập gia đình riêng, mức chi phí của cả gia đình nâng cao nên chị đang cần vay thêm 1200 USD để mở rộng mô hình kinh doanh nhằm nâng cao thu nhập.

loans.use: buy some pigs and building materials like gravel, sand ...

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her clothes stock

loans.name: Mekisa

texts.en: Mekisa is a married woman who is 32 years of age. She presently resides in Nofoalii village. She has four children, two boys and two girls. She and her husband run a fishing business. They sell their fish from the house and also deliver the fish to nearby villages. They earn about $200.00-300.00 WST ($80-120 USD) a week from selling fish. The business is the only source of income for the family. She would like a second loan to buy new fishing gear.

loans.use: To buy new fishing gear

loans.name: Mohammad Nasim

texts.en:
Mohammad Nasim lives in district 5 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and has one son. He lives with his own family. His father died during the war in Kabul.

Mohammad is also supporting his mother and one small brother with his retail shop. He started this business 4 years ago in Kabul. He has attracted good numbers of customers so he wants to take an individual loan to complete his inventory so as to make a good monthly income for his family. He is happy with all parts of his family.

loans.use: To complete items missing in his inventory

loans.name: Concepción

texts.es:
Concepción works as a seamstress in a clothing factory. This is her main source of income with which she supports her three children. Her home is located in the Villa Ingavi zone of the city of El Alto.

She needs a loan to buy construction materials so that she can finish work on her small home and make it more liveable.

This is her second loan with IMPRO, her prior credit record allows her to be approved for another loan. She is a client of IMPRO since 2006.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Concepción, trabaja como costurera en una fabrica de confección de ropa por temporada. Esta es su principal fuente de ingreso con la que cubre la manutención de sus tres hijos; su domicilio esta ubicado en la Zona Villa Ingavi de la Ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito requiere para comprar materia de construcción, para terminar con la obra fina de su pequeña vivienda familiar y hacerla más habitable.

Es el segundo crédito con IMPRO, el antecedentes anterior le faculta para aprobarle otro préstamo. Es cliente de IMPRO desde el año 2006

loans.use: Purchase materials to complete work on her home.

loans.name: Sokhorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokhorn D., 33, and her husband, Pheary Lay, married in 1993. They have six children; three sons and three daughters. The family lives on Koh Dach Island on the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Sokhorn is in the business of weaving silk. She learned weaving from her grandmother and started silk production in 1990. She sells her finished products in her village. Besides weaving, she also sells mangoes and other kinds of fruit (as a snack) in front of the village school. She hopes that her business will be able to support her family and allow her children to study as high as possible.

Mrs. Sokhorn is requesting a loan for the third time in the amount of $500 to purchase silk material for weaving.

loans.use: For purchasing silk material for weaving

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en: Blessing O. is a married woman with 5 children ,and she hails from Ajamgbadi Lagos State Nigeria. She has a profitable business center she started in 2005. She has two computers, one laminating machine, and one photocopier, and has two computer trainees in her shop. Blessing is requesting for the loan of $875 to enable her buy more computers as she is expecting new trainees, and needs the equipment for them. She says thank you to Kiva and the lender for this opportunity.

loans.use: To buy more computers for training students

loans.name: Ramon

texts.es:
Ramón is married and has been retired for many years. As his pension was not enough to pay his and his wife's expenses, several years ago they started buying merchandise to sell to their neighbors and relatives. Now, some days during the week, they go to a street market to sell as well. Their six children are all married and their youngest daughter helps them sell.

Ramón requests a loan of $600 that he will repay in six months to buy merchandise. With your support he will get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer.

Ramón esta casado y es pensionado pero desde hace muchos años, como con la pensión no completaba para solventar sus gastos hace varios años empezaron comprando mercancía que podían vender entre sus vecinos y sus familiares. y así ahora ciertos días de la semana van a la pulga a vender también. Todos sus hijos que son seis ya están casados, pero su hija mas pequeña les ayuda a vender.

El solicita un préstamo por US $ 600 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía. Con tu apoyo el saldrá adelante.

loans.use: Purchase Merchandise

loans.name: Sadiqan's Group

texts.en:
Sadiqan baji, the wife of N. B., lives in a city named Pak Pattan, Pakistan. She has been married for the last 20 years. She is a mother of two children: one daughter and one son. Both are enrolled in a local school. Her husband has a bicycle spare parts shop. He has been in this profession for the last 25 years. Now she is applying for a loan for her husband to expand his business.

She has been joined in her loan group a few more members: Shamim baji, who wants loan to expand her oil business; Kosar baji wants loan to buy an auto-rickshaw spare parts business; Asma baji wants a loan to buy chairs and a mirror for her barber salon; Sardaran baji wants a loan to expand her grocery shop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Babacar

texts.fr:
Babacar opened a tailor's workshop that he manages with his apprentices. To grow his income, he wants to buy some cloth, thread, and trim in large amounts. To finance his business, he was a recipient of a loan of 250,000 francs CFA from IMCEC. With this purchase of goods, thanks to the loan, he will benefit from economies of scale and thus grow his income for fortifying or refurbishing his machines.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Babacar a ouvert un atelier de tailleur qu'il gére avec ses apprentits.Pour accroitre ses revenus ,il veut acheter des tissus ,du fils et de la garniture en quantité . Pour financer son activité,il a bénéficié d'un pret de 250000f cfa de l'IMCEC.Avec l'achat de ces produits grace au pret, il bénéficiera des économies d'échelles et ainsi accroitre ses revenus pour renforcer ou renouveler ses machines.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Esther's Livestock Store Group

texts.en:
Esther is 40 years old. She is married, and has 8 children between the ages of 9 and 24. She has owned a small livestock shop since 1983. She begins work every day from 6AM and ends at 10PM. On average, she can earn a monthly profit of $40.

Esther is now requesting a loan to purchase more vegetables and fruits for resale. She will also share this loan with her subgroup members Zulfa and Rehema.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables and fruits for resale

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Chea T., 38, is married and lives with her children in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. Since 2000, she has been working as a weaver. She learned how to weave from her mother when she was very young. She also grows vegetables and rice to earn a living and is able to make US$2.5 per day. She says that farming is just to support her family from day to day. She doesn’t earn a profit from farming because the weather conditions are not very good. Most of the provinces do not have irrigation systems. Farmers have to depend on the rain. Inflation is also a problem. Prices of everything, including fertilizer and rice seed, have skyrocketed and most of the farmers cannot afford to purchase fertilizer for their rice fields. Her husband, Vat Ry, 41, is a construction worker who builds house and makes US$3 per day. To double the family's income, Chea is requesting a loan from Kiva via Credit, a local partner of World Relief, so she can breed pigs and cows for sale.

loans.use: To breed pigs and cow for sale.

loans.name: Arlindo Alfredo

texts.pt:
Arlindo nasceu em Gaza, tem 28 anos de idade estudou ate 3 classe vive maritalmente  e  pai de 5 filhos: com idades compriendidas entre os 9 aos 2 anos de idade so o mais velho e que vai a escola. mudou se para Namaacha uma vila na fronteira de swazilandia  a procura de emprego deixando a sua familia em Gaza.

Arlindo após de concluir a 3ª classe teve que interroper os estudos devido a má condição financeira dos pais pois eram camponêses. Assim teve que começar a trabalhar nas residencias como cozinheiro, anos depois foi contratado por alguns alfândegarios que trabalhavam na fronteira de Namaacha assim ele mudou se para essa vila, e recebia mensalmente 1.850,00.mt trabalhava como cozinheiro. Anos depois os seus patrões foram transferidos, e Arlindo consegue um emprego no hotel 5 estrelas da vila(Hotel Libombos)onde trabalha ate hoje entrando as 7h as 15h no periodo da manhã e as 15h as 22h no periodo da tarde auferindo um salrio mansal de 1.800.00.mt. Mas porque o salário não consegue sustentar todas suas necessidades resolve abrir o seu próprio negócio adquirindo uma banca no mercado central da vila onde roupa comprada na swazilândia os seus melhores produtos são camisolas, calções, e calsas que compra a a 55.00.mt , 120.00.mt e 220.00.mt  vende a 180.00.mt, 250.00.mt e 450.00.mt consecutivamente. Tem um lucro mensal de 4.000.00mt , consegue poupar 1.500.00mt e envia 3.500.00mt para a familia e ele gasta 800.00.mt. para alem da familia responsabiliza se pelos 3 sobrinhos que vivem com a sua esposa em gaza pois estes perderam o pai. 


Etse e o segundo empréstimo de arlindo na hluvuku e primeiro no kiva. O primeiro de 9.200.00mt usou para comprar mercadorias e pede este segundo empréstimo de 15.500.00mt para o mesmo fim. Esta confiante que vai desembolsar antes do prazo e pedir outro empréstimo para concluir a sua obra em Gaza.
texts.en:
Arlindo is 28 years old and was born in Gaza. He went to school through third grade. He is married and the father of five children, ages two to nine years old. Only the eldest goes to school. In pursuit of work, Arlindo left his family in Gaza and moved to Namaacha, a village on the border with Swaziland.

Arlindo had to interrupt his studies after finishing third grade because of the meager financial situation of his parents, who were poor country folk. As such, he had to start working as a cook in people’s houses. Years later he was contracted by some customs employees who worked at the border in Namaacha, where he moved to take the job. He received 1,850 meticais (MTn) per month while working as a cook. Years later his employers were transferred, and he found employment at a five-star hotel in the village (Hotel Libombos), where he has worked until now. He works 7am to 3pm on the morning shift and 3pm to 10pm on the afternoon shift, earning a monthly salary of 1,800MTn. But because this salary was not enough to cover all his necessities, he decided to open his own business. He acquired a stall at the central market in the village, where he sells clothes he purchases in Swaziland. His best-selling items are nightgowns, shorts, and shirts, which he buys for 55MTn, 120MTn, and 220MTn and sells for 180MTn, 250MTn, and 450MTn respectively. He makes a monthly profit of 4,000MTn. He is able to save 1,500MTn, sends 3,500MTn to his family, and spends 800MTn. In addition to supporting his family, he takes care of three nephews, who live with his wife in Gaza because they lost their father.

This is Arlindo’s second loan with Hluvuku [Kiva’s Field Partner] and his first with Kiva. He used his first loan of 9,200MTn to buy merchandise and requests this second loan of 15,000MTn for the same end. He is confident that he will repay before the due date and will ask for another loan to complete his work in Gaza.

Translated from Portuguese by April Newman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy footwear and clothing

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es: Alejandro tiene 29 años, convive con su pareja Carmen de 22 años y sus dos hijos Alex de 7 y Luz de 6. Desde hace 7 años trabaja en una ferretería, donde vende material para la construcción. Le gusta su trabajo, ya que el vender es su gran habilidad, su gran poder de convencimiento han hecho que Alejandro genere buenos ingresos para la manutención de su hogar, lo más complicado es que el trabajo es duro, por tener que cargar y trasladar el material, pero él es un hombre joven, que piensa en trabajar a favor de su familia hasta que le den las fuerzas. Es su primer préstamo en Microfinanzas PRISMA. Con el dinero del préstamo Alejandro quiere comprar algunos materiales de la misma ferretería en la que trabaja, para ir juntando materiales para construir posteriormente una pequeña casa propia.
texts.en:
Alejandro is 29 years old and lives with his domestic partner, Carmen age 22, and their two children, Alex age 7 and Luz age 6. For 7 years, he has worked at a hardware store in which construction supplies and building materials are sold. He likes his job because retail is his biggest skill. His great power of persuasion has made Alejandro generate good earnings to support his household. The most difficult thing about his job is that it requires heavy labor, as he has to lift and move the material. Nevertheless, he is a young man who always thinks about working for his family as long as he is physically able to do so. This is his first loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA. With this loan, Alejandro wishes to purchase some building materials from workplace so that he can begin to stockpile supplies in order to build his own little house.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to start building his own house

loans.name: Abad

texts.es:
Abad tiene su salón de peluquería ubicado en la Zona 16 de julio de la Ciudad de El Alto, el cual es su fuente de ingresos con los que cubre la manutención de su pequeño hijo  y esposa. Vive en alquiler en una casa en la Zona Ballivian de la misma ciudad.
 
El préstamo lo destinará para la compra de una maquina de cortar cabello con que podrá facilitar su trabajo y prestar mejor servicio a sus clientes.
 
Es primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada califica a Abad para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado.
texts.en:
Abad has a hairdressing salon in the July 16 area of the city of El Alto, which is his source of income for supporting his son and his wife. He rents a house in the Ballivian area in the same city. This loan will be used to buy a machine to cut hair that will facilitate his work and provide better service to his clients. This is his first loan with Impro and his application qualifies him for the loan he seeks.

Translated from Spanish by Jeanette Chase, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a machine to cut hair for his beauty salon.

loans.name: Mrs. Yet Tol Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank group consists of fifteen people who live in the village of Spean Pau in Kampong Chhnang province. The group is collectively seeking a loan, but all of the members will use the loan proceeds for different purposes, depending on their individual business needs.

Mrs. Yet T. is the village bank president. She owns a small restaurant where she sells Khmer noodles to both residents of and visitors to her local village. Her husband, Mr. Prak Noeurn, is a carpenter who makes beds, chairs, and other such wood products. Mrs. Yet T. is 39 years old, and she is the mother of two children, both of whom help their parents with their current businesses. Although she and her husband (and their children, for that matter) work extremely hard, they still do not earn sufficient income to properly support the family. As a matter of fact, they do not have enough money to purchase rice to keep in stock to feed the family. Thus, Mrs. Yet T. decided to ask for a loan in order to purchase rice.

One group member, Mr. Chandara H., is not seeking a loan, but his wife is; so, his wife is captured in the picture rather than him.

loans.use: To purchase rice in order to continue to feed her family

loans.name: Damiana

texts.es: Damiana tiene 38 años, vive con sus hermanos en la casa que le dejaron sus padres. Se dedica a la fabricación de ladrillos, negocio en el cual trabaja con sus hermanos desde hace ya 13 años, este trabajo le permite subsistir y poder salir adelante en busca de un futuro mejor. Lo que le gusta a Damiana de su trabajo es que puede trabajar al lado de su familia y todos juntos poder salir adelante. La venta es buena, ya que tienen mucha producción de ladrillos, los cuales llevan en camionadas a la cuidad de Juliaca y alrededores, para su posterior venta, la cual cada vez es mejor. Damiana se encuentra en su octavo préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma, siendo muy puntual en los pagos. Con el dinero que está solicitando comprará material para elaborar más ladrillos y también pagará la reparación de del camión con el que transporta su producción.
texts.en:
Damiana is 38 years old and lives with her siblings in the home their parents left to them. She works as a brick-maker and has done so, along with her siblings, for the past 13 years. Her job supports her and helps her get ahead in life and search for a better future. What Damiana likes most about her job is that she can work side-by-side with her family and they can all get ahead together. Sales are good since they are producing a lot of bricks. They take the bricks by truck into the city of Juliaca and the surrounding areas in order to sell them later. Each time, sales are better than before. This is Damiana’s eighth loan with Microfinanazas Prisma and she is always on time with her payments. With this loan she will buy material for more brick-making and she will also pay for repairs for the truck that transports her bricks.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials for making bricks

loans.name: Uma

texts.en: Miss Uma N. lives in Tangal. Tangal is located in the Lalitpur district. Most of the people in this region are engaged in small businesses like grocery stores, ready-made items, vegetable sales, utensils of different metals, and so on. The area is a very busy shopping center. Miss N. lives with her father, mother and brothers. Five years ago Miss N. opened her beauty parlor to upgrade her family's standard of living. She took 6 months of training for beauty parlor work from the local training institute. Her service is for ladies only. Now she is requesting Rs30,000.00 to buy various types of makeup supplies for her work. She wishes to use her income to further raise the living standard of her family.

loans.use: To buy makeup supplies

loans.name: Vasil

texts.en:
Vasil is married. He and his wife Sveltana have one daughter who is 9 years old, and they are expecting their second child soon. Vasil has been providing taxi services for 10 years in the city as well as to other cities.

Vasil is a former military officer. When he left the service he needed to provide for his family and decided to use his car as a taxi. Recently he sold his old car and bought a newer one.

Vasil would like a loan of 4,000 UAH to help with regular car maintenance, namely painting and tires. This business is the only source of income for Vasil's family.

loans.use: Repair taxi

loans.name: Alex

texts.en: For the last 10 years, Alex A. has made a living second-hand shoes at Kingsway in Cape Coast. He has a high-school degree, is a hard worker and is committed to pay all his bills on time. Alex will use this loan to expand his business, and hopes to use the increased profits made possible by this expansion to buy land and build a house on it.

loans.use: To expand his business selling second-hand shoes.

loans.name: Ilhomiddin

texts.ru: Илхомиддину 44 лет. Женат. Имеет 4-х детей. У него высшее техническое образование. Его жена работает учительницей в их сельской школе. Её дети тоже идут в эту школу. Она учитель начальных классов. Зарплата учителей совсем маленкая, но жена Илхомиддина все равно ходит на работу, чтобы учить сельских детей. Илхомиддин. Он взял кредит, чтобы купить еще одну партию молодых овец.
texts.en:
Ilhomiddin is 44 years old. He is married and has four children. He completed his college education in a technical field. His wife works as a teacher in the school in their small town. Her children also attend this school. She teaches the youngest children. Although teachers' salaries are very small, Ilhomiddin's wife still goes to work in order to teach the village children. Ilhomiddin has applied for a loan to purchase another batch of young sheep.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising and selling sheep

loans.name: Oumar Diaka

texts.fr: OUMAR DIAKA D. EST NE EN 1962 A FONGOLEMY .IL est commerçant de profession et est basé au quartier DIAKHAO de THIES avec sa famille;il est à son sixième pret avec l'institution.Avec la somme qu'il demande il veut renforcer son stock de marchandises.
texts.en:
Oumar Diaka D. was born in 1962 in Fongolemy. He has been a merchant for a long time and is based in the Diakhao district in Thies with his family. He is on his sixth loan with this institution. With the amount requested, he is planning to bolster his stock of merchandise.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: expanding his stock of merchandise

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en: This is Mrs. Angelina M., who is 33 years old, married and lives at Talairon, Oroquieta City. She is a simple woman, blessed with 3 children. Her husband is a bus driver. In order to help her husband, she decided to open a “sari-sari” (general) store adjacent to their house. It started with a capital of only PHP 500. Her primary customers are their neighbors and relatives. She has been able to manage the business well. In fact, their food is paid for with the income from the “sari-sari” store. Angelina is also thankful to Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative, because it helped her in the expansion, specifically on financial matters. She became a member of the Co-Op in June 2001. She has taken loans several times. Now, she is applying for PHP 10,000 for additional merchandise for sale. She’s looking forward to a comfortable life and plans to expand her business into a grocery store someday. She also wants to own a piece of land someday.

loans.use: To buy additional goods for her "sari-sari" store

loans.name: Brankica

texts.en:
Brankica K. is 49 and comes from the village of Dobrnja near the town of Tuzla. She is married and her husband is retired but he sells medicinal herbs. They have one nine-year-old daughter. Brankica sells used clothes in her own store. Beside that she breeds chickens for her own use and some to sell.

Brankica is already a loan client of WWI ( Žene za Žene International ). She has requested a loan through WWI in the amount of 1000 KM to purchase used clothes to resell. Her husband`s pension is not so much and the income from Brankica`s business is very important for them.

loans.use: To purchase used clothes to resell

loans.name: Naana

texts.en:
Naana S. sells gari (a fried cassava dish) which she gets by processing cassava, which she does at Kormantse near Cape Coast. She has received no formal education. She is married and has four dependents. Her husband is a trader.

Naana has sold gari since 1997 and her loan will be used to buy more cassava to process into gari for sale. She is responsible for catering for her family. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to pay her children’s school fees.

loans.use: To buy to more cassava to process into gari and sell

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.en:
Rodolfo G., 30, is married to Sherell G., an overseas contract worker. They have two children, one in elementary school and one in preparatory school. They live in a congested community in Parola. Tondo, Manila.

Rodolfo runs a videoke (karaoke) rental and video game business which earns P 12,000 each month. He also sells gasoline in small amounts for tricycle use and distributes e-load (prepaid credit) for cellular phones. These side businesses provide additional income of P 1,200 a month.

He is going to use his loan to buy another videoke machine.

loans.use: buying an additional videoke (karaoke) machine

loans.name: Angel

texts.es: Ángel tiene 25 años, vive con su hermano, con quien comparte las mismas actividades, juntos buscan progresar fuera de su tierra natal, y hasta la fecha han lograron obtener una casa propia, la cual construyeron a base de mucho esfuerzo. Desde que terminó sus estudios secundarios se interesó por tener un negocio propio, pero sus condiciones económicas no le dieron la oportunidad de iniciarlo y para lograr sus metas tuvo que realizar diversos trabajos de ventas en los mercados más concurridos de la ciudad. Al paso de los años consiguió el capital que requería, y junto a su hermano lograron instalar un puesto de venta de ropa en el mercado más popular de la capital, donde la gran concurrencia beneficia su negocio. Sin embargo, la demanda es muy exigente, tienen que variar y estar pendiente de las últimas colecciones en moda, tanto para hombres y mujeres. Es así que trabaja desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 11 de la noche, tiempo en que trata de brindar a sus clientes las mejores atenciones para asegurar su retorno. Ahora, su próxima meta es adquirir otro puesto para  incrementar sus ventas. Este es su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA y se compromete a trabajar de una forma responsable para poder solicitar próximos créditos. Los 2000 soles que solicita le brindaran la oportunidad de incrementar la mercadería con la cual viene trabajando hasta la fecha.
texts.en:
Angel is 25 years old. He lives with his brother and shares activities with him. Together they looked for opportunities outside of their birthplace. As of this date, they have obtained their own home, which took quite a bit of effort. Since Angel has finished his secondary studies, he has been interested in having his own business. Economic conditions had not allowed him to begin this business. To achieve his goals, he had to work at different sales jobs in the crowded markets of the city. After several years he obtained the capital that he needed and with his brother they purchased a booth where they sell clothes in the most popular market in the city.
