The large crowds in this market help their business. Never the less, the customers are very particular. The brothers have to provide a variety of clothing They also must provide the latest styles for men and women. It is in this manner that they work from eight in the morning until eleven at night. During this time they try to provide their customers with the best service in order to insure that they return. Now their next goal is to acquire another booth in order increase their sales. This is their first loan with PRISMA Microfinance. They promise to work in a responsible manner so that they can qualify for more loans in the future. The 2000 soles that they ask for will allow them to increase their inventory of clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase their inventory

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta P. is from the village of Puerto, Lurugan Valencia City. She is 43 years old. Vicenta is married and has children. To make a living, Vicenta owns & operates a business running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Vicenta has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Vicenta joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Vicenta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Vicenta is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Vicenta from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To grow corn and peanuts

loans.name: Wankinnou

texts.fr: H. Wankinnou est née vers 1950 à Ouidah. Wankinnou est mariée à ACCROMBESSI Hounye. Ce couple a à sa charge quatre enfants tous scolarisés dont deux sont les leurs. La famille réside depuis cinq ans à Fridjrossè Kpota, un quartier de Cotonou, Capitale Économique de la République du Bénin. Grâce au revenu de son activité, Wankinnou vient en aide à son mari dans les charges de la famille. Wankinnou vend des produits de soins corporels, principalement le savon de toilette produit au Ghana, un pays voisin du Bénin. Wankinnou vend aussi des ustensiles de cuisines. C’est à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin que Wankinnou achète ses produits. Wankinnou a déjà quinze ans d’expérience dans cette activité. Wankinnou a eu deux crédits d’ALIDé, crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés et avec lesquels elle a pu élever le niveau de son activité. Pour  continuer à développer son activité, Wankinnou demande un troisième crédit pour renforcer son fonds de roulement.

loans.use: Achat de savon de Ghana et de produits de soins corporels.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: acheter des engrais

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica is thirty-nine years old. She is married and has given birth to three children, all of whom are in school. Monica lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a busy commercial and farming community in the Brong Ahafo Region called Goaso. She is a trader; more specifically, Monica trades in charcoal. She supplies charcoal to retailers and food vendors in her community. She also travels to other communities to supply them with charcoal. Monica buys her bags of charcoal from charcoal burners in nearby towns. Monica has been in business for eight years and wants a loan, which she will use to buy bags of charcoal in bulk.

loans.use: purchasing bags of charcoal

loans.name: Education Group

texts.en:
Zaya Wallah is the leader of 'Education' group. There are four members in this group. Zaya Wallah is a married man; he lives with four daughters in district 11, Kabul, Afghanistan. They are in university and Zaya Wallah wants to take a loan for his business of fruit selling. He wants to buy necessary materials for his shop.

A. Ghafor and M. Omeir want to take a loan for their business of carpet weaving. They want to expand and progress their business. .M. Shekab wants to take a loan for his general store. He wants to make his shop larger. They have requested a group loan of 28,000 Afghani.

They want to thank AFSG in Afghanistan and all Kiva lenders who help poor people in Afghanistan.

loans.use: Expand and grow their businesses

loans.name: Honorata

texts.es:
La socia HONORATA pertenece al banco comunal “MERCAMUEBLE” y vive en la ciudad Imperial del Cusco. 

La socia tiene 30 años de edad, es soltera y tiene un pequeño restaurante. 
Ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con la atención de su restaurante. Ella prepara comida todos los días desayuno, almuerzo y cena. Su restaurante se encuentra ubicado muy cerca del mercado “MERCAMUEBLES” donde se venden muebles, el mercado esta ubicado en el primer paradero del distrito de San Sebastián de la provincia del Cusco. Ya son varios años con esta actividad y le ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone para en su trabajo.
       
La socia requiere el préstamo para aumentar el capital del negocio de venta de comida quiere comprar más insumos como arroz, aceite, azúcar, etc. Para preparar más platos de comida.    

La socia se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Honorata belongs to the Mercamueble Communal Bank. She lives in the Imperial city of Cusco. She is 30, single, and has a small restaurant. She alternates her activities between her household and the restaurant. She makes breakfast, lunch, and dinner everyday. Her restaurant is located very close to the Mercamuebles Market, where they sell furniture. The market is located at the first bus stop in the San Sebastían district, Cusco province. She has been doing this for many years. It has gone very well for her thanks to all of the effort she puts into her work. She needs a loan to increase the capital in her food selling business. She wants to buy more supplies like rice, oil, and sugar, etc. to prepare her dishes. She is grateful for the opportunity of the loan, and she promises to make her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase capital in her food selling business

loans.name: Neomila

texts.es:
Neomila es una socia trabajadora y dinámica, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, región de Ucayali.
Tiene 43 años de edad, madre de tres hijos, todos mayores de edad.Cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo que es docente de primaria.
Neomila se dedica a la venta de jugos, la cual realiza en su casa.
Forma parte del Banco Comunal “De la Amistad” desde hace once años, donde se ha caracterizado por ser puntualy activa.
El primer crédito que recibió fue de 300.00 nuevos soles, que utilizó para comprar frutas y venderlas en su casa. 
Ahora ella necesita un crédito de 1000.00 nuevos soles que serán utilizados para la compra de mesas, sillas y licuadora para implementar su negocio; así mismo invertirá en la compra de calaminas para cambiar el techo de su negocio. 
La meta de Neomila es llegar a tener un restaurant y muchos clientes.
texts.en:
Neomila is a hardworking and dynamic partner. She lives in the city of Pucallpa, Ucayali region. She is 43 years old and the mother of three children, all adults. She has the support of her husband, who is a schoolteacher. Neomila earns her living selling juice, which she does from her home. She has been a member of the communal bank "De la Amistad" for eleven years. She has been characterized there as being punctual and active. The first loan she received was for 300.00 nuevos soles, which she used to purchase fruit and sell it in her house. Now she needs a loan of 1000.00 nuevos soles which will be used to purchase tables, chairs and a blender to use in her business. She will also invest in corrugated iron sheets to change the roof of her business. Neomila's goal is to be able to have a restaurant and many clients.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will use the loan to purchase tables, chairs, and a blender to use in her business.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en: Lilia L. is from the village of Caputol. She is 53 years old, is married, and has seven adult children. Lilia owns and operates a business planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2004, Lilia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Lilia is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 7th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en:
Jessie V. is from the village of Poblacion 1, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 36 years old. Jessie is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Jessie operates motor transport services. He has been engaged in his business for over a year and earns approximately $225 a month from this activity.

In 2010, Jessie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation by engaging in business activities. Jessie is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. This will be his first loan from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair an existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Umeda

texts.en:
B. Umeda is 35 years old, married and has three children. She works with her husband, purchasing and reselling cows. Umeda would like to request a loan of 4,000 TJS in order to purchase additional cows to increase her inventory and meet customer demands. She believes this will lead to greater revenue and, ultimately, greater profit for her family. 

In the future, Umeda would like to reinvest the earnings generated by this loan back into her business to purchase more cows and increase their income further. They plan to use the increased income to fund their children’s education. You could become an important part of Umeda's family's life. She deeply appreciates the trust and support you are giving her. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 
But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase additional cattle to expand her business.

loans.name: Zaida

texts.es:
Zaida es una mujer emprendedora y muy alegre de 26 años, es soltera y vive en su casa propia junto a su hermana menor, Leyla de 22, y su sobrino de 4 años.
Desde hace 10 años se dedica a la venta de pescado en un puesto del mercado modelo de su ciudad, contando con la ayuda de su padre quien le enseñó este oficio. Asimismo, tres veces a la semana vende carne de res y lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es filetear la carne para parrilladas, pero por otro lado, lo que le desagrada estar en contacto permanente con el agua, pues le provoca dolores en los huesos.
Para el futuro, Zaida ambiciona instalar una carnicería, es por eso que con las ganancias de sus ventas compró una máquina cortadora, moledora; además adquirió un motocarro que alquila diario a 20 soles para obtener ganancias extras.

Este es su séptimo préstamo con MFP y está muy contenta de trabajar con los integrantes de su banco comunal, del cual ella es una de las fundadoras y quien les enseñó a laborar con esmero y puntualidad en sus pagos. Con los tres mil trescientos nuevos soles que solicita desea viajar a la ciudad de Lima para comprar 200 cerdos, los que traerá a su ciudad para vender su carne a los comerciantes del mercado.
texts.en:
Zaida is an enterprising and happy woman of 26 years of age. She is single and lives in her own home with her younger sister Leyla, 22 years old, and her 4 years old nephew. For the last ten years she has been selling fish at a stand in a market in her city. She has been able to count on the help of her father, who taught her this trade. Additionally, she sells beef three times a week. She really enjoys cutting the meat for grilling, but she dislikes being in constant contact with water, which brings on pain in her bones. In the future, Zaida plans to open a butcher shop. Because of this goal, she bought a cutting and grinding machine with her profits and also acquired a car which she rents out at 20 soles per day to obtain additional income. This is her seventh loan with MFP and she is very happy to be working with the members of her community bank, of which she is one of the founders. She has taught her fellow members to carefully work and be punctual with their payments. With the 3,300 new soles that she is requesting she wishes to travel to Lima to purchase 200 pigs, which she will bring to her city to sell their meat to the customers of the market.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase pigs to sell their meat.

loans.name: Katana Kitsao

texts.en:
Katana, 41, is married to Joyce (a businesswoman). They have two children, Sifa and Amina. 

Katana's tailoring business, which is 23 years old, is located in Gede-Malindi, where he targets students at a neighboring college and primary schools within the area. He earns a monthly profit of Kshs. 12,000. 

Katana is borrowing his first loan with Kadet, and has previously borrowed from another microfinance organization. He was introduced to Kadet by the chairman of his group. He hopes to save the extra income from this loan for his children’s education.

Katana, who describes himself as a hardworking man, dreams of owning a big house and being a major supplier of coconuts.

loans.use: To buy sacks for distributing coconuts worth Kshs 6,000, purchasing tailoring materials worth Kshs 10,000 and repair of his business premises with Kshs 4,000

loans.name: Ilda

texts.es:
La señora Ilda tiene 34 años está casada con el señor Néstor Quiroz y tienen 3 hijos, son una familia de escasos recursos económicos ya que actualmente no tienen casa propia y viven en una casa en la cual doña Ilda trabaja cuidando dicha casa por la cual recibe un pequeño pago mensualmente.

Doña Ilda y su familia viven en la ciudad de Cochabamba en la localidad de Viloma Grande, su principal actividad es la producción de la leche cruda cuyo producto venden a una empresa que se dedica a la elaboración de productos lácteos, actualmente solo cuenta con 3 cabezas de ganado lechero y también tiene yuntas los cuales alquila para el arado de la tierra, doña Ilda es muy trabajadora que se dedica a varias actividades más entre las cuales también vende alfa alfa y el esposo se dedica al servicio de la construcción , trabaja como contratista en la misma zona.

El préstamo será destinado para la compra de una cabeza de ganado lechero con lo cual incrementara el nivel de producción de la leche y mejorara el nivel de ingresos. Entre sus sueños y metas es ofrecer una casa a sus hijos y una educación hasta que tengan una carrera profesional.Doña Ilda ya cuenta con un terreno la cual le heredo su padre y su meta ahora es construir una hermosa casa la cual cuente con habitaciones para  sus tres hijos ya que en la casa donde viven solo tienen 2 habitaciones y se encuentran muy incómodos.
texts.en:
Ilda is 34, married to Néstor Quiroz, and has three children. Their family has scant economic resources. They currently do not have their own house. Ilda works taking care of the house in which they live. She receives a small monthly payment. Ilda and her family live in the city of Cochabamba in Viloma Grande. Her main activity is the production of raw milk. She sells her production to a business that makes dairy products. She currently only has three heads of dairy cows. She also has a team that she rents to plow the land. Ilda is a very hard-worker, and she does several other activities. One of those activities is selling alfalfa. Her husband works in construction. He works as a contractor in the same area. The loan is to buy a dairy cow to increase milk production and improve earnings. Among her dreams and goals is giving her children a home and an education until they have a professional career. Ilda has a piece of land that she inherited from her father. Her goal now is to build a beautiful house with rooms for her three children. The house they live in only has two rooms, and they are very uncomfortable.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses O. is a hardworking man. He sells planks in Oyo State, Nigeria. He is a happy man who has been in this business for a long time. He is 56 years old and married with six children. His children are doing well in business and school. He is requesting a loan of 100,000 nairas to purchase more planks to sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more planks to sell

loans.name: Amina

texts.en: Amina M. is married and has four children. She has not received any form of education.  Amina sells fruits and vegetables near a market at Akotokyire. Her husband is a driver.  Amina uses the income she generates from the sale of her fruits to help her husband in the general upkeep of the home.  Amina will use the loan to purchase more fruits and foods like plantains for sale. With the new earnings from her expanded business, Amina plans to save to provide a better education for her children.

loans.use: purchase more fruits and foods for resale

loans.name: Ana Delmy

texts.es: Ana Delmy N. de 40 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de ropa para damas y caballeros, esto lo hace con el deseo de poder brindarle toda la ayuda necesaria a su esposo con quien viven en el municipio de Ilopango, ubicado en la capital del país la cual es San Salvador. Ana comercializa la ropa de forma ambulante por diferentes pueblos como Cojutepeque, Ilobasco, Sensuntepeque, los cuales están ubicados en el departamento de Cuscatlán. Ella recorre grandes distancias para poder vender por lo menos la mitad de su mercadería diaria, de esta manera ella se asegura poder obtener ganancias las cuales no solo le permitan solventar los gastos de la casa, sino también, seguir invirtiendo en el negocio, lo cual en muchas ocasiones es algo difícil. Es por esto que Ana solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda poseer el dinero necesario para comprar más ropa.
texts.en:
Ana Delmy N. is 40 years old and sells clothing for men and women in order to provide for her needs. She lives with her husband in Ilopango, which is located in San Salvador, the national capital. Ana sells her merchandise as a traveling vendor in different towns such as Cojutepeque, Ilobasco, and Sensuntepeque, which are all located in the Department of Cuscatlán. She walks great distances to conduct her business and is able to sell at least half of her daily inventory, which enables her to cover her household expenses. Ana also earns enough to reinvest in her business, which is often difficult to do.

She is requesting a loan so that she can have the necessary funds to buy more clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase different styles of clothing to sell

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: Isabel, de 43 años, vive con su esposo y sus 5 hijos en su casa que es  propia.Desde hace  más de 15 años  se dedica a las labores agrícolas  en sus terrenos de cultivo donde siembra alfalfa que vende, y que además le sirve como alimento para sus animales. Sus hijos la apoyan en la labor, durante sus ratos libres. Ella compra toros jóvenes y delgados, que luego  engorda alimentándolos bien, y después de varios meses los vende a un mejor precio. Estas actividades le han permitido tener buenos ingresos económicos para su familia, es por esta razón  que se ha propuesto  adquirir  más  animales para incrementar su  capital de trabajo.Es la oportunidad número 13 que tiene un crédito con MFP, y promete que será  muy responsable con el pago de sus cuotas, además  agradece a todas las personas que hicieron posible el  préstamo que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio.Isabel tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de 2 toros jóvenes para engordarlos, y  de esta manera desea seguir progresando.
texts.en:
Isabel is 43 years old. She lives with her husband and their 5 children in their own home. For more than 15 years, she has been doing agricultural work in her fields where she grows alfalfa, which she sells and also uses as feed for her animals. Her children help her with the work during their free time. She buys young, thin bulls and then fattens them up by feeding them well. After several months, she sells them at a higher price. These activities have allowed her to have good financial income for her family, and this is why she wants to adquire more animals to increase her working capital. This is the 13th opportunity she has had with a loan from MFP, and she promises that she will be responsible with making her payments. She also thanks all of the people who made the loan possible, as it will be very useful for her business' progress.Isabel plans on investing the money she has asked for in purchasing 2 young bulls to fatten them up, and in this way continue progressing.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy two young bulls

loans.name: Melvin

texts.en: Melvin V. is from the town of Villa Marzo Cordon. He is 27 years old and is married. Melvin owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. He has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. Aside from his general store, he also ventures in the printing of T-shirt designs as his other source of income. In 2009, Melvin joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Melvin is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will again be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be his second from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more rice, oil, beans, fish, meat and some drinks

loans.name: Diouma

texts.fr: Diouma S. est une femme de 63, elle est veuve et mère de 03 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de KANDIA depuis le 01er juin 2007 et a été 06 fois de suite bénéficiaire de crédit et n'a jamais eu de problème de remboursement. La réception de son crédit coïncide avec la tombée de l'hivernage et ça lui permettra d'acheter des semences d'arachide et de mil et de l'engrais pour faire une bonne campagne hivernale. Les récoltes lui permettront de vivre et faire des reserves et quand une partie sera vendu ça lui permettra de subvenir aux besoins familiaux
texts.en:
Diouma S. is a 63 year old woman. She is a widow and the mother of 3 children. She has been a member of KANDIA's "Banc Villageois" since June 1, 2007. She has benefited from 6 consecutive loans and has never had a problem repaying. The loan received coincides with the arrival of the rainy season. It will allow her to purchase peanut seeds, millet seeds and fertilizer to achieve a good winter campaign. The harvest will enable her to save and will allow her to provide for her family's needs once part of the harvest will be sold.

Translated from French by Marie-Elodie Bazy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Mrs. Saroeun Phul Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan, located in Kdol village in Takeo province, has eighteen people. They have all selected Mrs. Saroeun P., who is 29 years old, as the village bank president. They will use their portion of the loan in varied ways to improve their businesses.

Mrs. Saroeun P. is a farmer who owns a half-hectare (1.25-acre) plot of land that she uses to cultivate rice to sell to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Vorn V., is a construction worker.

Mrs. Saroeun P. faces a problem in that her field has infertile soil. So, to improve production, she is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer. With the rest of the loan she will hire a farm laborer to help her to grow rice.

Mrs. Saroeun P. is the mother of four children, two of whom are attending the local school while the others are too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to hire a farm laborer

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios L. is from the village of Eastern, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 56 years old. Remedios is married and has 9 adult children. To make a living, Remedios owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food & daily use products and also fruits like sweet bananas in the local community. Remedios has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 4500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Remedios joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Remedios is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Remedios from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Nema

texts.en: Nema U. is currently in the business of selling mixed goods such as biscuits, cartons of salt, cartons of powdered milk etc in a retail shop and is requesting a loan to stock bags of sugar, coffee, tea leaves and more cartons of salt to sell.  Nema is 28 years old and is married to a soldier. She has three children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to extend the floor of her restaurant.

loans.use: To stock sugar, coffee, tea leaves and salt to sell

loans.name: Rita

texts.es: Rita tiene 30 años, vive soL. en su casa propia. DesD. que era niña se ha dedicado a L. agricultura, ya que fue su principal fuente D. ingreso económico, siendo los productos que más cultivo es L. papa y el maíz. Al cabo D. 6 meses aproximadamente son cosechados, por lo que requiere D. L. ayuda D. peones para que le faciliten L. extracción D. estos productos. Se siente muy contenta D. realizar este trabajo  porque se considera una persona capaz e independiente, y por tal desea ampliar sus campos para cultivar más a fin D. aumentar L. producción. Es su primer crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta D.  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte D. su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso D. sus actividades. El crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en L. compra D. sacos D. abono para su campaña D. siembra.
texts.en:
Rita is 30 and lives alone in her own home. From her childhood she has farmed, as it was her main source of income. The products that she cultivates the most are potatoes and corn. After about 6 months there is a harvest, for which she requires the help of labourers to facilitate the extraction of these products. She is very happy doing this work because she considers herself to be a capable and independent person. She wants to expand her land in order to cultivate more crops and increase production. This is her first loan with MFP. She is very happy to know that she has financial support. She is grateful to be part of her community bank because all of her peers are responsible and supportive. She thanks those who will lend money toward this loan. It will be very useful in the progress of her activities. She will invest the loan in the purchase of bags of fertilizer for planting.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es:
Ricardo es un padre de familia de 63 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa en el distrito de Olmos, una zona agrícola con bastante movimiento comercial que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Lambayeque, a mas de una hora y cuarenta y cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Durante su juventud sirvió en las fuerzas armadas del Perú y actualmente percibe una pension mensual, como este ingreso no es suficiente para hacerse cargo de la economía de su familia decidió dedicarse al negocio de alquiler de cuartos, el alquila algunos cuartos de su casa a los diversos trabajadores que llegan a la zona.

Ricardo desea habilitar algunas habitaciones para poder brindarle comodidad a sus inquilinos, para realizar esta acción ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 800 nuevos soles.

Ricardo es una persona tranquila y de trato amable, sus vecinos y conocidos dan muy buenas referencias suyas y le consideran alguien tranquilo y colaborador.
texts.en:
Ricardo is a 63 year old father who lives with his wife in the district of Olmos, an agricultural area that experiences some commercial activity. This community is located in Lambayeque Province, which is an hour and forty-five minutes away from the city of Chiclayo.

In his youth, Ricardo served in the Peruvian armed forces and now receives a monthly pension. This income is not enough to cover the family expenses, so he decided to start a business renting rooms. The rooms are located in his house and he rents to different workers who come to the area.

Ricardo wants to remodel some of the rooms so that they will be more comfortable for his tenants. In order to carry out this plan, he has decided to apply for his first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 800 PEN.

Ricardo is a peaceful and friendly person. His neighbors and acquaintances give him very good references and consider him to be a quiet and cooperative individual.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Remodel rooms for rent

loans.name: Igor

texts.en:
Igor is single. He has a transportation business in his home town of Ivano-Frankivsk, Western Ukraine. Igor offers transportation services all over the territory of Ukraine. He’s known as a very careful and experienced driver which is why he always has many clients, including VIP ones. Igor started this business eight years ago. Presently, his monthly income amounts to 7,000 Grivnyas (UAH). 

Igor is requesting an 12,000 Grivnas (UAH) loan to purchase parts and do some maintenance work on his car. This business is the main source of income for Igor. He works really hard to save his money because he wants to buy an apartment of his own.

loans.use: Purchase parts and do maintenance

loans.name: Luz Del Esfuerzo Group

texts.es:
El grupo Luz del Esfuerzo lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras provenientes de Masaya, ciudad de las Flores, una de ellas es Silvia Alejandra C. O. quien tiene un pequeño y modesto taller de costura donde su especialidad son la ropa de niños y niñas. Hace cuatro años C. inicio este negocio por unos pequeños encargo las ganancias de su trabajo las ahorro para poder crear su taller.
Ella es madre y padre para sus dos hijos de 11 y 5 años por quienes labora arduamente para que tengan estudio y una infancia feliz. La meta de esta joven es poder tener su casa propia, ya que habita en el hogar de sus padres. 
Las otras integrantes del grupo son Vilma R. de 55 años quien se dedica a la realización de tortillas, cosa de horno y nacatamales actividad que entre risas dijo que realiza desde que nació, y María O. de 53 años desde hace tres años tiene una pequeña fritanga donde el producto que más se venden son las tajadas con queso.
texts.en:
The Luz del Esfuerzo group is comprised of three hard-working women from Masaya in the city of Las Flores.  

Silvia Alejandra C. O. is one of the members.  She has a small, modest sewing shop; and she specializes in children’s clothes.  Four years ago C. started this business with some small orders.  She saved the earnings from her work in order to be able to create her shop.  She is mother and father to her two children, ages 11 and 5.  She works arduously so that they can have an education and a happy childhood.  This young woman’s goal is to be able to have her own house because she is now living in her parents’ house.

Vilma Roche, age 55 is another member of the group.  She makes tortillas, baked goods, and “nacatamales” (steamed meat and vegetable pastry, cooked in banana or maize leaves).  She laughs as she says that she has been doing this ever since she was born.

María O., age 53, is the other member.  She has had a small business selling fried food for three years.  The product she sells the most is plantain chips with cheese.

loans.use: Fabric, thread, and elastic

loans.name: Lucero De La Mañana Group

texts.es: Doña Federica P., tiene cuarenta y cuatro años de edad, ella es analfabeta, tiene 7 hijos, dos mayores de edad casadas y 5 menores de edad y que tienen bajo su responsabilidad, su esposo se dedica a la confección de pantalones y ella se dedica a la venta de ropas típicas en el mercado de la aldea y cuenta con 8 años de experiencia y de esta forma obtiene ganancias para poder colaborar con los gastos de su familia. Contando con entusiasmo, deseos de superación y la ayuda de unas vecinas  y compañeras de un programa de agricultura organizan un grupo, para poder solicitar un préstamo. El Banco Comunal se denomina Lucero de la Mañana, el nombré fue elegido por todas las integrantes. El grupo cuenta con 10 integrantes mujeres, quienes se dedican a diversas actividades entre ellos podemos mencionar; la crianza de animales, Confección de Delantales y Pantalones, Venta de Consumo Diario y ropas típicas.  El préstamo ella lo utilizará para compra de ropas típicas, para incrementar su negocio. Ya que el sueño de ella es que su negocio crezca, pero por falta de capital, no ha podido, y considera que este crédito le ayudará aumentar su negocio y generara más ingresos para su desarrollo personal y familiar.
texts.en:
Federica P. is 44 years old, and she is illiterate.  She has seven children.  Two of them are grown and married, and five of them are minors for whom she is responsible.  Her husband makes pants, and she sells typical clothing in the village market.  She has eight years of experience.  This is how she gets income to be able to help with the family expenses.

With enthusiasm, the desire to succeed, and the help of neighbors and colleagues in the agricultural program, they organized a group to be able to request a loan.  The name of their communal bank is “Lucero de la Mañana”.  The name was selected by all of the members.  The group is comprised of ten women who have different business activities.  Among those business activities is making aprons and pants and selling daily consumer goods and typical clothing. 

She will use the loan to buy typical clothing in order to increase her business.  Her dream is to make her business grow.  However, due to a lack of capital, she has not been able to do so. She believes that this loan will help increase her business and generate more income for personal and family growth.

loans.use: Working capital to buy and sell typical clothing

loans.name: Rosa Karina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PROGRESO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.


La socia es la Sra. Rosa Karina; ella tiene 30 años de edad y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia se dedica a trabajar en el poder judicial, ella es abogada, ella trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 3:00 p.m y por medio de este trabajo saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere seguir mejorando en el aspecto laboral. La socia solicita el préstamo para el estudio de sus hijos.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our associate is a member of the "Progreso" communal bank, located within the district, province, and departmetn of Cusco.

 Karina is 30 years old, married and has three children.  She is an attorney, works from 7:00 AM to 3:00 PM and manages to help her children get ahead.  She would like to continue improving her work.  She is asking for this loan to pay tuition for her children's schooling.

She appreciates those who have helped to make her dream a reality through this means and is committed to making all of her payments on time.

loans.use: Tuition for her children

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is a bodaboda (motorcycle transport) operator in Kiambu. He is requesting a loan of 30,000 Kes to buy a motorcycle for his business. He has been operating this business for two years in a very good environment. He is a member of Kagwe Faith SHG and the group has guaranteed his loan. David is also employed in a tea factory. He is very hardworking and hopes to own a motorbike taxi firm.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Cherrie Mae

texts.en:
Cherrie Mae A. is from the village of Kibaning, Kalilangan, Bukidnon. She is 19 years old and married. To make a living, Cherrie Mae owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, junk food, canned goods, and toothpaste in the local community. Cherrie Mae has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Cherrie Mae joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cherrie Mae is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like biscuits and instant noodles. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Cherrie Mae from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell like biscuits & instant noodles.

loans.name: Marithah

texts.en: Marithah A. O. is forty three years old. She is married and they have five children aged between twenty years old and ten years old. Her business is located in the town of Kakamega, which is in the region in Kenya known for production of sugarcane that is well known as the sugarbelt region. Marithah sells clothes and school uniforms to the local residents. She has been in this business for eight years now. She says that this business is profitable and the only major challenge she has is that there are very many people in the area with the same kind of business as hers, hence customers are spoilt for choice. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of Kes 60,000 to buy school uniforms to sell as the school will open soon. In the future, she hopes to expand her business and purchase land. She describes herself as a hardworking and visionary lady.

loans.use: School uniforms

loans.name: Rwenkuba Bakyara Tukore Group-Rukungiri

texts.en:
Ireen T., 55, is married and has five children. 

She has been engaged in a retail shop business in Katerera-Rukungiri for eight years. She says she used savings from her farming business to set forth in this business. 

To stay relevant and afloat in this business, she has had to summon up a lot of unwavering determination, perseverance and diligence. Weekly, this business generates her 70,000 shillings. With this loan, she says she is going to purchase more retail commodities to resell.

loans.use: To purchase more retail commodities to resell

loans.name: Bonifacia

texts.en:
Bonifacia T., from the village of Tabon, is 60 years old, married, and has five children. To make a living, Bonifacia operates a business venture in food production/sales. Her products include baked goods which are locally known as Biko, Puto, Putomaya, etc.

In 2008, Bonifacia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Now requesting her seventh loan for 5,000 PHP to buy ingredients for baking, she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for baking foods.

loans.name: Candido

texts.en:
Candido E. is from the village of Compra, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. He is 40 years old. Candido is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Candido is starting a business venture in the services sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing general services to local community members. Candido has been engaged in his business for over 6 years and earns approximately 15000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009,Candido joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Candido has successfully repaid a previous loan of 40000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Candido is requesting a new loan of 40000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Candido from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Las Animas Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama "Las Animas", porque asi se llama el pueblo. Esta ubicado en el Estado D. Mexico. El grupo esta conformado por 9 integrantes. Gabina Nancy P. es integrante del grupo. Tiene 27 años, estudio hasta L. secundaria, es comerciantes, tiene en total 3 hijos, 1 mujer y 2 hombres. ElL. se dedica a L. venta D. tortillas, negocio que inicio hace 1 año. Solicita el prestamo para comprar maiz por tonelas. Sus clientes son sus propias vecinas, ellas argumentan que L. tortilL. que les venD. esta bien hecha y estan muy sabrosa.Al momento D. solicitar este prestamo se siente feliz y aliviada porque con el credito podra invertir en su negocio, asi le resulta más barato que comprar por bultos. Con las ganancias que obtendra espera en un futuro no muy lejano tener su propio local porque en estos momentos renta y así tendrá mayores ganancias para ofrecerles una mejor vida y educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
This group is called "Las Animas", named after the village. which is located in Mexico. The group is maD. up of nine members. Gabina Nancy P. is a member of the group. She is 27 years old, attended school through secondary school, and has three children, one girl and two boys.  

Gabina sells tortillas. She started her business a year ago and is requesting a loan to buy maize in bulk. Her customers are her neighbors, and say that the tortillas Gabina sells are well maD. and delicious. Gabina is happy and relieved to have the loan to invest in her business because buying in bulk will allow her to lower her costs. With the business profit she obtains, she hopes to have her own store in the near future. Gabina currently rents and with the money saved she will be able to offer a better life and education to her children.

loans.use: To purchase maize.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca B. is 52 years old, married, and has six children. They live in the town of Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. Rebecca and her husband are both farmers. Rice is the primary crop that they plant and harvest. They also raise pigs in their backyard. Rebecca says that she and her husband work hard to provide for their family and sustain their children's education.  Rebecca is requesting a loan, which will be used to purchase fertilizers and pig feed.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and pig feed

loans.name: María Del Socorro

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Managua. La Sra. María del Socorro Salgada García, se dedica  arduamente a laborar como conserje  dedicándose a esta labor desde hace más de veinte años, es casada y con tres  hijos a los que tiene que proporcionarles las condiciones necesarias para que se desarrollen.
Una de las necesidades que la Sra. María atraviesa hoy en día es que debe mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda debido a que ha estado en malas condiciones por lo que a tomado la sabia decisión de iniciar la obra de mejora. Es por ese motivo que acude a ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de materiales de construcción como: zinc, perlines, clavos y pintura. Para realizar la mejora de  la vivienda realizando  el cambio de techo y pintar. 
Por medio de esta obra brindara mejores condiciones de vida a sus hijos.
Es importante destacar que por medio de la realización de esta obra, le proporcionara a su familia un techo digno donde vivir y con todas las condiciones necesarias para el desarrollo de sus hijos.
texts.en:
In the city of Managua, Maria has dedicated herself arduously to working as a caretaker for more than 20 years. She is married with 3 children for whom she must provide the necessary conditions for their development. 

One of the necessities that Maria confronts today is the need to improve the condition of her house. It has been in bad condition, and she is now made the wise decision to begin its improvement. This is why she approached Ceprodel, soliciting a loan to buy materials such as zinc sheeting, crossbeams, nails, and paint. She wants to put on a new roof and paint the house. This will provide better living conditions for her children.

It is important to point out that after completing this work, her family will have a worthy roof where they live and enjoy all the necessary conditions for the development of the children.

loans.use: TO BUY CONSTRUCTION MATERIALS (ZINC SHEETING, CROSSBEAMS, NAILS, AND PAINT) TO REPLACE THE ROOF AND PAINT THE HOUSE

loans.name: Ronald Francisco

texts.es: Ronald tiene 22 años de edad es soltero, vive en casa de sus padres, Ronald tiene una mototaxi el mismo lo trabaja desde hace 1 año poniendole mucho empeño en su trabajo ya que hace movilidad escolar, Ronal como todo joven tiene sueños y metas y uno de ellos es poder adquirir otra Mototaxi asi poder crecer sus ingresos economicos, con  el dinero comprara un toldo y puerta para la mototaxi
texts.en: Ronald is 22 years old and single. He lives in his parents' house, together with his older siblings. Ronald has a moto-taxi, with which he has been working for 1 year. He puts great effort into his work, since he drives schoolchildren starting very early in the morning. Like all young people, Ronald has dreams and goals, and one of these is to acquire another moto-taxi so that he can increase his income. With the money he will buy a canvas cover and door for his moto-taxi.

loans.use: to purchase a canvas cover and a door for his mototaxi

loans.name: Villa Quiquijana Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “VILLA QUIQUIJANA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Urcos, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Martina; ella es soltera y tiene 48 años y tiene 7 hijos; La socia trabaja con su negocio de picantería, ella vende comida y también vende chicha (bebida a base de maíz), la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m y por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante  a sus hijos, la socia quiere mejorar la atención de su negocio de picantería. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para preparar la chicha y para comprar productos para cocinar la comida como arroz, carne y fideos.


Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio de tienda de abarrotes, venta de helados, compra y venta de granos, negocio de venta de golosinas, compra y venta de animales.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members are part of the “VILLA QUIQUIJANA” communal bank.  This bank is located in the Urcos district, which is part of the Quispicanchis province and the Cusco department.

Martina is 48 year old, single, and has seven children.  She works her food business, selling food and chicha (a fermented corn-based beverage), works from 8:00 am to 6:00 pm, and moves her children ahead through this business.  She would like to improve her customer service and is asking for this loan in order to buy ingredients for making chicha and for preparing her food; things like rice, meat, and noodles.

The other members run grocery stores, sell ice cream, buy and sell grains, sell snacks, and buy and sell livestock.

[Martina] appreciates those who form part of this dream through this medium and promises to make her payments on schedule.

loans.use: to buy ingredients

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is a married woman with 5 children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past five years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling household items like maize flour, wheat flour, sugar and rice. She faces a major challenge of theft because of lack of security in her area. Pauline dreams of establishing a poultry farm in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 loan, she wants to install water pipes for the purpose of plumbing in her house. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to install water pipes for plumbing in her house

loans.name: Luka

texts.en: Luka is 29 years old, married and blessed with a five-year-old child.  He earns his living by repairing vehicles.  In addition, he owns a vehicle which he uses for a transport business.  Through Faulu Kenya, he has gained business knowledge that has helped him to sustain his business for nine years.  He hopes to start importing new cars for sale in the future.  He has requested 60,000 KES to buy spare vehicle parts.

loans.use: To buy spare vehicle parts

loans.name: Marcelo Vicente

texts.en:
Marcelo, age 37, works with metal in his workshop. He is completely dedicated to his work, very active, and has a lot of energy. He seeks this loan to buy raw material for his business. Marcelo and his wife live near the city of Otavalo, Ecuador, and have a nine-year-old daughter.
 
Marcelo's business is going very well thanks to a previous loan from FODEMI. Marcelo reports that his microenterprise is growing. He has been getting loans from FODEMI for a period of two years and has seen his economic condition improve. His goal is to see his microenterprise grow much larger. He wants to expand his workshop and provide a higher standard of living for his family.

loans.use: to buy raw material for his metal workshop

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR D. HUANCA”; el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito D. Calca en la Provincia D. Urubamba y Departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Teresa; la socia tiene 59 años D. edad, la socia es casada, La socia tiene 2 hijos D. 38, 36 años D. edad; la socia se dedica  a la crianza D. animales menores, la socia la socia cría chanchos, gallinas, cuyes,  la socia también tiene ganados, la socia ahora desea invertir en el crédito en la compra D. vacas, la socia las cría engorda y al final los venD., en la se considera comerciante minorista en la crianza y venta final D. animales menores y vacunos, La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra D. vacas para la crianza.

La socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir D. manera disciplinada con los pagos D. las cuotas.
texts.en:
Teresa is a member of the “SEÑOR D. HUANCA” communal bank located in Calca District in Urubamba Province and Cusco Department.

She is 59 years old, married and has two children who are 38 and 36 years of age.  She raises small farm animals like pigs, chickens and guinea pigs.  She also has cattle.  She’d like to invest the loan in the purchase of cows that she’ll raise and sell.  She considers herself a retail merchant of cattle and small farm animals that she raises herself.  She is requesting the loan to buy cows to raise.

She is grateful for the loan that will be granted and commits to repay in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Em

texts.en:
Em is 36 year old, married, and has two children. She supports her family through the income she earns from making clothes. Her husband is a driver. They live in Ho Chi Minh City. 

She intends to take a loan to buy fabric and materials to make a greater range of clothing to better meet her customers' needs. She hope her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions and send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fabric and materials to make clothing.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
This is 48-year-old Mohamed.  He is married to a trader and has six children aged 2, 5, 8, 11, 16 and 21 years old. In 1981, Mohamed established his plastic slippers business. He began his business because he was a gold miner where he accessed his business capital and commerce trade in gold.  As his income continued to grow, he switched over to the sales of plastic shoes/slippers. Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about Le Le800,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le Le5,000,000.  Mohamed has already received and successfully repaid two loans and now requires a new loan to buy Foam slippers - 10 pkts. @ Le60,000, Rosa slippers - 20 pkts @ Le70,000, and Bucket designed slippers - 5 @ Le400,000. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le Le300,000.  

In the future, Mohamed plans to establish a boutique, send his children to the U.S. to study and visit the Holy Land - Mecca.  He wants to get his goods from Conakry and be a supplier. Mohamed is now boasting of having a house and being able to buy goods in larger quantities.  Price inconsistency, weather, and tax/customs fees are his challenges. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase assorted plastic slippers

loans.name: Gulgumcha

texts.ru:
Гулгумча замужем и любящая мать 3 детей. Она активная и целеустремленная женщина. Она занимается продажей парфюмерий и косметики в центральном местном рынке. Более 5 лет она занимается в этом бизнесе, и она имеет много постоянных клиентов. Она обслуживает все свои клиенты с улыбкою и с радостью. Гулгумча хочет, расширит свой бизнес и пополнит свой оборотный капитал.  С этой целью она просила кредит в размере 3000$ США. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en:
Gulgumcha is married and the loving mother of three children. She is an active and purposeful woman. She sells perfumes and cosmetics in the local market. For more than five years, she has worked in the business, and she has many loyal customers. She caters to all of her customers with a smile and with joy. Gulgumcha wants to expand her business and add to her working capital. To this end, she has requested a loan of $3000.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy perfumes and cosmetics.

loans.name: Lidia Oliva

texts.es:
Lidia tiene 35 años vive en Cotacachi con su esposo con sus dos hijos que tienen 14 y 4 años de edad. Lidia se describe como una persona tranquila, alegre, sincera y no se hace problema por nada.

Trabaja en la confección de vestidos de tela indú las mismas que entrega a oTAVALO. Trabaja con FODEMI desde el 2002, el crédito que solicita es para la compra de 150 metros de tela y también para la compra de hilos.

Con esta inversión incrementará: su trabajo, sus ventas, sus ingresos lo cual ayudará para dar una mejor educación a sus hijos.

Su sueño es tener un taller más grande para poder emplear a más gente y seguir dando lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
Lidia, 35, lives in Cotacachi with her husband and two children who are 14 and 4 years of age.  Lidia describes herself as a calm, cheerful, sincere person who tries not to create problems for herself.

She works making dresses out of Hindu fabric that she delivers to Otavalo.  She’s been working with FODEMI since 2002.  The loan she’s asking for is to buy 150 meters of fabric and also to buy thread.  With this investment she’ll increase her work, her sales and her income which will help her provide a better education for her children.  Her dream is to have a larger workshop to employ more people and continue to provide the best for her family.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread.

loans.name: Teodoro

texts.es: Teodoro tiene 44 años de edad, vive al lado de su esposa y su hijo en su casa propia desde hace 7 años viene radicando después de mudarse de su tierra natal. Es agricultor y transportista de mototaxi desde hace 10 años, decidió realizar estas tareas porque le era muy necesario cuando se trata de vivir en la ciudad, se dio cuenta que su economía se mantiene estable y en caso del transporte puede ver diariamente las ganancias ya que en la agricultura tiene que esperar meses. El servicio de transporte que ofrece es todos los días y todo el día la ruta es local dentro de su comunidad. Teodoro se siente mas seguro desarrollando estas actividades y tiene planes para su futuro, desea tener ganadería y a su vez una unidad mas de mototaxi para lo cual seguirá esforzándose. Es la primera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, decidió trabajar con de esta manera para mejorar las condiciones de su actividad económica ya que le informaron de las ventajas de acceder a un préstamo. Con del dinero va a mejorar la cochera de deposito que tiene en su misma casa y que le sirve para guardar su mototaxi para lo cual comprara cemento y otros materiales de construcción y pagar la mano de obra.
texts.en:
Teodoro is 44 years old and lives with his wife and son in their own house. He settled here seven years ago after moving from his hometown.

Teodoro has been a farmer and a mototaxi driver for ten years. He decided to work in these areas because he needed to do something to live in the city. He realized he needed a steady income, and with the transportation business he can see his earnings daily, since with agriculture he has to wait for months. He offers transportation services all day, everyday and has a local route in his community. Teodoro feels more secure having these activities, and he has plans for the future. He would like to have livestock and another mototaxi, and he keeps working toward this.

This is the first time he has had a loan with MFP. He decided to work in this way to improve his business conditions since he was told about the advantages of getting a loan. With the money, he will make improvements to the storage area he has at his house for storing his mototaxi. To do this he will buy cement and other construction materials and pay for labor.

loans.use: to improve the storage area he has at home for his mototaxi.

loans.name: Los Tigritos Group

texts.es: Margarito tiene 28 años D. edad es casado y no tiene niños pero dependen D. él sus padres ya que él se hace responsable D. ellos y les ayuda con los gastos D. la casa. El tiene una tienda D. abarrotes en su casa desD. hace 18 años, al princio obviamente la tienda era D. su papá y después, cuando Margarito ya era mayor, se la traspaso a Margarito ya que su papa estuvo varios años enfermo y no podía atender el negocio es por eso que se lo paso a Margarito. Comenta que el esta pidiendo un crédito a la financiera para la compra D. artículos para surtir su tienda D. abarrotes y comprar D. otras variedades D. productos, el quisiera vender alimento para pollos, frijol, arroz, maíz, shampoo, jabón etc. ya que esos productos no los venD. todavía en su tienda y el quisiera vender eso para que la gente D. su localidad no se traslaD. a otras localidades ya que su población esta muy retirada D. donD. venden esos productos. El esta muy contento D. recibir este apoyo como él le llama ya que podrá tener un poco mas D. ganancias y así darle a sus padres una mejor calidad D. vida. Los otros tres integrantes del grupo se llaman Adán, Margarito y Delfino ellos invertirán sus prestamos en la compra D. frutas y legumbres para su venta y en una tienda D. abarrotes.
texts.en:
Margarito is 28 years old, married and has no children but his parents depend on him and because he is responsible for them he helps them with the household expenses. He has had a grocery store in his house for 18 years, which obviously belonged to his father and later, when Margarito was older, it was passed on to Margarito because his father was sick for some years and could not take care of the business and that is why it became his. 

He tells us that he is asking for a loan in order to purchase items to supply his grocery store and to buy other kinds of products. He would like to sell chicken feed, beans, rice, corn, shampoo, soap and other items as he does not sell these products in his store. He would like to be able to sell them so that the local people do not have to travel to other places since they are located so far from where they sell these products. 

He is very happy to receive this support as he says he could have a little more earnings and thus be able to give his parents a better quality of life. The other three members of the group are called Adán, [another man called] Margarito, y Delfino. They will invest their loans in the purchase of fruit and vegetables to sell in a grocery store.

loans.use: to supply his grocery store

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty isa  25 year-old married woman with three children, one of whom is in school.  She has a business of selling clothes in the Hai Mahad area in Yei, South Sudan.  She has been in this business for six years.

Betty requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan so that she can order more beautiful clothes for her customers.  She says that the profits from this loan will help her to pay for her child to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine has been running a retail shop for six years – an idea she got to meet the needs of her school-going children. She also supplies fresh fruit to hotels for additional income. She is married and has three children, ages 18, 16, 10 years old. All attend school; the elder two in high schools and the last in primary school. She lives in Malindi town of the Coastal Province, Kenya. 

Josephine joined Milango in April, 2011, after an invitation from a friend. Her major challenge comes from her supply business where payments are made on a monthly basis. A loan of 60,000 Kenyan shillings will help Josephine restock her business with retail stock like soap, sugar, flour, oil, etc. Josephine intends to faithfully repay her upcoming loan, so she can obtain higher credit and establish a salon and a boutique. This loan will also help her obtain additional income to carry out farming on the piece of land she bought using her first loan. She hopes Milango partners, especially KIVA, will support her with credit for her upcoming businesses.

loans.use: to purchase retail stock like sugar, flour, oil, etc

loans.name: Nelfa

texts.en:
Nelfa is 42 years old and lives in Oroquieta City. She is married with two children.

Nelfa has a sari-sari (variety) store business and earns approximately 1,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work. She has a requested a loan of 14,900  to purchase more product stock for her general store.

Nelfa has been a member of PMPC for four years.

loans.use: to purchase more product stock for her general store.

loans.name: Najma's Group

texts.en:
Najma has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her clothes selling business. With the loan, she will buy clothes of different variety to sell to her customers at a profit.
 
She also does decorative embroidery works. She started these businesses six years ago to financially assist her family. Now she is well established in her businesses and earns a reasonable income every month. 

She is married and her husband has a furniture making business. He is very much expert in his business and sells his furniture to different furniture selling shops in the market and also supplies to other cities on order. 

Najma is the mother of three sons and two daughters. Her eldest son is a rickshaw driver, the second one is an auto vehicle mechanic, and her two daughters do decorative embroidery and help her in managing her business. Her youngest son is studying in class 9th. 

Najma is very confident that an investment will help her improve her clothes selling business and that she will be able to buy some dowry from her extra income to see that her elder daughter soon marries. 

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Najma.

loans.use: To buy clothes for selling.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a resident of Kitale in Western Kenya. He is 33, married and has four children aged between two and six years old. Moses has been in farming for ten years, mainly producing maize and beans for the local market. He also runs a cereals shop in the market.
Moses has made a loan request of 31,200 KES from Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says the milk produced will help to provide milk for his family as well as repay the loan. Moses wants to focus on improving his farming business and producing milk in bulk. He adds that fluctuations in milk prices remain the challenge in farming.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Majdi

texts.en: Majdi is a 41 year-old man.  He is married and has three sons and four daughters.  He is a driver in the Ministry of Education with a decent salary. Majdi wants to restore the house's entrance to improve his house conditions, but the amount of money he has isn't enough to pay.  He needs to take a loan of $2,000 from FATEN. When Majdi gets the loan, he will be able to pay all the expenses needed for restoring his house entrance.  This will give his house's entrance a good image.  Majdi is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: To restore the house's entrance.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a 42-year-old farmer from Talibon, Bohol. She has one child who is 17 years old.

She has been engaged in farming for ten years. She primarily grows rice crops to sell. 

Evelyn works hard to support herself and her child. She is planning to send her child to college soon.

Evelyn has requested this loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other farm inputs. Evelyn hopes to own a bigger farm in the future. She also hopes to sustain her child's college education.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Nigmat

texts.ru: Нигмат более семи лет занимается выращиванием овощей и зерновых культур. Ему 55 лет. Он женат. У него пятеро детей. Его сын находится в России на заработках. Он берет кредит для закупа топлива и минеральных удобрений.
texts.en: Nigmat has been involved in growing vegetables and cereal crops for over seven years.  He is 55 years old, married and has five children.  His son is in Russia for work.  Nigmat is requesting this loan for the purchase of fuel and mineral fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase fuel and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Jovelon

texts.en:
Jovelon is a father who has the strong determination to become successful someday. He is 32 years old and has three school-age children. He has owned and managed a corn farming business for almost 6 years and usually earns a profits of 20,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) every harvest season. He utilized his income for the food and allowances of his children. Due to the high cost of commodities and school fees, he needs to earn more income to satisfy their basic necessities.

In this regard, Jovelon planned to increase his corn production to earn a higher income. He is asking for an additional capital of 15,000 PHP to buy corn seeds, fertilizers and insecticides needed in corn production. He believes that he will increase his production and income as he continued to work hard and strive harder.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, fertilizers and insecticides needed in corn production

loans.name: Kaingi

texts.en: Kaingi is a 42-year-old single woman. She has two children with ages ranging from 5 years to 10 years old. She describes herself to be quiet and humble. She operates a grocery store where she sells tomatoes, potatoes, cabbage, kale, etc. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located near a busy market and her primary customers are frequent and new. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds to improve the grocery store. She will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy more potatoes. Her business goal is to be a supplier of potatoes in large quantities within five years.

loans.use: To buy more potatoes

loans.name: Zoubairou

texts.fr:
Né en Novembre 1974 à Sikasso, Monsieur  Zoubairou  est marié et père des trois enfants. Il réside avec sa famille dans une grande famille traditionnelle élargie à Wayerma I, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso.
Monsieur Zoubairou est dans ce domaine du commerce d’engrais et semences, pesticides et insecticides depuis sa tendre enfance.
