Cette activité est le seul métier de la famille depuis au temps de son père, donc il connaît le domaine en détail mais les moyens lui font défaut pour pouvoir satisfaire ainsi sa clientèle qui ne cesse d’augmenter.
 Il décide alors de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui  il est à son premier crédit qui lui permettra d’acheter 3 cartons de semences PV, 5 cartons de semences tropical, 50 sacs d’engrais 13 boîte pesticides et insecticides. Il s’approvisionne au Ghana et en Côte d’Ivoire avant de les revendre en gros et en détail dans sa boutique à une clientèle composée généralement d’agriculteurs, de jardiniers, etc. Certains de ses clients payent au comptant, d’autre à crédit.
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 200 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour  contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Born on November 1974 in Sikasso, Mr. Zoubairou is a married father of three children. He resides with his family in a large traditional extended family in Wayerma I, a working-class district of Sikasso City. Mr. Zoubairou has been in the business of selling fertilizer, seeds, pesticides, and insecticides since he was very young. This business has been the family's only trade since his father's time, so he has a detailed knowledge of the sector. 

But he is short on funds for satisfying his ever-growing customer base. He has therefore decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso and is now on his first loan, which will enable him to buy 3 boxes of PV seeds, 5 boxes of tropical seeds, 50 sacks of fertilizer, and 13 containers of pesticides et insecticides. 

He gets his supplies from Ghana and from Cote d'Ivoire and then sells them wholesale and retail in his shop. His customers are composed generally of farmers, gardeners, etc. Some of his customers pay in cash, others on credit. 

With this loan, Mr. Zoubairou envisions making a monthly profit of 200,000 francs CFA that will be used essentially to help with family expenses, to pay the loan interest, and to invest the rest in his business.

loans.use: to buy various farming supplies

loans.name: Daouda

texts.fr: Monsieur Daouda habite environ à 2km du Guichet. Marié et père de 6 enfants, il évolue dans l'agriculture ( maraichage) depuis 5 ans. Il cultive du piment, des gombo et des tomates suivant leur campagne. Avec les revenus Monsieur Daouda nourrit sa familles et épargne. Il commence sa journée à 8h pour la terminer à 19h. Il sollicite ce prêt d'un montant de 150.000F pour acheter des semences. A l'avenir Daouda souhaite augmenter ses revenus avec l'aide de l'IMCEC et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: Acheter des semences pour préparer l'hivernage

loans.name: Dy's Group

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural village located in the Battambang province’s Bovel district, Dy is aged 39 years and married with two children. For the last two years, she has been farming rice to support her family. With the current business, she can earn about KHR40,000 per day and can save about KHR15,000 each day for the future needs.
Dy is just with VisionFund for this cycle. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to plow the field. She hopes to earn more crops so as to make a living.

loans.use: To plow the field

loans.name: Dialuz Del Carmen

texts.es:
Dialuz, de 47 años de edad es comerciante de productos comestibles, abarroterias, granos básicos y mercadería en general, con esta actividad ha sacado adelante su familia, pues ella ha sido padre y madre para sus tres hijos quienes ya son mayores de edad e independientes, se siente orgullosa de haberles inculcado los valores humanos que hoy ellos ponen en practica en su propia familia.  

Con tanto esfuerzo la Sra. Dialuz tiene su vivienda propia, aunque con algunas mejoras que hacerle, esta vez lo que mas necesita es hacer el sumidero desea comprar cemento, piedras canteras hierro y pagar mano de obra para dar inicio a esta obra.

Luego con otro crédito que solicitara a Kiva nuevamente, pretende completar la mejora instalando el inodoro en el interior de la vivienda, ya que ella por sus ingresos no podrá hacer las mejoras de un solo y prefiere ir por parte para poder cumplir con todos sus compromisos y a la vez ir mejorando su calidad de vida.

loans.use: Realizar el sumidero para iniciar la obra que posteriormente le permitirá instalar el inodoro.

loans.name: Horng

texts.en:
Horng, aged 42, is a resident in Battambang province. He is married and has four dependent children, three of whom are still in school while the remaining one is too young to attend school. To make a living, he and his wife sell salted fish, smoked fish and Prohok and work as government officer. Additionally, he provides motorcycle taxi service to supplement income. 
Horng has ever been with VisionFund for six times already and past loans have helped him timely provide his family with basic needs and keep his children in school. Now, he is applying for a loan from VisionFund to buy salted fish, smoked fish, and Prohok to resell. He hopes that he will generate more income to keep his children in school until graduating and to improve family living condition.

loans.use: To buy salted fish, smoked fish, and Prohok to resell to keep children in school until they graduate.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Gladys wants to buy 3 steers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy metal and equipments for his blacksmith business

loans.name: Nudewoso

texts.fr:
Nudewoso G. is a young woman, age 25, who lives in rampant poverty. Trained in the braiding of hair, she struggles a lot but manages ultimately to meet the needs of her family with her meager income. To augment her income, she also sells various items, including fruit. But her very limited financial capacity is the reason for constant inventory shortages. She is requesting a loan of $600 to strengthen her business and to help her family to achieve its potential.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Madame G. Nudewoso est une jeune femme de 25 ans qui vit dans une misère très galopante. Tresseuse de formation, elle arrive difficilement à satisfaire sa famille avec son maigre revenu. Pour augmenter ses revenus, elle a associé à la tresse la vente de divers dont les fruits. Mais sa capacité financière très limitée cause toujours une rupture de stock. Elle sollicite un crédit de $600 qui lui permettra de renforcer ses activités et contribuera à l’épanouissement de la famille.

loans.use: Acquiring fruit to sell

loans.name: Koumédjina E.

texts.fr:
Mr. Koumédjina E. A. was born in 1956 in Afagnan (Prefecture of Lacs). Very early on, he entered the business of transporting people. He obtained his driver's license in 1974 and helped his colleagues work before buying his own vehicle. This vehicle, acquired in 1986, is now very problematic because of its motor. He has in his care ten (10) people, whom he is unable to support due to his current difficulties. With difficulty, the members of his family eat twice a day. He is asking for a loan of $1200 to restore his vehicle, which is the source of his earnings. This way, his family will blossom.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur A. Koumédjina E. est né en 1956 à Afagnan (P/Lacs). Très tôt, il s’est lancé dans le transport en commun de personnes. Il a obtenu son permis de conduire en 1974 et aidait ses collègues à travailler au moment où il n’a pas encore acheté son propre véhicule. Ce véhicule acquis en 1986 lui pose maintenant d’énormes problèmes au niveau du moteur. Il a à sa charge dix (10) personnes qu’il n’arrive pas à supporter avec ses difficultés du moment. Difficilement, les membres de sa famille mangent 2 fois par jour. Il sollicite un prêt $1200 pour remettre en bon état son véhicule qui lui procure le gagne-pain. Ainsi sa famille sera épanouie.

loans.use: To replace his vehicle's motor

loans.name: Gulam Ayesha

texts.en: I live in Multan, a mid-sized city in Pakistan. I am the mother of five children. My husband and I make small carpets on hand looms. This business can yield very handsome profits to us if we can expand the variety, but for that we require a loan of US$ 250. With this loan, we will be able to buy the raw materials that are required in weaving carpets in bulk. We sell these carpets in nearby cities to small expensive stores.

loans.use: Expand carpet weaving business

loans.name: Gualberto

texts.es:
Gualberto works at parties and social events since he has contracts to provide food catering services like buffets and hors d'oeuvre. He lives in the area around Sopocachi and in his godmother's house since she also helps him prepare food. This is the first time he requests a loan, which will be used to pay his rent in Infocal and finish his culinary studies. His employment and experience qualify him for this loan. The income from his business will be used to pay back the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Gualberto trabaja con eventos de fiestas ya que recibe contratos para prepara comida buffet y bocaditos para todo acontecimiento social. Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Sopocachi y es la casa de su madrina ya que con ella trabaja con el negocio de la comida. Es primera vez que solicita un crédito. El monto solicitado será destinado para pago de pensiones en Infocal y así culminar sus estudios como chef. Su trabajo le permite acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia en su negocio, el cual le da ingresos para cubrir el préstamo.

loans.use: finish his culinary studies

loans.name: Rubina's Group

texts.en:
I am Rubina J. and I was born in Lahore, the second largest city in Pakistan. After my marriage, I had to move to a small town, Kot Radha Kishan, with my husband. I am a mother of four: three sons and one daughter. Currently, only two of my kids attend school. My husband raises cows and goats, and he sells goats when they grow to a suitable age and sells cow milk to our neighborhood clients. He needs to buy an additional cow for the business. 

I am a group leader of my group of four entrepreneurs. My group members have always displayed a high degree of cohesiveness among each other and have shown commitment toward group policies and procedures. I feel very happy to have a opportunity to help them. My group members are: Rubina K., who needs to buy goats for her business. Nermala R. needs a loan for her son’s mobile phone store. Koser H. also requires buying a few goats. Lastly, Naseem H. needs a loan to buy goats as well.

loans.use: Buy an additional cow for the business

loans.name: Kwegata Wakimese Group

texts.en:
Roy is 29 years old and married with two children. She has a retail shop. She wants to start up a poultry business with the extra profits.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand her retail shop

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim D. is 37 years old and married with three children.

He sells sheep in the village market of Dogolia in Sierra Leone.

With the previous loan, he managed to earn some profit and purchase three small sheep. Ibrahim is requesting another loan to increase his livestock.

loans.use: Ibrahim needs additional business capital to increase his inventory of livestock for selling.

loans.name: Godfrey's Group

texts.en: Godfrey is really focused. He has had a store in Kiriri for 13 years, where he keeps his maize, beans, and coffee that he has been buying from farmers and sells for a profit. His wife has a retail shop just next to his store. Godfrey is 32 years old and has 4 kids, plus 1 late brother’s daughter whom he looks after. His home is in the village, but he would like to buy another plot and build in the trading center just like his mates, as well as buy a car to help with the transportation of the goods to his store. The produce he buys is seasonal, and now the season is for maize, which he intends to buy in large quantities once given the loan from Kiva.

loans.use: Godfrey plans to buy maize, coffee, and beans for his store to sell, once he is given the loan from Kiva.

loans.name: Davinia Aracelly

texts.es:
Davinia Aracelly is a young woman 27 years of age, who works in the judicial complex. This is her first loan which she seeks to make improvements to her home such as adding a floor and roof as well as some expansion. The house is located in Residencial Bosques de Juigalpan. She is single, does not have children and is well-known throughout the city.

Her monthly salary requires her to turn to a loan to purchase the required building materials which are quite expensive. Her mother is a teacher, and she also tries to help out her family a little.

She is high-spirited and wishes to improve her conditions, and she also conducts jewelry sales to help with the home improvement plans.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Davinia Aracelly es una joven de 27 años, trabaja en el Complejo Judicial, está solicitando su primer crédito para realizar mejoras a su vivienda en el Residencial Bosques de Juigalpan, como es poner el piso y techo a una ampliacion que esta realizando, no tiene hijos, es soltera y muy conocida en esta ciudad. Debido al salario que devenga mensualmente necesita apoyar se con un crédito debido a que los materiales estan sumamente caros, su mamá es profesora y ella ayuda un poco a su familia. Es abogada con alto estpiritu de superacion, ademas de su trabajo en el complejo realiza otra activiad: venta de joyas, para ayudarse en la ampliacion de su casa.

loans.use: Install brick in the interior of her house.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua is 35-years of age and she has been selling plastic containers to enable people store water for use in the various homes in her community. She also sells babies' products like diapers, creams and soaps. Water shortage is very common and the demand for storage containers  is in high demand. Efua is married with 4 children and her biggest dream is to see the children go to university. She will use her loan to buy more plastic containers and increase her business. She is a member of the group called Exodus 14:14. Members agree to support and guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more plastic containers for storage of water

loans.name: Maryam's Group

texts.en:
Maryam baji, wife of H. A., has lived in a small city named Vehari, Pakistan for the last 40 years. Maryam baji has been married for the last 36 years. She is a mother of four children: two sons and two daughters. Her first two sons drive a four-wheel auto-rickshaw. Her first daughter is in 9th standard. Her husband is a washer man. He has been in this profession for the last 5 years. Maryam baji successfully completed her first loan from Asasah, a microfinance institute of Pakistan. Now she is applying for a loan for her sons, who want to repair their auto-rickshaw.

She has been joined in her loan group by a few more members named Khushnood baji, who wants a loan for her motorbikes workshop; Kaneez baji, who wants a loan for her decorative embroidery business; and Tasleem baji, who wants a loan for her grocery shop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia, 38 years old, is married with two kids who are in school. She has been selling grocery products for five years in the town to support her family. She says business is doing well, and she therefore wants to use the loan to buy more products to increase her inventory. Lydia believes this loan would help her increase her savings towards the welfare of her two children, who are in school now. She is a member of the group called ‘Nyame mmere' (meaning, God’s time). Members agree in principle to guarantee for each other to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more grocery products like canned fish and tomatoes, cocoa products, skim milk, body pomade, etc.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is 22 years old. She is the single mother of two children, ages 2 and 4. She currently sells snacks and small food items to her community. Every day, she begins work at 8AM and ends at 5PM. On average, her business can earn a monthly profit of around $20.

In the past, Amina has successfully completed one loan from BRAC Tanzania. Amina used her first loan to expand her business, and is now requesting a second loan in order to expand her stock and customer base.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Soung

texts.en:
Soung V., born in 1961, lives in Kampong Cham with her husband and four children. She works with her husband on the family's farm, making $3-$4 each day together. One of their daughters is employed in a local garment factory, while the other three are currently unemployed. 

Soung is requesting a loan of $1100 to combine with her personal savings to purchase a car which will enable one of her children to operate a taxi service and generate some additional income for the family. Inflation is rising rapidly in Cambodia, and farmers are feeling a great deal of the economic strain. Diversifying the family's sources of income can allow this family to improve its living conditions and get out of poverty.

loans.use: To purchase a car to operate a taxi service

loans.name: Ivonne

texts.es: Ivonne, mujer de armas tomar, se dedica a la venta de juanes y tamales (platos regionales de la selva peruana) en un puesto del mercado de su zona, debido a su buena sazón y atención cuenta con una clientela muy selecta que degustan de sus platos. Se levanta muy temprano a preparar los juanes y tamales, para luego llevarlos a vender en su puesto. Ivonne tiene 45 años, es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos que estudian y son sus ganas de salir adelante. Posteriormente quiere alquilar un local para vender comida regional y desde luego dar una buena acogida a sus clientes, por el momento, requiere de un préstamo para implementar su negocio con todo lo necesario para la preparación de sus platos.
texts.en:
Ivonne is someone who does not mess around. She is dedicated to selling juanes and tamales (regional dishes from the Peruvian jungle) in a stand at the market in her region. Due to her good flavor and service, she works with an exclusive clientele who eat her dishes. She gets up very early to prepare the juanes and tamales and later carries them to sell at her stand. Ivonne is 45 years old and a single mother. She has two children who study and they are her reason for moving forward in her work. Eventually she wants to rent a permanent place to sell her regional dishes and then give her clients a good reception. She now requires a loan to stock her business with everything necessary to make her dishes.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock her business with everything necessary to make "juanes" and "tamales."

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr: Yawa N. est une couturière renommée à Wome, un village du nord-ouest de Lomé, la capitale du Togo. Agée de 39 ans, Yawa est mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Passionnée par son métier, elle cherche à la promouvoir par le  crédit qu’il va bénéficier en achetant une machine  à coudre et aussi des tissus afin de vendre ces derniers à la clientèle.
texts.en:
Yawa N. est une couturière renommée à Wome, un village du nord-ouest de Lomé, la capitale du Togo. Agée de 39 ans, Yawa est mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Passionnée par son métier, elle cherche à la promouvoir par le crédit qu’il va bénéficier en achetant une machine à coudre et aussi des tissus afin de vendre ces derniers à la clientèle.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Acheter une machine à coudre et des tissus pour la revente

loans.name: Anacleto

texts.es:
Anacleto es productor de leche de vaca; como artesano confecciona chamarras y es también transportista inter provincial. Las tres actividades generan su  ingreso con lo que cubre la manutención de sus cinco hijos y esposa. Vive en la comunidad Villandrani Provincia murillo a una hora y media de la ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito lo destinará para incrementar a un dinero que tiene y  comprar  una vaca lechera de mediana  calidad, misma que le ayudará para producir mayor volumen de leche, venderla e incrementar sus ingresos.
 
Este es el segundo crédito con Impro y el buen comportamiento de pago permite aprobarle el préstamo solicitado.
texts.en:
Anacleto is a cow’s milk producer, and he designs and makes jackets like an artisan. He is also an inter-provincial carrier of goods. These three activities generate his income with which he covers the maintenance of his five children and wife. He lives in the community Villandrani, of the Province Murillo, an hour and a half of the city El Alto. He will use the loan to increase the amount of money he has and to buy a milk cow of average quality, which will help him produce a greater volume of milk, to sell and increase his income. This is the second loan with Impro, and his good payment behavior will legitimize the approval of the loan he is currently asking for.

Translated from Spanish by Matt Capetola, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: He will buy a milk cow to increase his production of milk and increase the size of his business.

loans.name: Srieng's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Srieng T. is the group leader for five people who all live in Sram Angkam village in Kampong Cham province. She and her husband, Mr. S. Phorn, are farmers who own a small piece of land where they cultivate rice. In the plantation, they can earn only a little rice revenue, not enough to support the family. In order to improve their living standard, Mrs. Srieng T. decided to ask for a loan to purchase some piglets to start a pig-breeding business.

Mrs. Srieng T. is the mother of five children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while another is a construction worker. Two of her children are attending the local school while the youngest one is too young to work or study. Mrs. Srieng T. did not come to take her loan but her husband did, so he is in the picture instead of his wife.

All the members in this group loan have end-of-term loans so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loans' term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s client make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase some piglets to start breeding pigs

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa B. started her "wailey" meat business 5 years ago in Abuakwa, a suburb of Kumasi, where she lives. Yaa prepares and serves her customers with a very tasty and good quality "wailey" meat and because of that many customers buy from her stand. She is now 40 years old and married with four children, who are all independent.

Wailey, as it is popularly called, is prepared from cow skin. Yaa goes to the butchers and buys the skin and then she roasts it on a fire. It then becomes very hard and it is used to prepared many kinds of our local dishes like okro soup, stew etc. But before you finally consume it, you need to cook it for a long time, otherwise it cannot be chewed. Some say its gives protein and others say that it does not give the body anything. But then, if you consider the number of people who buy wailey, it would amazed you.

Yaa wants to use the loan to increase her stock of assorted wailey meats. This would increase her sales and the income to support her grandchildren and business growth. Yaa belongs to a village bank called ‘Regina’. She would like a loan of GH¢400 to expand her business by restocking her inventory. This would enable her save more to support her husband with taking care of the home.

loans.use: To buy more supplies of "wailey" meat.

loans.name: Tutiniso

texts.ru: Тутинисо женщина 47 лет ,замужем, имеет четверых детей. Уже пятый год занимается бизнесом продажей хозтоваров.Тутинисо полностью своё время уделяет своему бизнесу.У неё договорённость с фирмами которые сами поставляют её товар.В её ассортимент входят вся химия для чистки и уборки дома.Тутинисо планирует взяв кредит увеличить свой ларёк и ассортимент товаров.
texts.en:
Tutiniso is 47 years old, married and has four children. This is her fifth year in the business of selling household products, and she devotes all of her time to the business. She has agreements with delivery companies to bring her products. Among others, her goods assortment includes products for cleaning a house. Tutiniso plans to obtain this loan to expand her store and increase goods assortment.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Household products

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en: Eduardo M., 50, is a retailer and has also produced corn since his marriage. His wife migrated to Riyadh for employment and they mortgaged all of their real estate to support his wife's application to work abroad. He stopped farming and focused on trading to provide for his family needs. Now he is in need of additional capital to purchase grocery items in volume to meet the needs of his customers.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items in volume for trade

loans.name: Santos Angela

texts.es: La señora Santos Ángela M. T., es de 43 años de edad, cuenta con su taller de elaboración de playeras, cuenta con 5 años de experiencia,  con el trabajo que realiza sostiene a su familia ya que su esposo no los ayuda a sufragar los gastos de la familia, señora emprendedora reconocida en su comunidad amable y responsable, la cual en la actualidad  requiere de incrementar su capital, en donde se acerco a la asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo para poder ampliar su taller y cubrir un pedido de playeras y con ello podrá mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Mrs. Santos Ángela M. T. is 43 years old and has a shop where she has been making t-shirts for 5 years and with this work supports her family as her husband doesn’t help defray the household expenses. She is a hard-working businesswoman known in her community as being friendly and responsible. She needs to increase her capital so she has approached ASDIR to ask for a loan to be able to expand her shop and cover and complete an order of t-shirts with which she will be able to improve her living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Materials to make t-shirts

loans.name: Munafa Group

texts.en:
This is a picture of Caroline A. Makeku, Fatmata K., Ramatu K. and Seinya K.. They named their group Munafan. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are requesting from SMT/Kiva. Each of them is requesting a loan of $160. With this loan, they will be able to increase the sizes and qualities of their businesses and consequently make better profits and improvements on their standards of living. 

Caroline A. M. (left) is the leader of this group. Caroline is forty-four years of age. She was born in Bonthe, southern Sierra Leone. She is a widow with three children. One of her children is in Senior Secondary School II (SSS II), the other in Junior Secondary School III (JSS III) and the other is in class IV. Caroline sells cakes. With this loan, she will buy sugar and a bag of flour. Caroline has been in this business for over twenty years now. This business remains her only source of income.

loans.use: To buy sugar and flour

loans.name: Elvis

texts.en:
Greetings from Elvis R., a 27-year-old single man in Gasabo District, Kigali city.

Elvis has two dependents to care for, 11 and 9 years old. He owns a shop where he and his one employee sell many kinds of things. He is seeking his first loan of 500,000 Rwandan Francs.

Elvis has worked in the same kind of business for 3 years. He works every day from 6:00 a.m. to 10:00 p.m. and earns approximately US $145 per month. He wants to use the loan to increase his stock of merchandise. Elvis intends to reinvest the increased profit in his business.

loans.use: Increase store inventory

loans.name: Doris Jovita

texts.es:
Doris es socia del Banco Comunal Unión II.
Doris es casada, tiene 55 años y 1 hijo, Doris tiene un carro con el cual realiza transporte urbano en la ciudad D. Ayacucho, tiene un personal encargado D. conducir el carro. Además Doris es docente y trabaja en un centro educativo en la ciudad D. Ayacucho.
Doris necesita un préstamo D. 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. llantas y para el mantenimiento del carro.
Doris sueña con que sus hijos sean profesionales, mejorar su negocio y ahorrar mas.
texts.en:
Doris is a member of the community bank, Unión II. Doris is married, is 55 years old, and has a son. Doris has a car with which she provides transportation in the city of Ayacucho. She is personally in charge of driving the car. In addition, Doris is a teacher and works in an educational center in the city of Ayacucho. Doris needs a loan of 3000 PEN, which will be invested in purchasing tires and maintaining the car. Doris dreams that her children will be professionals, will improve her business, and will save more.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tires and to maintain her car

loans.name: Chale Muamuma

texts.pt:
Chale M. Camisa
Localização: Boane
Actividade: Habitação – Compra de material de construção 
Empréstimo: 10,500.00MT
Início: 19/05/2009
Período de pagamento: 16 meses

Chale de 48 anos nasceu em Mopeia, Província de Cabo Delgado, estudou até sexta classe. Casado maritalmente com seis filhos, um maior e outros são menores, todos vão a escola.
Veio de Mopeia para Boane em missão de serviço e quando reformou decidiu fixar-se definitivamente no distrito de Boane. 
Para além da esposa e filhos, vive também com sua mãe. 
É carpinteiro de profissão e conta com ajuda de dois empregados. Produzem artigos mais solicitados pelos clientes, maioritariamente bases de camas e portas.
É segundo empréstimo com Hluvuku, tendo o primeiro sido aplicado para legalização do terreno no qual ele pretende iniciar a construção de uma residência familiar com melhores condições.
texts.en:
Chale, 48 years old, was born in Mopeia, Cabo Delgado province. He studied at school until grade six. He is married with six children, one has reached his majority, the others are minors, and all go to school. He went from Mopeia to Boane for his military service, and when he was discharged he decided to stay permanently in the Boane district. In addition to his wife and children, he also lives with his mother. By profession, he is a carpenter and he has the help of two employees. They produce the articles most requested by their customers, mostly bedsteads and doors. This is his second loan with Hluvuku. He applied the first to register his title to the land on which he plans to begin construction of a family home with better living conditions.

Translated from Portuguese by Heidi Petersen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials to build family home

loans.name: Leonilde

texts.en:
Leonilde D. G., 54, is originally from Chidenguela, but currently resides in Boane. She is divorced and is the mother of three children aged 25, 29, and 31. She is also responsible for two nephews who live with her.

Leonilde runs a small store that sells various products. She has one employee. Her best selling products are fish and crackers. With this loan she hopes to be able to introduce new products to her store. This will be Leonilde's first loan with Hluvuku. She is interested in taking out further loans in the future to help remodel her home.

loans.use: adding to her inventory

loans.name: Bahtiyor

texts.ru: Бахтиёр 1983 года рождения, неженат. Имеет высшее образование. Он готовит шашлыки и продает. Семь лет назад работал в одном из баров официантом.  Со временем научился как готовить и решил открыть свое дело.  В настоящее время у него много клиентов особенно в обед. Он готовит разные шашлыки из мясо  баранины, говяжий, шашлыки из печени и шашлык  фаршем. Таким образом ему удается продать 100 палочек шашлыка. Особенно по воскресеньям и праздничные дни. Кредит получает  с 2007 года, что позволило ему улучшить свое  рабочее место .
texts.en:
Bahtiyor was born in 1983. He is single. He has a higher education. He cooks kebabs and sells them. Bahtiyor worked as a waiter at one of the bars seven years ago. With time, he learned how to cook and decided to open his own business. Currently, he has many customers, especially during lunch. He makes various kebabs from lamb, beef, liver and ground kebab. Thus, he is able to sell 100 sticks of kebab, especially on Sundays and holidays. Bahtiyor has been obtaining financing since 2007, which allowed him to improve his workplace.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of products

loans.name: Sang

texts.en:
Mrs. M. Sang, 34 (pictured with her son), lives along National road number 1, about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh. She has been married since 2000. She has four sons: one attends school and other three are still young and stay at home.

M. has been growing rice and vegetables for 7 years. Her husband, Mr. Sarith Vit, 29, has been a fisherman for 7 years. He catches fishes from the lake nearby his house. M. is asking for her first loan of $500 to purchase a boat for her husband’s fishing business and for growing vegetables.

loans.use: To purchase a boat for her husband’s fishing business and for growing vegetables

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
Felix is 28 years old and owns a retail kiosk in Mukuru slums of Nairobi. Felix has been in this business for 5 years. He has requested his second loan of Ksh. 60,000 to increase his stock of flour, soda, rice and start selling cereals after successfully completing a first loan of Ksh. 30,000. He would like to own two supermarkets away from the slums one day.  He desires to educate his children to the highest level and buy his family a home and real estate investment away from Mukuru slums. Felix describes himself as hardworking and industrious. 


Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Add stock

loans.name: Brigida

texts.es:
Brígida está casada, vive con su esposo y sus hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace un año tiene un restaurante de comida oriental, puesto que después de más de 10 años de experiencia en diversos negocios, ha decidido que ésta es la mejor opción para generarse mejores recursos económicos. Para ello, todos los días su esposo y sus hijos la apoyan en la atención de establecimiento, mientras ella prepara los alimentos, combinado finamente los ingredientes adecuados a fin de que los platos sean exquisitos. Ahora Brígida ha decidido implementar y mejorar la decoración de su local; por otro lado, su deseo a futuro es tener un restaurante campestre para que ofrezca sus comidas a los turistas. 
Esta es la segunda vez que  está solicitando un préstamo con MFP y se siente muy a gusto de ser parte de su banco comunal porque le permite tener ahorros. El dinero que ahora viene solicitando será destinado a la compra de utensilios para su restaurante, además de manteles nuevos e ingredientes (arroz y condimentos) en grandes cantidades.
texts.en:
Brígida lives with her husband and their children in her own house. She has had an oriental food restaurant for one year. After having over ten years of experience in various businesses, she decided that her restaurant was the best choice to generate income. Everyday her husband and children help her take care of the establishment while she prepares the food. She carefully combines the ingredients to make her dishes exquisite. Now Brígida has decided to set up and improve the decoration of her business. Her future wish is to have a countryside restaurant so that she could sell her food to the tourists. This is the second time she has asked for a loan from MFP. She feels very good being a part of her community bank because it allows her to have savings. The money she is now asking for is to buy utensils for her restaurant. She will also buy new tablecloths and ingredients (rice and condiments) in large quantities.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy utensils and ingredients for her food

loans.name: Hard Working Group

texts.en:
These are members of the Hard Working group. They are small scale businessmen in Magburaka town, in northern Sierra Leone. They are requesting a loan of Le 500,000 for each to enable them improve their businesses. With a loan, they will be able to add more goods into their businesses, make more sales and better profit. Consequently, their living standard will improve so that they can better look after themselves and children. 

The leader of this group is Foday T. (left). He was born in Magburaka town and is now twenty-five years old. He is married with two children – one in nursery and the other is still suckling. Foday is a driver; he has been in this profession for four years now. With this loan, he will use it to buy tires and sell to fellow drivers.

loans.use: Buy tires to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buying fertilizer

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 39 years old and she is married without children. She produces and sells ice blocks at retail prices to her customers. She is a friendly and happy woman and uses her friendly skills to attract more customers to her stall.

Betty hopes for the loan of N160,000 to purchase an ice-block-making machine to enable her to produce more ice blocks to sell. She is indeed grateful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase an ice-block-making machine

loans.name: The Light Of God Group

texts.en:
Kate is a 53 year-old married mother of three children. All her children are adults except the youngest who is still in school. To support her household, she has been selling cereals such as local rice and maize in the community market to her loyal customers. She says selling these products is very lucrative and she has been in business for twenty years now. With her rich experience in selling, she is very popular in the areas where she trades her goods. She takes delivery of stock from the farming communities and this prevents her from using intermediaries who sell to her at higher prices. Therefore, she wants the loan to expand her inventory to enable her to make a good income to support her family especially the one in school. She hopes to repay the loan in time.

Kate is the leader of a trust bank group called "The Light of God". She is the one standing second from left in the group photograph. The members of this group are petty traders, food vendors and farmers. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and peer pressure to repay the loan. The group will be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy more bags of cereals.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is 58 years old. She is married and has five children. She is really industrious and she works with the motivation of supporting her children’s education to provide them with a better opportunity in life in the future. At the moment, only her last child is in school.  The rest have completed school and are working. She is a trader and trades in pepper, cooking oil and rice. She wants to use the loan to buy more bags of rice, cooking oil, and pepper to increase her stock of goods.

loans.use: To purchase foodstuffs in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy shoes, creams, lotions and childrens' clothes

loans.name: Ulziibat

texts.en: Ulziibat P. is a 47-year-old single mother of four children, three sons and one daughter, and lives with them in Bayanhongor, one of Mongolia's western provinces. Her only daughter goes to a secondary school. Her oldest son is 25 years old and drives a truck for a local gold-mining company. Her second son is disabled and stays home. Her youngest son is just four years old and stays home to help his disabled brother. Ulziibat has gone into business to earn money to feed her children. She ran small cafeteria with a relative beginning in 1998, renting out a small stall close to the local market and offering various dishes mostly for lunch. However, in 2008, she had to go into business selling coal and wood by the bag. Because the temperature drops as low as -40 Celsius in winter, every family needs coal and wood to heat their home.  She has applied for a loan to buy more coal and wood to sell to her customers.

loans.use: to buy more coal and wood to sell to her customers

loans.name: Ifeoma

texts.en: Ifeoma is 32 years old. She is an Igbo by tribe but she lives in Benin City, Edo State. She is married to a commercial driver and they have four children. Three of her children are in nursery and primary school, while her eldest child just gained admission into secondary school. Ifeoma owns a grocery store where she sells drinks and groceries such as biscuits, wine, noodles, candies, and body and hair creams. She is requesting a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more groceries and drinks to sell. She hopes to own a supermarket in the future. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and drinks to sell

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is 26 years old and is married with two children aged 2 and 4 years. She and her family live in Nyabihu, a region of Gisenyi located in the Western Province of Rwanda. In this area, Fatuma sells secondhand clothes and the hours of her business are from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. every day.

Fatuma is requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to expand her business through purchasing more styles of clothes, especially those styles liked by young people. Fatuma hopes that once she adds those styles, the number of her customers will increase as well as her profits. With those profits, Fatuma will continue building a secure future for her family.

Fatuma is a hardworking businesswoman who uses her leisure time in socializing with her family.

loans.use: To buy additional styles of used clothes to sell

loans.name: Jesus Jaime

texts.es: El señor Jesús Jaime M. es casado con la señora Sonia Guadalupe Montalvo, padres de familia de 2 pequeñitos, ellos hace 5 años emprendieron por si solos un negocio de venta de barbacoa todos los fines de semana, ya que a dicho negocio se dedica toda la familia, por tal motivo tienen la experiencia de la elaboración y sus clientes los prefieren, en este momento están tramitando un crédito para la compra de  ollas, materia prima,para la elaboracion y venta de su barbacoa. Para la inversión a su negocio y obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Jesús Jaime M. is married to Sonia Guadalupe Montalvo and they are the parents of two little children. Five years ago they started a week-end barbecue business on their own since the entire family is in the barbecue business. Therefore, they have experience in making it and their customer prefer them. They are negotiating funding to buy pots and ingredients for barbecue to invest in their business and earn higher profits.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Nuestra socia  Gladys,  pertenece al banco comunal  pertenece al banco comunal  “Los solidarios”, nuestra socia está ubicada en la provincia D. Urubamba ubicada en el departamento D. Cusco a 1 hora D. la ciudad del Cusco

Nuestra socia tiene 39 años D. edad, la socia es madre soltera, y tiene 4 hijos D. 17, 15, 10, 7; Nuestra socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, La socia antes vendía ropa, viajaba mucho para traer ropa al por mayor D. Juliaca y D. Lima, y el año pasado decidió cambiar D. trabajo y abrió su propio bar restaurante, ella misma cocina y cuida cada detalle D. sus negocio, la socia solicita el dinero para comprar gaseosas y algunas cervezas pequeñas.

Nuestra socia agradece  la oportunidad brindada y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
Our member Gladys, belongs to the communal bank “Los solidarios”. She lives in the province of Urubamba, located in the department of Cusco, 1 hour from the city of Cusco.

Our member is 39 years old. She is a single mother and she has 4 children, ages 17, 15, 10 and 7. Our member alternates her household activities with retail sales. Before she sold clothes and was traveling a lot to Juliaca and Lima. Last year she decided to change jobs and she opened her own restaurant-bar. She cooks and takes care of each detail of her business. She is requesting the money in order to buy soft drinks and some small beers.

She is grateful for and values the opportunity offered to her through this resource and she promises to repay her loan on time.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Jackson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy soft drinks and some small beers

loans.name: Kumushay's Group

texts.ru:
Герои нашей истории – жители города Балыкчи. Они неустанно прикладывают огромные усилия, чтобы вести достойную жизнь. Некоторые из них являются единственными кормильцами своих семей. Алиева Кумушай – лидер группы. Кумушай – мать троих детей: двоих сыновей и одной дочери. Все дети учатся в ВУЗах и на плечах Кумушай и её мужа лежит огромное бремя платить контракт за обучение троих детей. Чтобы дать детям образование, в 2001-году Кумушай получила кредит в сумме пяти тысяч сомов ($100), и начала торговать штучными товарами (семечками, жевательными резинками, конфетами и т.д.) в магазинчике, который она вместе с мужем открыли возле своего дома. Кумушай очень повезло, так как магазинчик находился вблизи от школы. Торговля пошла довольно бойко, и вскоре им удалось увеличить товарооборот до двадцати тысяч сомов ($450). Сейчас чистая прибыль от продажи составляет от пяти до шести тысяч сомов ежемесячно. Сейчас торговлей занимаются в основном её муж и дочь. Сама же Кумушай устроилась реализатором в аптеку напротив поликлиники и получает зарплату в размере четырёх тысяч сомов ($90). Кумушай понадобились средства для увеличения товарооборота и ассортимента товара в их магазине. И с этой целью она и обратилась за этим кредитом.  
Партнёры по группе:

Байчороевой Элмиресорок пять лет. Муж Элмиры работает охранником. У Элмиры трое детей. Двое из них учатся в университетах. Сама Элмира работает поваром в кафе. Элмире нужен кредит, чтобы погасить задолженность за обучение сына. Сын учится в юридической академии на первом курсе.

Бектургановой Бурулуш пятьдесят четыре года. Она – мать двоих детей. Дети уже выросли и сами зарабатывают себе на жизнь. Сын занимается перепродажей скота, а сама Бурулуш изготавливает национальные изделия на заказ. У неё имеются постоянные клиенты.Бурулуш нужен кредит, чтобы помочь сыну купить несколько баранов для перепродажи.

Дюшенову Рахатбеку тридцать пять лет. Жена Рахатбека является домохозяйкой и поэтому поиском пропитания занимаетс я в основном муж. Рахатбек занимаетс я фермерским хозяйством. Покупает скот, откармливает и перепродаёт. Рахатбек обратился за кредитом, так как хочет приобрести бытовую технику. 

Жакыбалиеву Алмазу тридцать два года. У Алмаза один шестилетний сын. Алмаз, чтобы прокормить семью таксует по городу на своей машине и ему удаётся заработать около пяти – шести тысяч сомов в месяц. Сейчас Алмазу нужен кредит, чтобы отремонтировать машину. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
The heroes of our story are citizens of the town of Balykchi. They consistently put forth huge efforts in order to lead a decent life. Some of them are the only providers for their families. Kumushay A. is the leader of the group. She is a mother of three children: two sons and one daughter. All of the children attend universities, and the huge burden for paying their education contracts lies on the shoulders of Kumushay and her husband. In order to provide the children with education, Kumushay took out a loan in the sum of five thousand som ($100) in 2001 and started selling various goods (seeds, chewing gum, candy, etc.) at a store that she opened together with her husband near their home. She was fortunate to have the store near a school. The sales were very good, and soon Kumushay and her husband were able to increase the goods turnover to twenty thousand som ($450). Their current net monthly profit from the sales is from five to six thousand som. Her husband and daughter primarily work at the store now. Kumushay found a salesperson job at a pharmacy opposite a hospital and receives a salary in the sum of four thousand som ($90). She needed means to increase goods turnover and merchandise variety at their store. This is why she requested this loan. Her group partners are: Elmira B. is forty-five years old. Her husband works as a security guard. Elmira has three children, two of whom attend universities. Elmira works as a cook at a café. She needs a loan in order to repay a debt for son’s education. Her son is in his first year of a law academy. Burulush B. is fifty-four years old. She is a mother of two children. The children are already grown and earn their own living. The son is involved in livestock sales, and Burulush makes national goods to-order. She has consistent customers. Burulush needs a loan to help her son buy several sheep for resale. Rahatbek Dyushenov is thirty-five years old. His wife is a homemaker, and this is why he is mainly responsible for supporting the family. Rahatbek is involved in agriculture. He buys livestock, fattens it and resells it. He requested this loan because he wants to purchase household appliances. Almaz J. is thirty-two years old. He has one six-year-old son. In order to provide for his family, Almaz provides taxi services throughout the town using his own car. He is able to make around five-six thousand som per month. Almaz needs this loan in order to repair his car.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing goods turnover and merchandise variety

loans.name: Ndolo

texts.en: Ndolo S. is 39 years old and makes a living selling clothes. His business is located at Gikomba, a very busy open air market in Nairobi. He has been in business for the last 10 years and reports that profits are strong. However, he says that customers want more choice because many sellers in this market offer similar items. He works very hard at his business so that he can take care of his four children, and is humble, caring and hardworking. Ndolo has applied for a loan of Kes 60,000 to buy a motor bike to transport clothing to different parts of town.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to transport clothing around town

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua S. prepares 'Fante kenkey' for sale at Akotokyire. Ekua is a widow who has six dependents to take care of. She attended junior high school. Ekua has been selling 'kenkey' (maize dough) and supplying it to her customers for some time now. She is responsible for paying school fees, utility bills and other family expenses. Her loan will be used to buy more maize to prepare 'Fante kenkey' for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to buy a piece of land.

In her hands are a few 'kenkey' balls to show how it looks. The food is well protected and preserved in a plantain leaf which turns blackish after boiling. 'Fante Kenkey' can keep for more than two days without going bad.

loans.use: buy more maize to prepare 'Fante kenkey' for sale

loans.name: Eddy

texts.en:
Eddy is an individual loan client with Esperanza and his story is representative of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) generally. He is located in the rural areas surrounding El Seibo, an agricultural area where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. He makes his home in a simple structure with his long term partner and their three children.

Eddy is excited to be taking his first loan with Esperanza and he is excited to grow his business. He plans to use this loan to invest in his business, raising animals by purchasing young goats, pigs and chickens that he will look after. He will use the profits to invest in school supplies for his children and a motorcycle to facilitate his business. He thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: Chickens, pigs and goats

loans.name: Lakk's Group

texts.en: This group loan consists of five people who live in Deum Kor village in Kandal Province, led by Mrs. Lakk M., who sells pillows door to door to support her family. Since her business is going well she wants to expand it and so is seeking a loan to buy cotton and cloth to make more pillows to sell. Her husband, Mr. Sinat Sen, is a soldier who receives a modest salary. They have three children who are attending local public school.

loans.use: To buy cotton and cloth to make pillows to sell

loans.name: Franklin

texts.en: Franklin C. is from the village of Barangay Roxas, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 41 years old, married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Franklin owns and operates a business operating motorcycle transport services. Franklin has been engaged in his business for over 9 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2009, Franklin joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Franklin has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. Franklin is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase a new engine. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Franklin from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a new engine

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda P. is from the village of Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 39 years old. Imelda is single and has one school-aged child . To make a living, Imelda owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Imelda has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Imelda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Imelda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to  purchase additional products to sell. Imelda is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Imelda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her child. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Aïssatou

texts.fr: Aïssatou D. est une femme de 48 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du banc Villageois d PAKOUR de le 30 décembre 2008 et y a reçu 05 prêts qu'elle a toujours remboursés sans difficulté. Elle développe un petit commerce de tissus, elle s'approvisionne dans la ville de Tambacounda, environs à 200 kilomètres et revend dans son village. Ce prêt lui permettra d'augmenter la quantité de tissus qu'elle achetait et prétendre à plus de bénéfices afin de mieux participer à la prise en charge de la famille, par exemple la nourriture, la santé, l'habillement et la scolarité.
texts.en:
Aïssatou D. is a married, 48 year-old woman who is responsible for the care of two children. She has been a member of the Pakour Banc Villageois since December 30, 2008. She has repaid her previous five loans easily. She has a small fabric business. She stocks up in the city of Tambacounda, about 200 kilometers away, and then sells her products in her village. This loan will enable her to increase the amount of fabric that she buys. She aspires to increase her revenues to help meet the family's expenses for food, health, clothing and schooling.

Translated from French by Joanne Archambault, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her ability to self-finance

loans.name: Perlicana

texts.en: Perlicana V. is from the village of Gappal, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 35 years old and is married with three school-aged children. Perlicana owns and operates a general store, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over fifteen years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Perlicana joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her second from ASKI. Perlicana plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Marcosa

texts.en:
Marcosa B. is from the village of Pagalungan, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 55 years old. Marcosa is married and has 9 adult children. To make a living, Marcosa owns & operates a business making & selling food, primarily snacks & other delicacies in the local community. Marcosa has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Marcosa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Marcosa is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make the products that she sells. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Marcosa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

location.town: Pagalungan, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Help Yourself Group

texts.en:
Mary N., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Help Yourself. Mary is 46 years old, married and has five children who range from 12 to 23 years old. 

She was not able to attend school due to lack of financial support. 

For 10 years, she has been manufacturing and selling “iron soap,” a locally manufactured soap, in Rehabilitation Community, on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia.

She plans to use her 8,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 40,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more gallons of the red oil and caustic materials used in the production process. 

She describes herself as humble and easy-going.

Her goals are to improve her business and continue to support her children so that they can have a better future.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Oretha's picture is inset at lower right because she was absent during disbursal.

loans.use: To buy more gallons of red oil and caustic materials used in the production process of soap

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua N. is married and has one child. Ekua sells 'kenkey' (fermented maize dough) and cassava at Elmina. She has been through junior high school. Ekua uses her income to pay utility bills as a way of helping her husband support the family. Ekua will use the loan to purchase additional bags of maize to produce 'kenkey' and to distribute to her demanding customers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ekua plans on plowing the proceeds back into her business.

loans.use: purchase additional bags of maize to produce  'kenkey' and to distribute

loans.name: Solid Teachers Development Initiative-Mityana Group

texts.en: Patrick K. is a teacher by profession and belongs to the solid teacher’s development initiative group-Mityana. He started teaching last year after graduate school. Patrick describes himself as calm, collected, forthright and pro-active. These are virtues he says jump started his progress in the teaching business. He teaches mostly in schools around Kikumbi-Mityana. Patrick, who comes across as a jolly and humorous gentleman, also sells cash crops like coffee and maize to supplement the relatively paltry remuneration he gets as a teacher. In a week, out of his cash crop sales his reckoning is that he makes 40,000 shillings. Patrick has no children and is still single but prefers not to divulge his age, insisting he is an adult and that is what matters. With this loan he says he wants to purchase a cow. With this cow he says he will be able to get milk that he will sell and presumably if the cow gives birth to other calves he will be able to plan to sell them when they grow so as to expand on his business profits.

loans.use: The purchase of a cow.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn R., aged 34, is a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Elmer R. Sr., a buy and sell agent and business partner. She is the mother of four children, one of whom is already in high school while the other three are currently enrolled in elementary. By the grace of God, Roselyn has managed to support her children's schooling. At this time, she is working hard to be able to send all of her children all the way through college. This is a dream for most Filipino parents like Roselyn as she herself has been a college undergraduate and believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents could leave to their children.

Roselyn operates a buy and sell business. What she basically does is buy general merchandise from wholesalers and sell them piecemeal with a little profit. Products can range from furniture to household appliances, electronic devices, clothing and other such products. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options offered. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 300 in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a PHP 14,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy greater quantity and more variety of products to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.
  
Roselyn dreams of being able to give all her children a good, high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She also hopes to have her house renovated by the end of the year. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy more products to expand her inventory

loans.name: Jessica Tatiana

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Cevallos de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Damas De Éxito, esta es una zona urbano marginal muy poblada en esta ciudad.

Aquí encontramos a la señora Jessica, ella tiene 32 años de edad, está casada y tiene una hija de 5 años de edad la cual está en el primer año de educación básica, su marido realiza transporte escolar en su carro.

Se dedica al comercio, arrienda un local en el centro de la ciudad de Portoviejo donde vende zapatos de niñas, nos cuenta que ya son tres años que lleva en este negocio y que gracias  a Dios le ha ido bien, trabaja todos los días desde las 8am hasta las 18h00, cuenta con la ayuda de una ayudante a la cual ella le paga un sueldo. Su mercadería la compra en Guayaquil y también le traen del Perú.
  
Este crédito es para viajar a Guayaquil este fin de semana a traer más zapatos de niñas.  Es socia de la Fundación Espoir desde el año 98 pero se cambio a este Banco Comunal hace 2 años y está muy conforme aquí ya que las socias son muy cumplidas y responsables.
 
Sus sueños son tener su propio local y ahorrar lo que paga en arriendos.
texts.en:
The 'Damas de Éxito' (Successful Ladies) community bank meets every two weeks in the Cevallos neighborhood of the city of Portoviejo.  This is a very densely-populated, marginal, urban area of the city.

Here we find Jessica who is 32 years old, married and has a 5 year old daughter who is in her first year of elementary school.  Her husband buses children to school in his car.

Jessica is a merchant.  She rents her business premises in Portoviejo city center where she sells children's shoes.  She says that she has been in her business for three years and, thankfully, it has done very well.  She works every day from 8.00am to 6.00pm.  She has help from an assistant to whom she pays a salary.  She buys her goods in Guayaquil and also gets them in from Peru.

This loan will be used to travel to Guayaquil this weekend to buy more children's shoes.  She has been a member of Fundación Espoir since 1998 but she moved to this community bank 2 years ago and is very happy here since the members are very punctual and responsible.

Her dreams are to have her own premises and save what she pays in rent.

loans.use: To buy children's shoes

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es: MARIA TERESA Y. I.  TIENE 52 AÑOS CASADA VIVE CON SUS CUATRO HIJOS TODAVIA SOLTEROS Y ESTUDIANTES. VIVE EN CASA PROPIA.ELLA TIENE UNA AMPLIA EXPERIENCIA DE SU NEGOCIO COMO COMERCIANTE, SU TIENDA ESTA UBICADA EN UN LOCAL EN SU CASA DESDE HACE 15 AÑOS. TERESA  ATIENDE SU NEGOCIO Y CON SU  CALIDO TRATO A SUS CLIENTES LOGRA QUE LOS MISMOS LA VISITEN DE NUEVO TAMBIEN POR SU AMPLIO SURTIDO DE PRODUCTOS DE COMESTIBLES  COMO AGUAS GASEOSAS, AZUCAR, MAIZ, FRIJOL ES POR ESO QUE HA TENIDO ÉXITO Y HA LOGRADO AGRANDAR SU PUESTO. GRACIAS AL CREDITO ANTERIOR LOGRO MONTAR OTRO NEGOCIO Y DESEA OTRO CREDITO PARA SURTIR SU NEGOCIO CON OTROS PRODUCTOS DE COMESTIBLES  QUE SUS CLIENTES LE PIDEN, ELLA HA TRABAJADO MUCHO POR SALIR ADELANTE  Y TIENE VARIAS METAS COMO POR EJEMPLO  SEGUIR AYUDANDO A SUS HIJOS CON SUS  ESTUDIOS.
texts.en: Maria Teresa Y. I. is 52 years old.  She is married and lives with her four children who are still single and students.  She lives in her own home.  She has a lot of experience in her business as a saleswoman.  She has run a store in her own home for the past 15 years.  Teresa serves in her store and through her warm dealings with her customers she has managed to get them to visit her over and over.  These repeat visits are also due to the wide selection of food products she provides such as water, soda, sugar, corn and beans.  This is why she has been successful and has managed to expand her business.  Thanks to her previous loan she managed to set up another business and she would like this other loan to be able to stock her business with more food products which her customers are asking for.  She has worked hard to get ahead and has several goals such as, for example, to continue helping her children with their studies.

loans.use: To buy food products

loans.name: Liz

texts.es: Liz tiene 22 años, vive con su esposo y su hija en casa de sus padres. Hace más de 2 años se dedica a la elaboración de fustanes con diseños típicos de su zona, en esta actividad, su esposo también la apoya, aprovechando en sus horas libres. Su trabajo lo desarrolla en un taller que acondiciono dentro de su casa, contando con su principal herramienta que es una maquina de coser. Una vez realizado los trabajos, los lleva a vender en las ferias comerciales de la zona rural de su ciudad, lugares donde recibe las ganancias esperadas, por ello lo considera bastante rentable esta actividad; y por tal espera comprar nuevas herramientas para agilizar su trabajo y aumentar su producción. Es su primer crédito que tiene con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero. Asimismo agradece a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de materiales para la elaboración de más fustanes.
texts.en: 22 year-old Liz lives with her husband and daughter at her parents' house. For the past two years she has been in the business of making fustanes (a type of traditional skirt) using patterns that are typical of her region. Her husband helps her with the sewing in his free time. She works from a sewing room she set up in her house, and her main tool is her sewing machine. She sells her skirts at commercial and rural public markets. Liz considers her business quite profitable and hopes to be able to buy more machines to increase production. She will us this loan, her first with MFP, to buy more material for making skirts. She is very thankful for the financial support and to all the people who will be managing the loan that will allow her to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy material to make fustanes (skirts) to sell

loans.name: Tilman

texts.es:
Tilman R. es un hombre de 40 años que se dedica a la venta de comidas rápidas y almuerzos en su carruaje llamado "Comidas Rápidas los Reyes" tal como lo muestra en su fotografía; él es casado, vive en el barrio José Antonio Galán de la ciudad de Barranquilla  y tiene 3 hijos en las edades de 11. 15 y 16 años. Su emprendimiento lo inició hace 5 años vendiendo pizza  y gradualmente ha agregado almuerzos, comidas rápidas, bebidas, helado, carne y pollo al carbón.
Desde que está vinculado a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo hace 8 años ha recibido 10 financiamientos y el décimo es justamente su credikiva, con el cual comprará 4 juegos de sillas plásticas y materias primas e insumos para sus comidas; Con su vinculación a esta organización ha mejorado sus condiciones de vida y ha construido su excelente historial crediticio. Su sueño y gran desafío es convertir su negocio en un “Restaurante 5 estrellas” reconocido en todo el Caribe Colombiano.  Tilman es un trabajador incansable,  su negocio  es exitoso en el barrio y reporta una rentabilidad sobre las ventas de un 28%, una liquidez de 43,3%, rentabilidad sobre la inversión es del 25%, tiene una rotación de  cuentas por cobrar de 21 días y una rotación de productos terminados de 5 días. El es fundamentalmente feliz con su familia y sueña con poder ofrecerles un gran porvenir.
texts.en:
Tilman R. is a 40 year old man who sells fast food and lunches in his food stand called "Comidas Rápidas los Reyes" [The Kings Fast Food] as is shown in the picture above. He is married and lives in the neighborhood José Antonio Galán in the city of Barranquilla. He has 3 children, ages 11, 15 and 16. He started his business 5 years ago selling pizza and has gradually added lunches, fast food, drinks, ice cream, grilled beef and chicken. 

Since he has been associated with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo [Mario Santo Domingo Foundation] for 8 years and he has received 10 loans. His tenth loan is actually a Kiva loan, with which he will buy 4 sets of plastic chairs, raw materials and supplies to make his food products. His relationship with this organization has improved his standard of living and has given him an excellent credit history. His dream and great challenge is to convert his business into a 5 star restaurant, known around the Colombian Carribean. Tilman is a tireless worker and his business is successful in the neighborhood. It has a 28% profitability on sales, a liquidity of 43.3%, a return on investment of 25%, a 21-day turnover on accounts payable, and a 5-day turnover on finished products. He is fundamentally happy with his family and dreams of being able to offer them a great future.

loans.use: Four sets of plastic chairs, raw materials and food supplies.

loans.name: Emie Rose

texts.en:
Emie Rose P. is from the village of Carugmanan, Banisilan, South Cotabato. She is 33 years old. Emie Rose is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Emie Rose owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, toothpaste & snack food in the local community. Emie Rose has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Emie Rose joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emie Rose is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell, like food & canned goods. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Emie Rose from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell, like snack food & canned goods

loans.name: James Kasis

texts.en:
James Kasis S. is a 35-year-old man, married to Millicent Chemutai. Together they have four children and live in the Kapomboi area of the town of Kitale. He sells used clothes in the same area. James has been in this business for five years now and gets a monthly income of 15,000 KES.

This will be James's first loan from KADET, and he plans to use the entire loan to buy two bundles of used clothes worth 25,000 KES, to 1,000 KES for transport and 5,000 KES to buy shirts and trousers for resale. 

With the income he is going to get he plans to expand the business by adding more stock and also to buy a plot of land later on. In the future, James wants to be a wholesaler and also to educate his children at higher levels, like taking them to university.

loans.use: To buy more used clothes for resale

loans.name: Engelina

texts.en:
Engelina T. is from the village of Kandiis, Magsaysay, Misamis Oriental. She is 23 years old. Engelina is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Engelina owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and raising pigs and chickens for sale. Engelina has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Engelina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Engelina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell. Engelina is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Engelina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
